author: Aruna K.

description:
Dosa has brunch! Ok, so it's actually a small section on the menu with five options, but they are good options!

THE WAIT: None for four on a Sunday around 12:45pm. 

THE SERVICE: Fine, but our food took an incredibly long time to come out!

THE COST: $144 total for a couple of drinks, 2 starters, 4 brunch entrees.

COCKTAILS
* Kerala Rhum Runner (Batiste Rhum, curried strawberry castrique, crem de violette, aperol, mint, lemon, champagne, tall. $13) - 3.5 stars
Interesting flavors, but this was a bit strong for me! (I asked for a suggestion for a light, refreshing drink.)

STREET FOOD STARTERS
* Sprouted Mung & Paneer Salad (bing cherries, coconut, chile, arugula, orange-cumin dressing. $11.50) - 3.5 stars
Not bad, a nice light starter, but a little bland in flavor.

* Papdi Chaat (crispy wheat crackers, diced mango, avocado, spiced yogurt, mashed potatoes, mint & channa dal crumbles. $6.50) - 3 stars
Basically 4 crackers with mushy guac topped with crumbles. A bit bland. 

MISSION BRUNCH FAVORITES
* Over Easy Uttapam (tomato, onion & chile uttapam topped w/ 2 eggs. $12.50) 

* Lamb Keema Omelette (south india omelet filled w/ minced lamb, peas & diced potatoes. $14.50) - 4 stars
Great texture on the lamb. Light dosa, crisped edges & soft in the middle.

* Egg Dosa (2 eggs spread inside dosa w/ chopped onions, green chiles, gunpowder spice. $12.50 + $2 w/ added cheddar/mozzarella) - 4 stars
Nicely done!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Dosa is pretty upscale and hipster for an Indian restaurant; I didn't see any Indian servers or bartenders when I was there. It felt like the PF Chang of Indian food. But I will say this - I went with an Indian who assured me that the food is authentic and the chef is Indian. He also thinks that this location is better than the Fillmore location. Indian food is one of those cuisines that I know very little about and I was happy to have a "guide" for the evening.

Without reservations on a weeknight, I was first seated at a bar and then I was able to improve our position by moving to a table by the window near the entrance.

We started with the Vada Sambar, which are like little donuts dipped in a lentil based sauce/soup. It reminded me of minestrone and it reminded him of home.

Next, we shared the spicy mung dosas and I realized that I find eating with hands to be as challenging as eating with chopsticks can be for others. I struggled to not make a huge mess or to miss my mouth. I think I failed once or twice. 

We also tried their lamb shank special. It was hearty and ended up being more food than we could finish.

It was a fun evening and DOSA is a comfortable introduction to Indian food for those who are also not too familiar with the cuisine. There are good cocktails as well.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Had heard rave reviews about the place - but food and service ... had better experiences elsewhere  .. the lamb sliders were horribly spicy - meaning have some heat but not such that it burns your palette...
The lamb dosa was much to be desired ... the lamb came separately with a plain dosa... seriously? And the flavors were seemingly forced as the lamb and dosa didn't go well together - mismatched flavors... the seating is much to be desired... we were seated right next to a table of 4 with probably one inch of space between us... server forgot items in the bill - had to be reminded... didn't impress me much..,
author: Sameer B.

description: We will stick to the Fillmore location! This place is set up like a typical Indian restaurant... tables placed where you are fighting for elbow room with the person at the next table. Service is hackneyed and the menu though similar seemed diff... Chef needs to rethink the shredded lamb dish. Fillmore or bust...
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
We come from Houston and Austin, TX  to San Francisco for vacation. We were tired of the mediocre restaurants that we were coming up on as we were rushing in our travels so decided to Yelp and plan out a nice Indian meal. After making the journey and reservations to be seated, we are so satisfied at how authentic and fresh everything we had were. Because every single thing we ordered tasted so well and made so authentic to real Indian cuisine, we deemed this place 5 stars. 

Service was very helpful in making our selections, very knowledgeable and came with the recommendation to everyone to share small dishes so that we can taste as many styles in one sitting. Good advice. 

We had the paper dosa, vada pav (which seemed popular), and uttapum sampler. Paper dosa, incredibly crispy the ENTIRE time. Vada pav, buttery crispy outside with a pleasant cut of sweet chutney. Uttapum, inventively topped with mushrooms (authentic mushrooms of Asia ex. enoki) that compliment so well.  Let me enlighten to those that has not experience indian cuisine in India - In the US, although the dishes can be found, the ingredients from the US are simply different than India. Perhaps a spice would be less potent, the potatoes not as soft and sweet. All of which makes a big difference in the final taste of Indian dishes. Ex. if you mother had a specific brand of peanut butter that she always served, you grow up longing for that familiar taste, smell, and texture. Having a different variety is noticeable when you have eaten it for 20+ years! We are glad to find that this is the first restaurant in the US that authentic, really was authentic down to the spices, saltiness, sweetness of the potatoes, the exact caramelization of onions. 

I encourage you to try this place. It would definitely show what authentic Indian cuisine is like.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Cocktails rotate so they didnt have the one i like. they are back so making overly sweet ones :(

Food: lamb keema sliders, truffle dosa (and lamb if there are more people) but that is all that i should order in the future, and then the rasmalai for dessert and call it a day. I always forget how filling the dishes are and over order. Also, the lamb pepper fry is back but it isn't what i remember it to be - sliders are way better.

Service was extremely slow tonight. Waited 15 mins for them to even get our cards.
author: Laura D.

description: OMG this is our place to go. Definitely the best south Indian food I have ever had in The US. Every time me and my wife visit Bay area we always visit it
author: Kanak S.

description: The ambience was very nice. Out servers were not attentive as others. Based on my experience and first time trying out South Indian food in San Francisco, the food did not taste that exquisite like other south indian restaurant. There were hardly any flavors in our Dosas. The chutney lack texture and spices.
author: David M.

description:
Eugh - this was only ok. Food was fine, service wasn't great. One of our appetisers just never showed up (but did appear on the bill), and a bottle of wine with a cracked top was brought to our table. We noticed the wine bottle (but not after tasting - imagine what *could* have happened!) and it was swapped for a non broken one.

The general feeling was there was no ownership of our table, no one checked on food. 

At the end they did comp the one appetiser we actually were served in lieu of the potential fatal bottle of wine. 

Thank goodness for good company or else it would have been a disaster of an evening.
author: Kathleen G.

description: Amazing fusion of Indian food but terrible and slow service. No wonder parties are dropping off on a Friday night
author: Vaibhav G.

description: Dana is amazing and the food and drinks are stunning. We stopped in as a small progressive craw and everything was amazing! Will be back!!
author: Tyler S.

description: Stopped by here on a chilly day and had the rasam, dosa, and green chicken curry dish to share. Everything was excellent, I'll definitely be coming back again.
author: Anjali P.

description: One of my favorite Indian restaurants in San Francisco. Being vegan I had never been able to have Dosas until I got here. Servers are very knowledgeable and willing to listen and recommend what's best. No exception so far! I like to get there earlier and sit at the bar wit a cocktail, too. There is a full bar! The bar tenders are great and the cocktail suggestions provided on the menu are creative and makes me want to go back to taste each one of them,  one at a time. Ambiance is pleasant although you do get very close to your neighboring table,  especially at a table for two. Wonderful. Highly recommended.
author: Anna P.

description: Hands down the best South Indian food in San Francisco. We've been loyal customers for years and now we enjoy it with our family. They have spicy and non-spicy, so everyone can enjoy depending on their taste. If you like spicy, the habanero mango dosa is the way to go. From the apps menu, bhel, spicy mung salad or avocado chaat are favorites. For non-spicy, try the paper dosa or masala. Great drinks and food in a fun atmosphere - more upscale and hip than traditional Indian.
author: Amisha G.

description:
We have been making plans to come here quite a bit, and finally we managed to come.  Once seated we looked over the menu and they have small plates that range from $5-15, Dosas and uttapan which is similar to a dosa.

We ended up getting a masala dosa, since it's the classic thing to get and we also got the uttapan sampler.  The dosas are pretty delicious in my opinion and full of flavors, however I could've gone without the uttapan and ordered a few small dishes instead.  The uttapan was basically a lentil pancake and they cook them with different veggies like mushrooms and spinach.

 We never had southern Indian food before, so this was definitely a new experience, even though the food was good we were just not too into it.  I would probably come back to try some of the small plates.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
I want to give Dosa 3.5 stars. 
Upscale, hip, non Indian looking restaurant that serves Indian food. On my multiple visits here I have tried a few cocktails - a savory mango cocktail that they had on their specials for lunch and Araam se - in which you pick a spirit and flavor of choice (citrus, fruity, spicy etc) and the bartender makes you a yummy drink.

About food, tried the mysore masala dosa, plain dosa, raita, mini uttapams, dahi vada, egg curry and veg kofta - everything tastes pretty good. I feel like they hold back on the spices though, food is not spicy even when you ask for it. Biggest plus - complimentary fried papads!
author: Reema B.

description:
This is my second time here and I really like it; it's def NOT Indian food, though.

I think the flavors are tasty and they have some unique spins.

Favorite items to note: truffle dosa, beet croquettes, and mushroom/arugula uttapam. Have tried other items from here as well but these were the most memorable.  I sat at a table for my first visit in the Fall and the bar when I went this past weekend. I liked how there was no wait to be seated, considering it was 8:30pm on a Saturday night.  

The bartender was super cool about making sure I liked a wine before getting a glass, so I tried a few and then found one that worked. I like when they're super cool about tastings and knowledgeable based on describing wines I like. 

It's a bit pricey but so are a lot of restaurants in SF.
author: Monica J.

description: Dosas are excellent and spicy, quality is consistently high.  Great for vegans and dosas are gluten free.  A bit pricey and service can be slow sometimes.  We've been in and had part of an order forgotten once, but we've also had excellent service on several visits.
author: Doug G.

description:
great service. although the restaurant needed more employee because it was super busy the employees were efficient and we did not end up waiting for too long. 
the food is southern indian food and is different from the typical indian places. the quality of food however was not the best considering the price if the food. it was heavy and not very fresh.
author: Helia S.

description: Every dish that we ordered was delicious. The food can be quite spicy which is exactly what I love about it. The atmosphere was great and the staff was nice.
author: Corbin F.

description: Met a friend of mine from college here who is Indian and she loves this restaurant! It was suggested by her and she lives in San Francisco. It is southern Indian Cuisine and it is extremely authentic. Will definitely be back
author: Janine S.

description: Flavors and texture are always spot on.  Their drinks are refreshing.  The service is phenomenal.  It's obvious why they have stayed in such a hot market!
author: Ilicia Maxine R.

description:
TLDR: Solid Indian restaurant with a fancier vibe. Restaurant week menu is a TON OF FOOD.

Came here for Restaurant week with 4 friends, and we all opted for the 3 course meal - I also got the wine pairings. At Dosa... the 3 courses are all savory! They are also gigantic, so I couldn't even touch my third course. Got to enjoy that as lunch the next few days!

1. South Indian Cioppino - I wouldn't even call this a cioppino. It was more of a coconut-y seafood soup. The seafood was good, but the broth itself wasn't my favorite. Pretty steep on the normal menu for what it is too ($17).
2. Lamb Keema Dosa - The dosa itself was tasty! The lamb was good, but the chutneys weren't my favorite. After trying all of the dosa restaurants in Sunnyvale, I have high expectations for my chutneys now!
3. Goat Biryani - was wayyy to full at the end of dinner, so saved my Biryani for the next day. I did pick at the crust a little bit though, and it was so delicious. The crust obviously got soggy the next day, but the rest of the dish was amazing. Super tender goat, even after being blasted in the microwave, with the perfect raita.

I'd probably pass on the dosa's at Dosa... get the biryani instead!

Happy Hour goes until 7:00!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Food- 3-3.5
Service- 0

We waited around 15 mins for water or anyone to show up asking if we need anything. When someone finally showed up they had run out of the one dish I wanted. This was at 8 PM. 

The food was decent to good, the prawn masala was quite good. Because we had waited so long for the food, we were running late and decided to do wrap the prawn masala for later. We come home and check the bag and lo- the prawn masala was missing. Only thing which was packed up was the condiments and the dosa. 

So we paid 24 dollars for the prawn dish and ate like 1/4th of it. Thanks- not coming back here.
author: Ramana I.

description:
Dosa! Dosa! Dosa! 

This is a gem of a restaurant off the corner of 21st and Valencia St. in the Mission.

We love Indian food, Southern Indian even better.
This is hands down the best Indian we've ever had. That's saying a lot as we've been to hundreds of Indian restaurants on our travels.

I enjoy the Mission so we always choose this location over the sister restaurant on Fillmore St. (at Post St.), in Japantown/Lower Pacific Heights.
The Mission location is an intimate space with warm colors and low lighting. The bar dominates the space while tables are spread about in a relaxed environment. 
The Fillmore location, which opened later, is a much larger space. I steer clear of any eatery that reminds me of the typical California restaurant, BIG and loud. (Think Cheesecake Factory) To each their own, I say. 

So, onto the review of their namesake, the Dosa, PERFECTION! 
We've tried many of the Dosas and two that stand out are ...
Habanero- Mango Masala - out of this world good, not as spicy as described, I like heat tho. 
The White Truffle Masala - knock your socks off good.

Other items that can be made Vegan, were equally delicious. 

The innovative cocktails were perfectly balanced and yummy. 

We came for the Dosas and returned for the Dosas.

I wonder if I say Dosa out loud three times I'll be transported there, in Dosa nirvana.
author: Brian D.

description: Service is a 3-Star at best. But the 5-Star food makes up for it. Expect to wait a lot and/or aggressively flag wait staff down.
author: Safeer J.

description: This is an amazing place for Indian cuisine. Every dish we ordered was delicious. The place is always busy, but it's easy to find a table. The service is fast, the staff is friendly. I highly recommend this place.
author: James G.

description:
Yuck! I have never !EVER! experienced worse service. I wish I had written down our waitresses name, because in retrospect I would have loved to discuss her future at this establishment with management.

We were treated like animals! Our comrade didn't receive his meal until 35min after we received ours! Talk about faux pas!! When we asked our waitress about the status of our food, she very flippantly brushed us off and we had to wait another 10 minutes!! In addition to this, she never brought me the beer I ordered and asked about THREE times!!

Anyway, I'm unsure if this waitress is the norm here, but I am letting anyone that reads this know, the quality control for service here is very poor. Myself, and anyone I happen to tell this story to will never be coming back. And I eat out ALL OF THE TIME!!
author: Jack T.

description: I had a wonderful dinner here! I tried their avocado grapefruit chaat and it was so satisfying. Not too spicy and so fresh! I tried their lemon beer (I forget the name) and it was delicious. My friend got their Mumbai Felicia cocktail which was so good! Definitely want to go back and try more of their drink selection. Service was wonderful, I spilled my water glass as soon as we sat down and our server was so kind about it! Their chocolate ganache dessert was decadent so definitely give that a try.
author: Kat C.

description:
Its a okay place but I found it to be a bit overrated.  A little too costly for the taste and service (its not really a very high end or a  very fancy place - its a shade above regular street restaurants).  Potion size for certain items was almost a joke! $8 for a single vada-pav( literally single- who serves 1 piece of vada pav!).  Frankly, I would have been okay if you had charged me $12 but given me 2 pieces - but getting a single piece of vada-pav is borderline insulting. 
Probably not going there again.
author: Vivek T.

description: Good food. A little smaller space than the Fillmore one. They have a great menu of cocktails!
author: Hemant J.

description: Their dosas are actually quite good. I shared a masala dosa with my bfan and it was very flavorful.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Nice DOSA place for family. Make sure to reserve the seat in advance. 
Idli fry was killer. The service was good and food tasted great. However, it tends to be noisy at times.
author: Aman C.

description:
I've loved this place for years, but now I'm obsessed. The new brunch menu is on point, from the pani puri to the spicy mung lentil dosa I devoured. Oh ya, and the epic coffee gelato I cleansed my palate with before heading out? Siiiiiiii, senor!

Lassi bar?

Mango mimosa?

Chunky coconut chutney.

Hell ya, get it.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Went to DOSA when I was in the mood for... dosa!  it begins well with the complimentary popadums, all Indian restaurants should do this.
I went with a friend of mine and decided to order a dosa and the shrimp curry.  First of all, in this situation, I would've thought we would get the dosa first, you know, like an appetizer.  Or, maybe we get it with the curry, since there are 2 people and 2 food orders.  But we got the shrimp curry first, which was a very toned down version of a what I would call a curry.  I could hardly taste the curry in the sauce.  It lacks flavor and complexity that a good curry usually has. Then some time later, after we completely finished the curry, we got the paper dosa.  Dosa was good, thin & crispy.  Again, I think you know where I'm going, both the sambar and the potato filling lacks in flavor.
I think this restaurant might be a good intro to Indian food for someone who hasn't tried it much.  It's clean, has good service and nice setting.
author: Dian K.

description:
We, a party of 7 were there last night. The wait was long, the small place was packed, but the hostess graciously made it easier. We were seated after the said wait and food orders were taken quickly.

The menu is very limited, almost one dish each of chicken, lamb, seafood and two types veg entrees, then some dosas & oothappam.. it was a mix of traditional Indian and then a modern take on it. We ordered idly Sambhar and Chennai chicken for starters and  lamb curry, seafood curry, poori chana, masala dosa, paper roast dosa and mushroom arugula oothappam.. all good. The Sambhar was excellent..

Only 3 stars as one of us had an upset stomach next morning. It may be the lamb curry as he was the only one who had that.
author: Ge E.

description:
A bit crowded, but excellent vegetarian options. Enjoyed the Potato Dosa. Would recommend skipping the mushroom uttapan with arugala (too much of a pizza vibe going on).

Tip- make reservations for parties greater than 4 even on weeknights! Such a small venue.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I had the mango dosa which was the best dosa I've ever had. It was very filling because they added a lot of cashews but I'd def get it again. 
The ambiance was also very nice and the service was fast plus the bartender was very friendly.
author: Shrishti B.

description:
By far the MOST PHENOMENAL meal we have had in a long time! The ambiance, the food and the service exceeded every expectation!
Our server Jenny is not only gorgeous but gave us the best service we have ever experienced!
This place is 10  
Thank you Jenny and Dosa for a absolutely wonderful evening
author: Kate G.

description: I was here recently and ordered the Mysore Masala Dosa and it was hands down the best I've ever had before and I've had many Dosas in my 25 years of existence (I'm from South India and eat out quite often). The rest of the menu looks interesting and I look forward to returning soon. Make no mistake, this ain't cheap but if you appreciate good food, you won't be disappointed coming here.
author: Gouthaman K.

description:
This was my first experience with South Indian food and I was completely blown away by Dosa. I have heard rave reviews from friends about this spot but did not even know it was a different style of the "traditional" Indian food that I am used to until coming to the restaurant this past weekend.  Upon entering, we were greeted with a friendly hostess and the amazing smell of Indian spices, a nice comforting feeling on one of those super chilly San Francisco nights.  A party of 4 with no reservation on a Saturday night I was expecting a wait, but we were seated immediately in a booth near the back of the restaurant and quickly greeted by our friendly server.  The server was able to go over the menu and explain the difference between Dosa, Uttapam and some good appetizers to share. 

We started with the Chutney sampler as well as the summer bean Vada.  The Chutney sampler was delicious, crisp little wafers with hidden spices and four different dipping sauces. For main dishes we shared the following: mushroom & arugula uttapam, channa bhatura, white truffle masala dosa, and the spicy mung masala dosa.  All served with some tomato, sambar, and coconut chutneys for dipping.  We all agreed the white truffle masala dosa was the highlight or all the dishes.  The amazing aromas of Indian spices with the white truffle oil was decadent and delicious.  

Dosa has become my new favorite Indian restaurant in town.  This small quaint spot puts out some of the most flavorful dishes in town and can accommodate a lot of dietary needs (vegan, gluten free, etc).  Expect to pay a bit more (~$15 per entree) than some of the other Indian restaurants in town but the price is worth it for the huge portions, great food and all around amazing dining experience. Can't wait to come back to check out the weekday Happy hour drinks and bites!
author: Kelsey B.

description: I appreciate Dosa for bringing South Indian food to the Bay Area masses. This place has both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options and has South Indian staples like dosa and utthapum and North Indian foods like curry and naan. The best thing I've had so far is the spicy mung masala dosa. Flavorful and packed with all that potato goodness. I did have the vada pav as an appetizer during dinner but felt like the portion was too small for the price. Overall, the  menu seems somewhat overpriced. The cocktails are good, but pretty expensive. I paid more for my cocktail than the dosa. I suppose the pricing is typical for the Bay Area and for alcohol in general, but something just feels excessive to me. I will probably return when I crave dosas in the city. The ambience is worth the visit.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Want some tasty South Indian food with lots of spice? DOSA is the place to be! :)

All the dishes I tried here was bursting in flavor with strong spices blended together to form a unique and flavorful experience. When I first saw the chennai chicken placed on our table, I thought it was going to taste bland and average just from looking at it. However, the flavors that come from the crust and the meat make it so interesting and delicious.

Of all the entrees that I had the pleasure of tasting, the best by far had to be the fish curry which I believe to have been a limited time special. The curry was smooth and mild while the fish was cooked in such a manner that it melted in my mouth. The lamb dosa came in at second place with the lamb meet being cooked just right in a blend of spices.
author: Joshua M.

description:
*****Amazing cuisine, delicious cocktails, gluten free heaven!*****

Extensive menu with lots of gluten free, nut free, dairy and vegan dishes. 

The dosa is simply exquisite - right texture, almost melts in your mouth. The cocktails we had were really good as well (the right amount of each ingredient - not too strong). 

Honestly this is one of the best dinner experiences we have ever had! We greatly recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for a good Indian or a nice dinner out.
author: Kimberley C.

description:
This is not DOSA on Filmore. I repeat; this is nowhere near DOSA on Filmore.

Went with a friend for lunch. I ordered Kerala egg curry with Paratha (4.5/5). It was a well-crafted dish.... loved it. But the shocker was the Vegetarian Thali (1.5/5) that my friend ordered. The Rasam may well have been substituted with Tamarind juice. The lemon rice was stale! 

This may still be a good place to go for dinner. But for lunch thalis, you may as well go to Udupi Palace.
author: Ram R.

description: Pretty decent food. Not a big fan of south Indian food but this place is really good. They have some enterprising options on their menu and their cocktails are pretty good. It's a little pricier than the standard Indian cafe's that you may have been to, but the service and ambience is worth the additional price.
author: Varun V.

description:
Came here for a date night.  Intimate space and good service.  The prices are pretty steep though.  We ordered the prawn curry and it came with 5 little shrimp for $26.  There was also barely anything else in the curry to fill you up so it really was not a full entree...unless you eat like a rabbit or something.  What was served was tasty, perhaps a little bit spicy, but it was just way over-priced.

The dosas, of course, are what they are famous for and they are delicious.  We had the pumpkin dosa and it was impressive.  They are large and very dippable and share-able.  They are also served with plenty of different chutneys & sauces to dip the dosa in.  Definitely a must order if you come!
author: Jess Y.

description: This was a really nice restaurant, and a great place to come with friends.  Grab a table by the window if you can.  The chicken curry with lemon rice was amazing- the curry flavors were complex, and the chicken was so moist and delicious.  The beet soup was a melody of flavors, and the scallops were excellent.
author: Laleh J.

description: Went to Dosa with a work buddy from the UK. He  had heard good things about Dosa and wanted to give it a try. And Londoners love their Indian food! First let down of the evening, they didn't have diet cola. All out. Not a big deal, but how does a restaurant run out of soda, when there is a convenience store two doors down? Overall, food was good, but not great. Service was slow. Spicy dishes were not that spicy. My Indian friend from the UK agreed-was pretty disappointed. With so many Indian restaurants to choose from in the city, I would not recommend.
author: John P.

description:
been many times, usually very good. thus 3 stars.
but i had a super disappointing meal last week. 
it's STILL eating at me (no pun intended)
and it was not cheap, $140 for 2

we sat and had mediocre service at the BAR (right?)
they were passive and didnt seem to care much
later, our main dish was forgotten, they realized and fixed it

the food started well: a delicious avocado chopped salad (the dosa i love!)
then crashed:3 bland, underwhelming and misguided dishes followed
including a chicken satay-like dish that tasted like dish water
it was so dull and flat we asked for a sauce to dip it in 
and a arctic char which was a high quality piece of fish, 
but on top of a pasty, canned soup-like curry sauce. 
i tried to push the sauce aside. it was terrible. and $30!

my date and i were in a deep talk so i didnt say anything. 
i really wanted to email the restaurant directly
but there's not email on their site
so here you go, DOSA!

i live 3 blocks away and usually visit often
will not be back for a while :(

feel free to reach out to me DOSA
i'd be very happy to see that you care!
author: Sara S.

description: I visited them recently and tried some of Habanero dosa. It tastes as advertised. Appreciate the they keep the Indian taste and yet serve to western audience.
author: Janani N.

description: Came on a long weekend.. worst service ever.. we waited for food.. beer was not chilled.food is not that great.. there are better places in bay area.. please try them
author: Bibhabari K.

description: One of my all time favorite restaurants in SF. For SF the pricing is reasonable (15 ish per plate) for the ambiance, and the food is spicy, original and has yet to disappoint. I lived in South India for a bit so I have pretty high standards, but I love their fusion take on dosas, and recommend the mango habanero dosa if you have a very high spice tolerance!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Pros:

The lamb chops were amaze! As was the mango lassi and masala dosa!

Cons:

I mentioned that it was my girlfriend's birthday but the server didn't seem to care or acknowledge it in any way. Also, the wait for the food was very long.
author: Brown B.

description: Being Indian, We don't generally go out for any kind of Indian food. But this place is awesome! The food is contemporary and a modern take on mostly South Indian flavors. The Arctic char was especially good and Mysore masala was more on the traditional side but solid. The service was phenomenal and they had recommendations for every thing and the staff asked about our opinion of every thing. We would actually like to take family there. Keep it up Dosa!
author: Ron B.

description: I really love Dosa. Tons of delicious veggie options. Try the Fillmore location for a fancier feel. I prefer this more casual location.
author: tim b.

description:
We came here upon a friends recommendation and was glad we did.  The service impecable!  The food and drinks perfection.  Recommend anyone to try their brunch.  They feature items that feature true southern Indian cuisine.  By the way the full bar also has some enticing beverages.  We did the bottomless mimosas which was truly delicious.  
Strongly recommend trying this one!  I know we will be back!
author: Lonnie W.

description:
Most amazing spread of indian cuisine 
Hard to get a seat so.please always reserve arrive on time 
Close to mission garage parking 
Ideal for dinner any time
author: Kumar R.

description:
Four stars for the white truffle dosa. I loved the filling and the dosa itself. The Sambhar and chutney's not so much. (Have had better chutney's elsewhere)
We also ordered the duck breast uthappam which was supposed to come with pineapple chutney but was instead served with the same Sambhar and chutney's I did not like very much. The four stars are because of the fact that the served us one rasamalai (good!)  to make up for their mistake. So instead of three stars I'm giving them four overall.
author: Amrita G.

description: Its one of the over rated and expensive restaurants. Ambience and experience one u would expect in a fine dining restaurant. Both are missing in this place. Waiters can be nice to you if they think ur worth serving. The dosas that we tried with masala were burnt oneside & doesn't taste authentic.
author: Manii S.

description: Nice ambiance, but the food is overpriced for portion and quality. Staff was friendly. Make reservations ahead of time to be sure you don't have to wait. There was no wait on weeknight however.
author: Cody H.

description:
For all the hype about the dosas here, we were slightly disappointed. First off, it's quite a small restaurant which leads to quite a bit of waiting (even on a Sunday). The atmosphere is good (slightly noisy) but the tables and arrangement feels rather cluttered.

We got the Habanero-Mango Masala dosa and the South Indian moons. The Habanero dosa was not at all spicy, more like a typical Masala dosa that you'd get in India or an authentic south Indian restaurant. But it did taste good. The South Indian moons consists of all the Uttappams on the menu in mini size, and it's alright. The chutneys are pretty tasty but the sambhar that came with the dosa/uttappams wasn't too great. We loved the cocktails, some of which have a nice spicy or fancy twist to the taste.

Overall, it's worth a try if you like slightly less spicy dosas, with an Americanized ambience and menu. Definitely not THE most authentic of south Indian food offerings that I have come across in SF, especially for the pricing.
author: Aditya S.

description:
My new favorite spot to go!!!!!!! Go there during brunch time! Great music too. Get the platter with all the samples.. yummm!


Love love love
author: Na A.

description: The food is small portions. The service sucks. Could not even understand the waiter. The food tasted good. We have passed  this place for years. I will continue to pass it in the future
author: Jeff O.

description: I love this place and have for a long time... Last night I had the Arctic char and peach curry and it was excellent. I'm already thinking up an excuse to go back for more! Also their drinks are great!
author: Maya M.

description: Had a delicious dinner last night (Tuesday) here with my husband. We ordered and the white truffle masala dosa, the paneer and pea dosa, the side of rice made with straus milk, and a glass of the house red wine. I had made a reservation through yelp for 8:30pm and I was glad I did! Even though it was a Tuesday, there was still a wait. I would definitely say don't make a reservation if you can before hand. It's a nice intimate setting, and I think they had a full bar. The food was delicious, the servers were super nice, and I'll definitely be back!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Yay for SF restaurant week! $40 for an 8 course meal shared family style. Perfect way to sample! 

Highlights: 

The beet cumin soup was a winner. Normally I wouldn't think of ordering beet soup at an Indian restaurant so this was a surprise. Pureed beets with a hint of cumin, topped off with creme fraiche. 

Another winner, the lamb keema dosa. Sure I had to pay an extra $2 but that's ok, I could eat a full order of this all by myself. After all, the restaurant's name IS dosa. The dosa itself was a crispy thin crepe that came with a variety of sauces I could fill it with. I liked that the filling was on the side so I could customize it however I wanted. And the soup that you dip it in! Apparently the restaurant was founded on this. 

Rasmalai for dessert! My first time having sweet cheese. Drenched in a milky rose, cardamom, and pistachio "soup". I love flowers! If you do not like floral tasting things, you might not like this. It'll taste like potpourri. 

I appreciated that the owner took time to take care of his customers. When our dishes arrived, he thoroughly explained each one to us. 

Tip: Do not ask for naan. Save yourself from my embarrassment. They don't have any. 

Another tip: Free refills on the lentil chips!
author: Jen P.

description: I never liked indian food until I tried dosa- literally had no interest whatsoever and then tried the white truffle dosa at Dosa and now am obsessed. Everything is amazing here!
author: Sarah H.

description:
The spiced cocktails are unique and tasty. The Steph Curry is my favorite, just the right amount of kick from the spiced nectar.

The food is solid if you like South Indian food. We ordered the masala dosa and mushroom uttapam between which I preferred the latter. 

With one drink and one entree each the bill was ~$60 for two of us.   

The restaurant always seems busy so be prepared to wait a 10-30 minutes if you don't have a reservation.
author: Andrew S.

description:
In search of the best Dosa in SF, I went to its namesake restaurant to see what the hype was about and was really excited to see a new Western take on one of my favorite South Indian dishes. A lot of my friends who came before suggested that I try out the drinks they had. I tried out the Peony, which was delicious. I never thought mixing milk and alchol outside of a White Russian would be any good, but this was creamy and good. Some of my friends had a variety of other drinks, I think another group favorite was the Port of Call which was a spiked tea with a side of peanuts. For my second drink I had the Aaraam Se, which I was intrigued by the sheer fascination as to what I would get. I don't really remember what it was and it wasn't particularly distinct, so I would say to stick with one of their premade drinks. It is a cool experience none the less to just name off your favorite flavor and the bartender to just concoct something. 

As for food, I started by splitting a plate of Vada Pav which was delicious. The side salad it came with was a nice added bonus and wasn't just a bunch of greens on a plate but rather well made. The Vada Pav was cooked great and had the masala and spice of a more traditional vada pav. Now to main course, and I didn't feel vindicated eating at dosa without having one of their dosas. I chose the White Truffle Dosa due to a recommendation from a friend and enjoyed the meal but definitely didn't think it was that much different than an average dosa I would get from home. I would really love to come back and have one of their more traditional dosa types like a mysore or something else just so I can use it as a better barometer to dosas I have had in Madras. 

I also was not a huge fan of sitting right dab middle of the dining area with waiters constantly bustling around, but still I would love to come back just due to how extensive their menu is and their genuine focus on South Indian food. 

P.S. The Habanero-Mango is probably one of the spiciest things I have ever eaten. The warning is very well warranted considering my friend who ordered it couldn't even get through half and my mouth was burning for almost the whole meal from just one bite. Beware it is not for the faint of heart, but it was very good for the one bite I could taste before the heat kicked in.
author: Vaibhav S.

description: Sean is an awesome bartender, a real mixologist. The lamb curry fry was terrific and the atmosphere and vibe is great. Highly recommend DOSA!!!
author: Dan W.

description:
Food: 4 stars.
Service: 0 stars.
Overall: 2 stars. Well 1 star, they made me cry!

Super disappointed with my experience here after hearing DOSA was good mainstream Indian fare - although I did hear the one on Fillmore doesn't have the service issues that Valencia does.

I came for restaurant week with some friends, and our wine bottle slipped off the table after someone hit the other side. I don't know what I was expecting, but the staff blamed me for knocking it over! And then proceeded to tell me that this has never happened, and then showed me how sturdy the table was by shaking it. And then to add insult to injury, a few minutes afterwards the waiter came over and then told me how the staff saw me do it and that they still suspected it was my fault. I didn't even touch the bottle...

My friends and I won't be returning, and I hope DOSA reconsiders its service model. It's a shame because the food was decent.
author: Reyana F.

description:
RATING: 2. Wouldn't recommend. I probably wouldn't go again, but I might give it another shot and try out some of the more traditional dishes instead.

ORDER: Vada Pav, Mushroom and Arugula Uttapam, Spicy Mung Masala Dosa, Alchemist, Ginger Ante

OVERALL: I had heard a lot about DOSA from various friends, but when my friend and I went we were overwhelmingly underwhelmed given the price and hype. Choosing to order the more unique options over the more traditional dishes in an effort to try something different, I found the food inspired, but lacking the key tastes that make Indian cuisine what it is. If you're looking for unforgettable South Indian cuisine, I probably wouldn't look here.  

We had been raved to about the cocktails, but also weren't too impressed. The Alchemist (I think that was the one) was actually a hot drink, which we didn't expect and was a little off-putting. The Ginger Ante was not bad, but I've had Moscow Mules I've liked better.

PROS:
-I'm not a big fan of vada pav, but the vada pav was one of the best I've had (from someone who's eaten the street vada pav in India and one too many times growing up)!
-Great atmosphere and environment
-Wonderful service; kind and knowledgeable about the menu.
-Lots of creative concoctions

CONS:
-Food not worth the price.
author: Anjli S.

description: This is the second branch of DOSA. They have another one at Filmore at. This restaurant also has a very cool ambience and great service. I loved their cocktails here and their food tastes great - especially chole bhature, vada pav slider and idly sambar.
author: Rakesh G.

description: Second time dining at Dosa - love the food and the fusion concept. I am 100% South Indian myself and can tell you when someone attempts to present Indian food fusion and fails - but these guys don't disappoint. Nice selection of cocktails as well - certainly will come back.
author: shalini s.

description:
My wife and I used to frequent Dosa Valencia when they first opened several years ago before they made it big. We knew the restaurant was going to be a huge success because the food was so amazing. We loved it. We probably went at least 30 times and when Dosa Fillmore opened we frequented that one because it was closer to where we live. We didn't think Fillmore was quite as good as Valencia but it was still excellent.
For some unknown reason we stopped going some years ago. No one reason in particular, I think we just got excited about other cuisines and places and lost interest.
We went back to the original Valencia location last night with a couple friends. I knew exactly what I wanted to order and was pleased most if not everything I used to love is still on the menu. A few highlights:

- Lamb sliders. These things were awesome. Heat level is INSANE. I applaud the chef for having the nerve to put as much heat into those things as they do. I nearly choked at first as I inhaled a tiny chunk of the lamb and the heat seared the back of my throat. All good. That's the kind of burn anyone who likes spicy food should love. The quality of the lamb which was finely ground was also superb. 
- Chennai chicken. This is always good, however it used to be better. The chicken used to just explode on the palate with various spices and heat, and the accompanying yogurt sauce cooled it perfectly. Now it is more like a standard fare chicken and the sauce is kind of boring. Disappointed but still pretty good.
- Dahi Vada. This one was the major letdown of the evening. This dish used to be spectacular. It was served in a nice size bowl with a spiderweb thread of yogurt and sauce that was beautiful to look at and tasted like heaven. Now it is served in one of these gourmet bowls that really allow them to give you half as much and gone is the intricate artwork on top. It still tastes similar but nowhere close to how awesome it used to be. I really think Anjan should restore this dish to its former glory. It was one of the best dishes I've ever encountered anywhere.
- Corn Poriyal. Very good, refreshing corn spiced perfectly which was a nice break from the heavy flavors everywhere else.
- White Truffle Dosa. Spot on. As I'd expect from all of the dosas, this one was just as I remembered it and 100% delicious and awesome. 
- Caramelized onion Uttapam. Very good but I didn't think it was very unique. Just ok.
- Channa Batura. Pretty close to how I remember it and it was usually one of the dishes we loved the most. It still comes out with a gargantuan wheat bread ready to explode with steam in the middle and the divine chickpeas. It is still awesome. I think it used to be a smidgen better but it is still wonderful. 
- We ordered a few rice dishes and a veggie curry also which I thought were good but not the highlight of the meal so I won't go into great detail. 

I hope this provides a good review for your consideration of Dosa. If you like Indian food you will not be disappointed with Dosa, just know that technically it used to be better. You still can't go wrong here though. Bon apetit!
author: Matt H.

description: Food here is ok.  It's on the bland side compared to other Indian places.  It's quite expensive for the small portions.  Presentation is pretty.  They have fun drinks.  Location is trendy and the restaurant is cute.  Have to shout to hear each other.
author: D C.

description: Good food options and cocktails! Lovely ambience but usually hard to find a table unless a reservation is made early!
author: Jagruti T.

description: Horrible service. I have ordered from them twice and they have messed up the orders twice. Both times the food came extremely late (over an hour delayed.) Not worth the effort.
author: Mayank S.

description:
I still can't wrap my head around why people like this place - their food is far from South Indian, sub par and they have really poor service.

4 of us (all Indian) tried this for the second time and the food was as bad as last time (frozen food reheated, Costco Indian dessert and the appetizers - dahi vada, idlis, were rock hard). I understand the fusion concept of Indian food like Taj Compton but this is neither that.

What killed it for us what the seriously bad attitude of the wait staff and poor service.

Save yourself a trip - tons of better Indian places around to try out.
author: Karan A.

description:
I've never been to India so I can't speak to the authenticity of the food, but Dosa is regarded as one of the best Indian restaurants in SF. Knowing its reputation, I didn't want to order the basicass chicken tikka masala, but I didn't know what to get so I opted for the tasting menu. At $42/person for 3 courses, Dosa has easily one of the most budget-friendly tasting menus in the city. 

1st course: Fried sole -  I was surprised by how much fish they gave considering it was just an appetizer. Think the fish from fish and chips, but with a curry dipping sauce rather than tartar. It comes with a little salad which was refreshing.

2nd course: Paneer & Peas Dosa - How does one not get a dosa at a place called Dosa? Paneer is so interesting to me because unlike the cheeses I'm familiar with, it doesn't melt. It's a curd cheese that has a hard tofu-like texture. Definitely get this if you haven't tried paneer before. It comes with a lentil dipping soup as well. I was already getting pretty full by the end of this course...

3rd course: Hyderbadi Lamb Chop - I was struggling by this point but it was easily my favorite course. The yogurt marinade was perfect to undercut that fattiness of the lamb.

Guava Gelato - Everything else on the dessert menu looked extremely rich and heavy. This was the perfect end to the meal.

Solid portions, tasty food, and doesn't break bank. Highly recommended!
author: Lucy N.

description:
Really bad sitting and food is as good as dosa in Fillmore. Serious on sitting area. Curry smell in clothes and overall bad service 
Not going back
author: Nick S.

description: We happened to stumble upon this restaurant when we were in the Mission, and (luckily), it was SF Restaurant Week (and we still got a table)! They had to sit us at the bar first before a table opened up. Unfortunately, bar service was subpar. I think it took about 20ish minutes for us to get our drinks and the bartender looked really stressed out the entire time. Luckily, the negative was behind us once we were seated! The food was OUTRAGEOUSLY good!! And service (while not excellent) was still quite good as well! With the restaurant week deal, my husband and I were able to have eight courses of outstanding food, for $40 a person. We started out the meal with the red beat and cumin soup, spicy cauliflower and chennai chicken appetizers. All were outstanding!! We then had the lamb dosa (for an extra $2 a person), the spicy prawn dish and the coconut chicken masala. While all three were delicious, the lamb and prawn dishes stood out! Finally we ended the meal with a tapioca kheer and a rasmalai dessert. Both were EXCELLENT!! Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes Southern Indian food! We will be back!
author: Courtney G.

description:
Dosa is a must-go place on my list whenever I'm in San Fran! The only thing I go for is the Tamil Lamb. It is absolutely delicious. The lamb is always cooked to perfection and melts in your mouth. The gravy is spiced perfectly. Last time I was there, I also had the Keema Dosa which was really yummy! The time before, I ordered the Chile Uttapam which was super spicy, just the way I prefer it. 

However, the dessert was not at all good. I forget what we ordered, but it was something along the lines of Mango gelato and another dessert. Unfortunately, both were less than satisfying. 

However, this place simply gets 5 stars for its lamb. 

Definitely give this place a try - specifically for the Tamil Lamb.
author: Sargam B.

description:
We came here to celebrate my son's birthday with a couple of his pals! I got there a little early and sat at the bar and had one of their delicious happy hour cocktails, the Steph Curry. It was a delicious, not too sweet, slightly spicy bourbon cocktail. Mommy mellowness fell over me. The boys came and we had the fries appetizer and mango lassis. The wait staff was super cool, informative and helpful. We decided to go a la carte because with three 14 yo boys I wasn't sold on the $45 each family style option. After shelling out that kind of dough I was not going to make a burrito run if they happened to be hungry afterwards. We started with the kiwi and beat salad--a refreshing palate cleanser. I ordered the prawn curry with coconut rice--beautifully rich with flavor, two kids got the lamb korma, one got the sliders and actually I can't remember what the ex got. But everyone was satisfied! A couple of the boys found their dishes authentically spicy but this was an adult authentic Indian place and their palates will thank me later;-)
The waitstaff did their magic with the birthday dessert and candle and we ended a fabulous birthday meal!
author: Kymi A.

description:
Charles your fantastic bartender is one of the reasons you guys rock . I work in the business and found his attention to detail 
Friendly excellent service was second to none . I come by late after I work . He made my experience notable . 
Thank you Charles . Kudos .
author: Susan L.

description:
This review is for the delivery orders only. 

The food is closer to 3.5 for me, but it's too expensive and portions too small for it to make my regular delivery rotation. 

Mostly due to a combination of the following:
-they charge a delivery fee on top of the "handling fee", Healthy SF fee, tax, and tip. 
-entrees are $13-20, but the portion size is closer to an appetizer. We usually order 1 uthappam and 1 dosa, which come with a small soup. This can be a benefit when I want to eat light, but I ultimately pay more than I do for a meal that, if ordered elsewhere, would have enough food for lunch the next day.

Tax/tip are standard, and sure, many restaurants charge separately for Healthy SF (though I tend to avoid them). But everything about nickel-and-diming delivery AND handling fees on top of expensive entrees rubs me the wrong way. Of the two times I've ordered, I've paid over $20 per person to still want dessert or a snack after.
author: Krista L.

description: Very good food. Staff can somehow remember everything you order without taking any notes.
author: dogan kaya b.

description: One of the best Dosa joints I've ever been too. Quality service and fantastic food. Definitely come here for all your San Fran dosa needs
author: Zain L.

description: Came here after we heard that it would be a 1.25 hour wait at Lolo's across the street... and was not disappointed. The Mumbai Felicia was refreshing and the Steph Curry was very spicy (you need to try it to know what I am talking about!)  The cocktails are a bit pricier but well worth it.  Would recommend.
author: Eric L.

description: Umm.. just no. The food is less than average. With so many good indian restaurants around it's hard not to be judgy. If ambience and good service are what u are looking for then go to this place. If you are looking for good food, walk 10 steps and go to udupi palace instead.
author: Vineeta K.

description:
Eating here is an experience, one of those that leaves a memorable impression on your taste buds leaving you longing for MOREEEE.

The food here is fantastic.   We had the truffle dosa and the pumpkin dosa and were in heaven the entire time.  It was so delicious and special, and the serving size was very generous as well. 

When you order any dosa dish you will be served something along the lines of a giant crepe - not too thick - slightly crispy, with your filling of choice, as well as a variety of sauces to compliment the dosa. 

So. Damn. Good. 

I really love the decor and vibe this place has.  The only thing  don't like is how close the tables are.  I literally heard everything the table next to me was talking about, and I'm sure they were listening to my convo as well...but hey in SF this is hard to escape so whatevs. 

I WILL BE BACK. 

omg and if you don't like black licorice tasting things DONT EAT THE AFTERMINT THING BY THE REGISTER. Just warning you ~
author: Christina L.

description:
I came to DOSA with a few friends for dinner. To be honest, I didn't really know what to expect as I rarely eat South Indian food.

We ordered a few things: some dosas, chennai chicken, fish and lamb curries. The lamb curry was probably the best in my opinion; the lamb was very tender and the curry very flavorful. The chicken was okay, and the dosas were pretty underwhelming. Almost everything we had was very salty, especially the chips.

I have a bit of mixed feelings about this place. Probably worth a try if you fancy Indian cuisine and are in the SF Mission area.
author: Alvin W.

description:
The Beet & Cumin Soup was simple, but very rich and smooth. The Sprouted Mung & Paneer Salad was okay, but could use more paneer. The star was the Mixed Mushroom & Truffle Oil Uttapam.  A delightful pancake, with a nice amount of truffle oil.  There were plenty of amazing vegetarian options, including the dosas!

Pistachio Barfi was good, like a fancy...granola bar.  Which is a weird thing to say, but I mean it as a compliment.  Its layered cashew milk fudge, ganache and pistachios. Hard to cut, but tasty!

We had reservations for a Tuesday night, and it was necessary.  It was packed even mid-week!
author: Kelly E.

description: Delicious! Spicy. Only complaint is I wish they would trim out the chicken better. Gristle, ew!
author: Cricket X.

description:
Dined here again and it was decent. I feel like the quality of the food is different from what it used to be 2-3 years ago. We feel like the service is fine but generally lacking because management might have changed. 

I like their cocktails but their wines by the glass aren't that great. I wish that there were better options especially for the white wines by the glass as Indian food goes well with white wines.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Let me start by saying that Dosa is my favorite Indian dish, so I had pretty high expectations for the Dosa at a place called 'DOSA'.  My sister and I started with the Poori and the mint chutney which was pretty light, despite being fried bread.  For dinner I got the Rava Masala and my sister got the Spicy Masala Dosa (made Vegan w/no ghee).  I am allergic to rice and my sister is Vegan, and they were able to accommodate both of us, however even though the Rava Masala is made with semolina flour they also use a very small amount (according to the waitress) of rice flour.  Needless to say, I took my chances.

We drank their house reserve Rose wine and had their house-made Masala Chai with a coconut passion fruit sorbet for dessert.  All-in-all the experience was great, the food was delicious and the ambiance was nice for two late 20's ladies.  My 4 stars is because it was super busy and the 2 bars tenders seemed stretched too thin to give us a lot of attention, so we ended up waiting for things like water refills.  

I will definitely eat here again on my next trip to San Francisco! :-)
author: Katie S.

description: Excellent food and service every time I've been here! My favorite is the white truffle masala dosa and I always get it. The last time we were here, we had a reservation for 8pm for a party of 6. We showed up exactly on time but they weren't able to accommodate us until about 9pm due the small size of the establishment. We were starting to feel a bit annoyed thinking they shouldn't have accepted our reservation if they were at full capacity. However, the staff went out of their way to compensate for our wait time and apologized profusely. They offered us some really amazing appetizers of our choice and a round of drinks, all on the house! They were very attentive to us even while we were waiting, constantly trying to free up a table for us. This is the mark of a good business, and we certainly appreciated the way they handled the "hangry" crowds during peak times. The food as always was top notch. Highly recommend this place to anyone that loves South Indian food!
author: Gauri P.

description: This is a different Indian food experience than what you might be used to since it's southern Indian. A dosa is basically a crispy crepe. I had the white truffle dosa, and I thought it was incredible. My only (minor) gripe is that there weren't many non-vegetarian choices, so if you have some major meat lovers, this might not be the best place to have dinner with them. An added bonus is the free papadum they provide as an appetizer.
author: Charles L.

description: Trendy, and loud. Nice waiter who became somewhat annoying. The drinks were interesting, especially the Gin and Tonic. Dosas were ok, sauces good. Either way I would not return - can't deal with noise and over-priced food.
author: D W.

description: The ambiance was gorgeous and inviting! Upon arrival the hostess was extremely pleasant and seating us within 5 minutes. Unfortunately, our waitress did not show the same welcoming and friendly attitude. Although seated first, she proceeded to serve the man next to us. She gave him his water and complimentary snack prior to ours.  Then when asked about the menu she was not able to answer our questions. Sadly, once the food came she was only attentive to us one time. We could not even get her attention when we were ready to pay our bill. Luckily, the bus boy was eager to help, offered more water, and smiled although busy himself!
author: Chelsea R.

description: We had visited Dosa Fillmore before, Dosa at Valencia is a bit more casual but same great food. We ordered the Thali which was a great way of trying lots of different flavors. We loved the dish. As an appetizer we ordered bhel puri which was also amazing.
author: Pau Y Monica C.

description: Hostess was great. Waiter wasn't very attentive & he took a long time to get to us & help us when we needed help. The food was good. Just really expensive for what they serve. I'd go back for the Dosa but that's it. Way over priced even for SF.
author: Cyndi F.

description:
Love dosas and other South Indian dishes and came here with very high expectations as it was highly recommended by a lot of friends but had a terrible experience. First there was a long wait before we finally got a table .

Was extremely excited about the food and ordered Dahi vada and idli fries for small plates. The idlis were hard and cold and the dahi vada also had hard vadas. Extremely disappointed- but still wanted to give it a chance. 

For the main course tried vegetable korma and mushroom and truffle oil uttapam. All the food was below average. Still can't wrap my head around why people love this place especially because it is not even cheap.

Definitely not coming back!
author: Avi K.

description: Thank you for responding to my review, Anjan.  Your seating records are clearly inaccurate as we were not seated until 50 minutes after our reservation and over 40 minutes after we arrived.  You should check with the young gentleman who was hosting that night.  He will tell you that we certainly were not seated within any 15 minute grace period.  It's unfortunate that you have changed your review to imply that I exaggerated or "felt" like we waited 40 minutes--it's unfortunate because it is completely and wholly inaccurate.  If you would like to discuss, I am happy to, but please do not publicly write false statements about my time at your restaurant.
author: Paula N.

description: It's pleasant place for a nice dinner. The food is delicious and the ambience is good. We had idli, masala dosa, dahi bada, ras malai and masala chai. Idli was just perfect and the sambar was tasty! Will go back there soon!
author: Suhani N.

description: Nice atmosphere, great vegan options!
author: Kaisa H.

description: Had dinner here last night with two friends. We came late in the evening and it was clear they were wrapping up and closing but the staff did an outstanding job making us feel welcome. You can generally feel when people want you to leave but their warm service never made anything feel rushed. Our server, Jenny, was outstanding as well as the manager Jesse. Even the chef came out and said hi. How can you beat that? Restaurant industry folks work so hard and it's so easy to phone it in for the last table but they finished strong. Food, drinks, service (both service steps and enthusiasm) all receive top marks. I would go again for any single portion and will go again for it all. Bravo.
author: Tom K.

description:
I think I'm at a 2.5 only because of their policies. I planned on getting a salad & spending no more than $15-$20, but upon seating, our party of 10 was notified that we had to order from a Prix Fixe menu at $45/person. Only because of the number of people?? I've never heard of such bull****. On top of that, they added a 20% mandatory gratuity rather than 15%, Healthy SF, and taxes. Our bill was $930 with an average of 2 drinks per person. We left full, mostly on rice, potato & chicken, but the value was NOT worth it.

Otherwise, the food was actually pretty good, and service bordered great. An interesting twist was the music playing in the background. Straight 90s Hip Hop. Go figure..
author: M P.

description:
Dear Dosa,

I had never had a dosa in my life before, but man, your white truffle dosa has me hooked. It's true that there could be a little more filling, but oh my god, that dosa shell is so delicious and crispy that I guess I can't complain about a little (to be honest: a lot) extra shell hanging off the side. Also, I'm sorry I ate all your chips. But they were awesome.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Delicious food that can cater to whatever your dietary restrictions are. They even have a special menu they can give you that shows you how various offerings can be gluten free or vegan or whatever. Not that I need that, but I've seen it and I was impressed. 

If you're new here, get the uttapam sampler and be delighted. 

Wonderful craft cocktails (I recommend the Hanging Gardens) and a solid wine list. 

My favorite entrees are the lamb pepper fry (with lemon rice!) and the vegetarian koftka (sometimes vegan, not currently) with coconut rice. 

Honestly, if you can't handle spicy, this may not be the place for you. There are a couple dishes, but most things have some heat.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Great food, and very delicious.
BUT... Watch your credit card receipts! They add stuff to your final bill after you have signed it, and put in the total amount.
author: Andy C.

description:
Feeling Indian for dinner but don't want something to heavy? 
Feeling fusion / modern food but everything seems to be New American these days?
DOSA will be the perfect choice for dinner.

What exactly is dosa, you might ask? It's an Indian crepe, accompanied by sauces (in this case, a coconut cilantro and a tomato sauce), sometimes stuffed. Dosa (like the food) is best eaten with your hands, pulling apart the crispy dough and dipping it in the sauces. 

DOSA (the restaurant) does a perfect rendition of this. The whole ritual of breaking apart the food and dipping in the sauces is so addicting, you keep doing it while you're chatting. I'm such a fan of the coconut cilantro sauce, which is light and refreshing.

What is better, is that DOSA manages to make my paneer dosa crispy on the edges, and fluffy towards the middle. This holds the paneer well, making this middle part of the dosa chewy. The paneer was savory and well spiced, giving the whole dish so much flavor.

At the end of the meal, I am stuffed, satisfied, but not to the point of a food coma. That, to me, is just where I want to be on a Saturday night.
author: Julia N.

description:
Amazing service. Amazing drinks. The bartender was very knowledgeable. Jenny was a real treat; really made the experience special. Great service from all the staff. 
Although the name of the drink Alchemist does not live up to its presentation; a smoking drink served under a glass bulb, something right out of Beauty and the Beast. I suggest renaming to Gastón, or "Rose" in Hindi. 
All the dishes had great flavor, and very drink we had was perfectly balanced. 
I love the tiny atmosphere of the space.
author: Tim G.

description:
Great South indian place. 
Veggie, non veggie all the stuff here is good.
Anything on menu is great.
author: Siva Sankar G.

description:
Talk about yummy in the tummy. I don't usually pay $15 for south indian food, seeing as how the hole in the wall places are usually the best, but Dosa definitely takes it home for a trendy place.

I'm a huge fan of uttapam, so that's what I got. They had a "tasting" of 5 different uttapam, so I got that. My favorites were the mushroom and caramelized onion ones. We also ordered this crab cake thing, which was like 100x better than normal crab cakes. Plus the chutney was amazing.

Great place for dosas and uttapam - something you don't find at your run-of-the-mill indian place. Great cocktails too.
author: Sherry L.

description:
********************* 1312 **********************

    Absolutely no parking or valet in this part of town, and I was way over dressed.... I love the space at Dosa, the layout, the cute bar, and the awesome Lamb Keema Dosa that they offer. 

   The lentil soup was too salty but the mince lamb and potato was delicious. The savory crepe is big and generous portion for dipping, quite delicious and all for only $15. You will surely be full and happy with just that, but I suggest sharing it and order another dish or 2.

   Bartender was very nice gracious, making the cocktail to your liking. I'm loving this Southern Indian Cuisine here. Check out their sister location on Fillmore too!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Has to be my go to spot for South Indian fusion food! I've tried pretty much all the vegetarian options available. They are all great! They also have great Frankies for brunch! All their entrees pair very well their Indian-ised cocktails. Especially Morjim Goa with the Masala Air.
author: Nandita D.

description:
Great food, as always. The green chutney has great texture but misses the spot in terms of spice, I guess a few more green chillies would fix that. Sambar is authentic, perfectly spiced and populated with vegetables - just great! Dosas are brilliant. There is nothing that they missed. 
Personal opinion - I do not think paneer stuffing goes well with dosas. Primarily because both are sour to a certain level. But the paneer dosa shows a lot of culinary craft as they actually make paneer work with dosa, and mind you with no overdose of spice to mask the taste but by fusing the spices to the right level. All in all great stuff!
author: Ashrith B.

description:
This place gets crowded pretty quickly during dinner so make a reservation. (And even after making a reservation, it still takes a bit of time to get seated.)
I came here with two other friends and we shared two small plates, a dosa, and an entree- $25 each including tip and tax. 
Hands down, the best dish was the Kerala Chicken- it was delicious. The Dahi Vada: the lentil fritters were good but the yogurt sauce was overpowering. If you like sweet potatoes, the Sweet Potato Dosa is amazing. The Chennai Chicken reminded me of a more oily version of the Japanese tapas- karaage. 
Overall an enjoyable experience!
author: Grace L.

description:
This is probably the most unique Indian cuisine experience I have ever had. Prior to my visit, I had never even heard of a dosa. Man, I was in for a treat!

For starters, make sure you make a reservation. This is CRUCIAL. This place, while not terribly small, is not very large, and they seem to operate at max capacity. It's also a very intimate and hip setting, so I imagine it fills up quickly as a date spot. 

So aside from some popular Indian dishes (curries, chutneys, etc.), there are DOSAS...and these things are AMAZING. Depending on what kind of dosa you get (for example, mine had potato with truffle oil as a filling), it can be rolled up or folded...and it is HUGE!!! Imagine a LARGE crepe that is lightly fried (buttery goodness) to perfection. It's large enough to not only eat the contents that come inside of it but also to dip in the various sauces, chutneys, etc. that they bring out with it. 

Beware of the lentil curry soup! It is fantastic but also very, very, very spicy. I like spicy things...but my nose was running, and I was sweating like a rabid hog after just a few bites. Whew.

Prices tend to be on the high side. I think a curry dish was in the $20 range. The dosas vary depending on if you get vegetable, meat, etc., but they tend to be cheaper. Appetizers are also on the pricey end. This looks like a great place to get drinks. I saw many interesting libations on the menu.

I really like the Mission District in general, but now I love it even more since I've discovered Dosa. I will definitely be back when in the Bay Area!
author: Jessica G.

description: We were seated right away and presented with the menu and drinks. Very busy, so try to book a table if you can. Recommend the halibut curry and lamb Keema dosa - both delicious! There were so many things I want to try on the menu, so will be back again. Only downside, the toilets weren't very clean,  but hey, they hardly ever are.
author: Ed C.

description:
Took for ever to attend to our table.
No one bothered to clean up the old plates and bowls and kept accumulating stuff on our table. I did my part of Karma by paying 18% tip. Hope they dont repeat this to others.
Food was great, but nothing near to what it was 4 years ago.
author: phanivas v.

description:
Subpar service, waited a long time for order to be taken and food to come, ran out of our entré when it was time to serve us.  Those things happen regardless of a restaurants best efforts.  

What was excellent was the food, all of it was great.

Prices are steep, 18 bucks for 2 scallops is beyond overpricing but they were super yummy.
author: carter b.

description: Jenny the server is smokin', great indian food, love the dessert here, great masala, very rosey chai love everything on the menu
author: Carmin W.

description: 3.5 star for this place.. Had always good experience here for dinner. Ambience is good and service is excellent. Their Chole Bhatura is a must try.. They have wide variety of dosa's and their uttapam's are good too.. Their chef special uttapam is a must try too. It is always good to reserve and go here on weekends as they are pretty busy!!
author: Anuja S.

description:
Came here with some friends based on their recommendation. Wasn't what I was expecting when he said indian food as I'm more accustomed to hole in the wall indian restaurants.  The atmosphere here is very intimate with low lighting and lots of fixtures hanging from the ceiling.  

There's a full bar with many specialty drinks. They can even make you a customized drink if you ask them. We ordered the chicken curry, lamb curry, and a bunch of naan like breads that i can't remember the names of.  While everything was delicious,  I'd have to say after a while I wasn't sure what I was eating since I dipped everything into the habanero and tomato dipping sauces. 

My favorite was probably this potato stuffed bread, the puffy bread, and the lamb curry. The lamb was cooked so tenderly that it tasted like beef. 

Honestly its a bit steep for Indian food, but service and quality of food was top notch.  I'd just rather pay $50 for a steak.
author: Milton F.

description:
We used to love this restaurant but when we got there on time, if not early, on November 4,2016 with a confirmed dinner  reservation, the hostess told us there was something wrong  with her "thing" and we'd have to wait behind the 25 people standing on the street waiting to get in.  No apologies, just a "we'll get you seated when we get everyone else seated."  In our estimation that looked like at least an hour.   We went down to Rasoi down the  street and got right in.  An hour an a half later we walked by Dosa and about half the same people on the street were still waiting (and visibly angry).

You won't get mus back to Dosa anytime soon.
author: Tom H.

description:
This Sunday afternoon I placed a Caviar delivery order and it was almost comically messed up: 

Ordered: 
* Uttapam - Caramelized Onion: Savory and sweet caramelized onion and cilantro. "A thicker version of the dosa crepe with a variety of savory toppings. Each served with sambar and our housemade coconut chutney and tomato chutney."
* Masala Dosa - "The classic dosa filled with creamy spiced potatoes, onions, and cashew nuts (masala)."
* Masala Chai
* Madras Coffee

Delivered: 
* Uttapam
* Masala Dosa - No. This was an empty crepe with absolutely zero fillings. A good crepe, but still just a crepe. 
* NO drinks. 
* 2x sides of delicious sambar, coconut chutney & tomato chutney, plus a wonderful potato salad side.

Caviar customer service stepped up to the plate and rushed the missing drinks to me at no extra charge, and refunded me the whole cost for the empty Masala Dosa. Caviar is awesome. 

The saving grace for this debacle was the Dosa flavors and spices: absolutely delicious.  

Come on, Dosa, get your stuff together! You make wonderful food. Just please double-check your orders before sending them away with food delivery services. Thank you!
author: Sarah J.

description:
Loved it when it opened, then it plateaud, now it is really wonderful and sophisticated, better than ever before. DOSA is definitely in the top ten restaurants of San Francisco (not sure which location is better but Valencia is more casual). 

So I don't really care for dosas themselves. Though many people love a good dosa, I just find them boring. I do love practically everything else on the menu. The high brow bhel puri, uttapam, any seafood dishes, the duck tacos... So innovative, delicious, mind and mouth both happy. Makes my creativity flow. 

And for brunch, the banana Nutella dosa is not a gimmicky version of a brunch crepe. It's actually really really good, crispy, and served with unsweetened coconut chutney, sweet tamarind chutney, and a rasmalai-type sweet chutney. 

And now they have a kids' menu!! Cheese dosa, plain rice, mild curried chicken, etc. I brought in one toddler and one baby for brunch and everything went very smoothly. No snooty anti-kid vibes you'll find a lot of places in San Francisco. In fact, I noticed several children there approx age 6 for brunch and they do have high chairs.
author: Marina N.

description:
Good food. Wish they wrote down our order, so they wouldn't have brought a dosa instead of an uthapam! 
Amazing rasam and sambhar! Many veggie options.
author: Deepti K.

description: I went their after checking the reviews and must say I enjoyed the food here. Though I am a spice lover, and the food was not at all spicy still it had wonderful quality and taste that I would love to go here whenever I am in the city.
author: Priyanshu G.

description:
There was this couple on a first/second date and I hope it works out because I felt like that guy represented me (white guy wearing a purple gingham J Crew dress shirt with an Asian girl at an Indian restaurant).

Even though this is an Indian restaurant that caters to white people I appreciate that they offer dosas and uttapam. 

Okay this is a rare thing for me to say but this restaurant killed it last night. The meal was fantastic. Our waitress had a nice voice. 

We get some drinks at the bar (kingfisher beer on tap and some girly gin drink). I follow up with Pinot noir and Cabernet franc (can't tell the difference). 

Get the tasting menu. I recommend the lamb slider, truffle dosa, and then lamb chops or chicken korma as the third course. The chennai chicken as a first course was meh. 

The lamb slider: such complex flavors going on. Spicy, savory, delicious, juicy, meaty. Get this!!

Truffle dosa: very tasty South Indian crepe. Comes with dipping sauces. 

Lamb chop: it's small but good

Chicken korma: this is more of a basic chick dish (think chicken tikka masala). Nonetheless it's a solid choice for a curry. 

For dessert I got the Shrikhand. Don't even bother. It's terrible. It's some weird creamy thing. 10 bucks wasted 

Total with tip was $105 for each of us (my friend and I).
author: Jerry B.

description: Great Southern Indian Food, just don't expect all the standard curries and other staples of a typical Indian buffet restaurant.
author: Peter H.

description:
This is the first time I've been to Dosa and tried South Indian food. It was delightful and delicious. Upon arrival to Valencia and 21st St, we were lucky to have found street parking immediately..and the restaurant was just a short walk away.
