We were seated 15 mins prior to our reservation, since we arrived early, and the host was even considerate enough to offer us the choice of a window seat, since it was such a warm evening. With about 15 minutes to spare before 7pm, we were also offered the Happy hour menu to browse through. We didn't have to wait too long before our waiter arrived to take our order.

Once our order was taken, we were given a plate of light and crispy homemade chips. It was very tasty and addicting. We started with the Chennai Chicken from the happy hour menu. Fried boneless chicken with a bit of heat accompanied by a yogurt dipping sauce. Although it was too spicy for my palette, I did manage to enjoy about 6 pieces of it while little sweat beads started to build up on the bridge of my nose. 

Our waiter was extremely helpful in offering his suggestions for which menu items had a little less heat in them and which menu items we should consider, so that it would be the right amount of food for the two of us. His suggestions we're spot on. 

We ordered the White truffle masala Dosa and the Hyderbadi lamp chops. Both were absolutely amazing! The Dosa.. which is essentially a crepe, was so light and crispy and the potato filling with infused truffle oil was superb. I enjoyed it a lot. The lamb dish was awesome as well. So tender and flavorful!  And the lemon rice accompaniment was perfection. 

After dinner we even had a little room saved for dessert. We ordered the special homemade gelato. It was toasted rice with cinnamon flavor.  The combo sounds weird....but it tasted wonderful!

Overall, I had a very pleasant experience at Dosa. My tummy was happy and my metabolism was reved up a bit. I would definitely recommend South India cuisine to anyone interested in trying something different. The only minor dislike I had was that their menu items did seem a little overpriced.  But having won as many awards as they have, I guess that I can see why they would charge a little more than expected. I wouldn't hesitate to go back again since I had an overall nice experience with the food and the service.
author: Vindy C.

description:
The first time I came to Dosa I had the Mango Habanero dosa. I was warned (on the menu) that it would be spicy, but I usually pride myself in having extremely spice-resistant taste buds (being South Indian myself). It was pretty spicy, but only at the edges where the potato curry inside didn't "diffuse" the spice. I really loved the taste, especially that it incorporated non-traditional ingredients and still maintained an authentic taste. I also had the Papdi Chaat, which also tasted incredibly authentic. 

However, at the time (end of January 2015), I wasn't really active on Yelp (didn't most very many reviews). I decided I would definitely come back later.

This past Friday, I came back with a friend who was visiting San Francisco for the first time. We're both South Indian, so we know the authentic taste of a homemade masala dosa, and like I said before, it lives up to it. 

This time, I had the Paneer and Peas Dosa, and my friend had the Sweet Potato dosa. Paneer and Sweet Potato aren't ingredients typically used in authentic South Indian dosa, yet the taste maintained that "authentic" integrity.  We also the vada pav, and I loved how they incorporated the spices also prevalent in authentic Indian cuisine, in a fusion way. I also had a Mango Lassi and Rasmalai, which both had an authentic taste. The Rasmalai tasted better than most Indian restaurants and included the flavor of the cardamom and saffron used in it. 

This restaurant is definitely worth the hype and the price.
author: Deepti N.

description:
We had an 8:30pm reservation and were seated at 9pm. Nice hostess and server. Good South Indian food. This trip I did not have a dosa. If I return, I will try one. We shared a bread pillow and we were in love with it. Friends got the lentil fritters, dosa and chicken curry. Husband and I got the scallops (spicy and tender) with lotus root, uttapam (pretty good), and veggie meatballs in a peanut sauce (the "meatballs" were nice, but the sauce was a little overwhelming for my taste). The coconut rice was a bit dry and too sweet to accompany the peanut sauce of this dish. Plain rice would have been better. Instead of dessert, we had mango lassis. 
It was difficult to have a conversation with the noise level of the music. 
It's very crowded so definitely make a reservation and still plan on waiting a bit.
The 4 of us were happy and full when we left.
author: Tanya F.

description: I am South Indian- and I know what a good dosa tastes like, and honestly this wasn't one of them. The service was also very under whelming. First, the waiter didn't seem to know much about the menu. Which is excusable, but he also pretty much flat out refused to make any minor modifications to the dishes. Go here if you like over-priced, average tasting dosas- but hey- the service is just like what you would get in India ;)
author: Deepthi R.

description: Ordering on yelp doesn't work. They are always too busy. Got calls from yelp to say can't reach restaurant. Also they require reservations for communal tables as well
author: Viral C.

description:
White people Indian food.... Nuff said 

Food isn't as flavorful as an authentic Indian restaurant. You can definitely tell this place was made for the ambiance and not the food. Fairly expensive and it seemed as though a lot of the items on the menu were made up, bread chicken with a fancy Indian name and a side of chutney doesnt make it authentic. One thing Positive you can take away from this spot is that the Service was good
author: Farhad H.

description:
We really enjoyed our first visit to DOSA on Valencia:

1. The decor and space was amazing - especially the warm lights in the evening
2. The service was great, very friendly and just the right level of attentive, and
3. The food was definitely above average - especially the Rava Masala DOSA and dipping sauces

One tip: DOSA is popular and strongly recommend booking reservations in advance

We look forward going back again.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I loved this place. They served papad to start with. We ordered chutney sampler, few dosa, tea, coffee, idle fry. Loved all of them. I did had a bad experience with salted lassi. It was both sweet and salty instead of just salty. But that's how they make salted lassi, so won't reduce any stars from rating for that. After I mentioned that this was not what I exactly wanted, our server took it off from our bill too. I liked their customer service too
author: Gayatri P.

description:
Today I walked in here having a craving for some Indian food. The guy who greeted me wore a green hat and was very personable. I had walked in with just my yoga attire with my yoga mat as well. He didn't seem to have a problem with how casual I was. I was also midway working thru my chai (how ironic) latte and he asked politely if I could finish it quickly since they sell drinks too (like chai! Haha)

It was totally understandable regarding the drink policy. I really appreciated how professional he was about it so I chugged it like a champ. 

I saw down and decided on the lamb Keema omelette. I've never had a lamb omelette before but I have to say, it was very delicious! The egg was very juicy. The lamb was very nicely spiced and there is some sort of red sauce pairing to go with it. It comes with a potato salad too sprinkled some cilantro and some other spices. I was too full by then and packed it to go. I paired this meal with a fresh mango lassi. They hands down have the BEST mango lassi, perfect blend of sweet and creamy. 

For a gal doing a solo lunch, the staff was very kind and attentive, asking me if I wanted to set my yoga mat elsewhere instead of in the floor. I'll definitely come back with more peeps next time !
author: Aggie Z.

description: We were not experienced or big fan of Indian food before we came here. The owner was there and offered us amazing "simple" traditional Indian food; we had Indian draft beer (IPA and Lager) and it was simply the best. We'll be back for sure.
author: Iona S.

description:
Tldr; over priced mediocre food with poor service.

The food was reasonable but the service was really poor. It took the staff 15+ mins to refill our water even after multiple attempts to get the staff's attention. 

The paneer and peas dosa was pretty bland, but did have a solid pound of cheese in it. Pongal was the saving grace of the meal.
author: Kishore R.

description: Amazing south Indian food! Service is superb too. Try the onion uttapam here! Its taste takes me back to India. Waiting time is usually a lot, but everything is worth the wait! In my experience, I was told I would be seated in 45 mins, however I got their message in 15 mins with a table ready for us! Great service, good food. Would recommend this place to all south Indian food lovers!
author: Madhura P.

description: Tried this last week when I was visiting SF.  Excellent appetizers and food.  The kale pakora is to die for and the sula red wine was so good and smokey.  Must try!
author: Rakhi B.

description: I have been here several times and most of the time it's great.  The food is always amazing.  Tonight, we had an issue and we heard lots of apologies but I was shocked no one comped even a drink.  We sat at our table for 15 minutes before anyone even spoke to us.  It was a lovely server (woman) who wasn't our official server.  She took our order.  Our official waiter came by the table 1 hour after we arrived to ask how things were.  Unacceptable.  The lovely female server checked on us and I expressed how weird it was that it took him an hour to come by.  She sent the manager over.  The manager was very apologetic but didn't comp even a drink.  I was very surprised.  I expect better from Dosa.
author: Becky T.

description:
Great variety of Dosas with a western touch.
Cool mission vibe. It can get crowded.
The place to go for dosas in San Fran
author: Greg O.

description: Awesome cocktails prepared by a stellar mixologist -- female/short dark hair -- recommended THE LONG GOODBYE and it was delicious -- then had to have THE ALCHEMIST after I watched her prepare this cardamom-smoked magic in a belljar. Great food also!
author: Monty P.

description:
My husband grew up in the Artesia/Cerritos area and claims to be "totally traumatized" because he had to smell Indian food all the time. I kept telling him not to knock it 'til he's tried it, but he is adamant!

So when an opportunity was afforded me to ... ahem... trick him into going to an Indian restaurant, I took it with both hands!

Thanks to my aunt for providing this excuse and thank you Dosa for providing a pleasant foodie experience!

Kale Dosa
Dosa is a grain/legume (I think they use lentil) crepe and they way "Dosa" does this crepe, they make it crispy. Which we really like! Each person on our table had a different presentation of their dosa. This dosa had kale in the batter as well as the chutney used to dip the dosa. Very very good.

Broccoli Raab Dosa
Also came with the dosa and some dipping sauces.  I think masala was one of them. Very good.

Paneer Dosa
All that cheese in their paneer dosa... can't go wrong. Very good.

Bhatura
Impressive and fun. It's really just an oversized puffed up pita full of hot air. But I love it!

Lamb Curry
Spicy, cut up into pieces, and very good!

Chutney Sampler
A VERY good buy!

Warning: Long wait. You must arrive as soon as they open. Reservations are not going to do you any good.
author: Kislev A.

description:
Best place for dosa in the entire Bay area. Every item is delicious. This is the same type of food that I get in India(south to be specific).
Go to this restaurant only. Don't go to any other branches of dosa restaurants in San Francisco.
Our first visit here was for dinner.
We liked all the chutneys that were served with papad. Best chutneys I have ever tasted.
I have ordered from the spring tasting menu. Lamb kebab sliders were awesome. Spicy moong masala (pesarattu) is another rare item that I don't get in any other  indian restaurants in the US. The sambar and the chutneys served along with dosa are the best. Hyderabadi lamb chops are good. The only thing I didn't like is the wine.
We're surprised by the type of delicious food we got and started exploring the menu further.
I have stumbled upon masala tea and filter coffee. Non-alcoholic drinks were placed in the alcohol menu.
I have never had such a great masala tea and filter coffee.
By the time we finished our dinner, the restaurant was heavily crowded.

Our second visit was for lunch.
Lunch menu is very short. It's just dosas and chat items. I ordered egg dosa which has spicy powder in it along with cilantro and loved it.
Masala tea (tea with spices) is my usual drink.

I recommend you to go to this restaurant early for dinner to get  a wonderful experience.
author: Krishna M.

description: I don't often review, but felt my experience on Friday night warranted some feedback. I hadn't been to this Valencia location for many years. I made a reservation for 5 people - had to confirm with a credit card so if I canceled within 24 hours I'd be charged $15/pp. Fine. Fast forward to our arrival (on time). Our table wasn't ready. If I'm guaranteeing my reservation with a credit card I would hope we would be seated within 10-15 minutes of the reservation time. Almost 30 minutes later (and in the sweltering heat - there are some serious ventilation issues happening) our table was cleaned and cleared but we were still not seated (hostess was busy with other people arriving, so I had to ask her if we could be seated at our table). In the meantime, we had been subjected to some *serious* attitude from the bartenders. I've lived in this city for 20 years so I'm used to service with attitude but this was some outrageous eye rolling, non sensical sarcasm just for trying to figure out who to order a drink from while we were waiting for our table. Ugh. We were seated at our table and thank goodness our waiter was wonderful (I wish I knew his name - he was our saving grace). We ordered a bunch of stuff as per his recommendation. Everything was delicious but the timing was off. And it was even more sweltering at the tables than it was at the bar. After we left, we all reeked of fried food because of the ventilation issues. Not sexy. Very long story short, food is great but some serious facilities and staff problems.
author: Tara K.

description: Excellent service at the bar- Ask for Ryan !! Amazing ambience!! Great food... not spicy - just perfect!
author: G A.

description: Just go here. Do it. You are worth it. And get the Prawn Masala and Lamb Sliders along with whatever else you decide to get. Aaaaaaaaamazing.
author: Rachael S.

description:
i was a little hesitant to give dosa another try, granted the first and only time i went was at the fillmore location like years and years ago, but still..i wasnt impressed by my experience there at all and havent returned.  but i saw their restaurant week menu and was like OHHH, so many options! such value! we must go for girls night! so i made a reservation, and came on wednesday at 8. place was packed! we grabbed a drink at the bar first and got seated immediately when there was an opening for us.

for $40 a person, we got to pick 3 courses each - so the 3 of us ended up with NINE different dishes. NINE! and all were SHAREABLE. it was ridiculous how generous they were with portions.  to start, we had the lamb slider (tender and yummy), beet croquette (super interesting!), and seafood chowder (my gf's LOVED and devoured).  then it was a round of dosas - lamb keema (side of minced lamb and peas and diced potato) was soooo good i ate most of it, winter uttapam with potatoes, and something that was more flatbread like. i really enjoyed that each was paired with 3 very delicious dipping sauces - so much spice and flavor in each! and THEN we moved into entrees. my fave item BY FAR is the super tender and deeelicious goat briyani. omgosh. soo good. i would come back again and again for this item! the chettinad chicken was awesome as well with the lemon rice, and the fish curry we didnt even touch (packed for lunch) because we were so full. 

awesome experience at dosa. the service was quick and attentive as well, and they spaced out the courses nicely.  we also had delicious cocktails that complemented the food in terms of flavor and spice. overall great.
author: Christina L.

description:
Eh, Not my thing...
Honestly many items we had were just too spicy. Don't get me wrong, I like my spice but you couldn't taste soo many other flavors that were in the dishes due to the overwhelming spiciness :( my party of 4 agreed.
We went for restaurant week & the 1st course items were pretty small.
The place was packed & as a result service was not great :/. Our sever was very nice but our water glasses ran dry many times & were left that way for too long :( This cannot happen @ an Indian restaurant, that's just unacceptable.
The items we had:
-Mango lassi- great! Not sure how you can mess that up though...
1st course
-Mandarin lentil salad- not refreshing this we had hoped :/
-The kebab- ARE YOU KIDDING ME? one teeny tiny pieces of meat & a sauce that really just killed my pallet even though I had a mango lassi
-Minced chicken samosa- okay
2nd course
-Fennel & Spinach Dosa- okay
-Paneer & peas Dosa- was my favorite
-Spicy Dosa- the main filling was potatoes which were fine but super cold because all of the dosas were brought out at the same time (which I understand) but was still a bummer
3rd course
-Prawns- they were cooked well but the sauce wasn't great
-Lamb chops were excellent & the sauce was fantastic
-Goat Biryani- pretty good
Dessert
-chi tea- okay
- Seasonal sorbet which last night was mandarin orange & was really refreshing  & the perfect end to our meal! It also tasted really fresh & like there were no artificial flavors at all.
author: Ashley G.

description:
After seeing that all the restaurants in the Mission area we were in required an hour late, and we were starving, we were lucky enough to score a table at 830 on a Friday night here by just walking in. We were ready to eat and drink!

Ordered a bottle of pinot grigio, but it was a rose color. Still very tasty, and we were happy with our choice. The papadums are so tasty, and with our side of raita ($4.50), the two went superbly together.

We ordered two appetizers, the shammi kebabs and the cochin calamari. For entrees, we ordered the chicken and eggplant bharta with a side of coconut rice and the tomato and onion uttapam. The appetizers came with 2 mini uttapams as well.

The food is quite tasty here, and the spiciest Indian cuisine I've had. Even their mint chutney had a kick to it! I enjoyed the kebab on the mini uttapam, but enjoyed the calamari much more. The fresh squid was swimming in a bath of a makhani type sauce, which I loved. The side salads were also refreshing.

The chicken and eggplant bharta was pretty good too. The coconut rice was the most flavorful I've ever had, actual pieces of dried coconut all throughout the bowl of rice! The uttapam, I could care less for, and again, it was spicy! I definitley cannot handle spicy as I used to!

All in all, a great meal with friends, and prices were very fair. I think next time I will have to try the huge dosa, as it looked enticing from watching others eat it. Great service here too, one of the workers took 3 different pictures for us gals as we were leaving!
author: Denise L.

description: Good tasting food. Decent service. But, the menu is super difficult to read (even with eyeglasses on) because the typography is way too small.
author: Scott A.

description:
Has the potential to be great but falls just short sadly. Menu is perfect with something just for everyone-- and drinks that are actually different than what you'd find anywhere else! Get the "Aaram Se" which means "relax, take it easy" in Tamil where the bartender makes something with your liquor of choice! 

Unfortunately though, the dosas come out cold which is what makes the meal a bit lacking. Perhaps ask the server for something fresh of the stove next time you're there!
author: Pooja R.

description:
Went to this place on a Saturday afternoon. Had a Kerala egg curry and my wife had a Mysore masala dosa. 

Kerala egg curry was amongst the best I've ever had. Lovely coconut flavor. 

Personable staff and the manager was very knowledgeable about the food and the menu.
author: Amiyo C.

description:
Excellent service.  Sumptuous feast for dinner. Each dish cooked to perfection. Wonderful dining experience until someone turned the music way up such that the heavy beat
totally blocked off the conversation my dining partner and I were having.  We couldn't hear each other from then on.  So we left.  Fortunately we had finished eating but would have stayed a bit longer and considered dessert.
author: Laila K.

description:
Wish they play Indian music, not America pop music please. It's feels strange to eat curry hearing Mariah Carey. I'm happy with the glutin free selection. And good knowledge of the staff about glutin free very professional. 
Good bar table it's made of comfy Shiny stone.
author: Jov T.

description:
Spring tasting menu is a good way to taste a wider range of their menu.
Everything is good here.
Sheer Khan and Peony : favorite cocktails
author: Sridevi K.

description:
Been coming to Dosa for ages. Food is good, but the Valencia location service is Poor  - they forgot to bring a couple of items despite being reminded about them a second time. They charged it to the bill. When told, they said they'd take them out and knock out more items. Turns out they didn't even correctly take off the charges. We were so tired of waiting, we just paid and left.

Stick with Fillmore location.
author: Anand P.

description: Went after passing by this spot a couple of times in the mission with a South Indian friend. Ordered the Chettinad chicken, Dahi vada, paper masala dosa, and the Mysore dosa and they did please. Was scared it wouldn't live up to my friend's expectations since I had suggested the place. But was relieved to hear that after testing out so many dosa spots in the Bay Area since coming here, this was easily the most authentic and closest and most perfect comparison to the ones she's had back home. She also ordered one to go for her family to enjoy as well! Overall, I highly recommend DOSA, it was delicious and service was amazing!
author: Nadine C.

description:
We tried dinner at Dosa on Valencia.  We took Bart & got off at 24th St Bart & walked to 21st & Valencia.

No reservations we got a table since it wasn't too busy yet after 6pm.

FREE papadums - crunch & light, no sauces given though.  They have a Full Bar.

I picked Broccoli Rabe Dosa $13 - it was cut into 3 dosa filled w/ broccoli rabe, side of Samba (soup) & coconut chutney & the orange sauce.  It was pretty good & filling.

B. got the Daily Special Masala Rock Cod $21 - rock cod w/ spicy sauce, small scoop of lentil rice & brussel sprout poriyal.  He liked his dish.

He got a Glass of White Wine $9 & a glass of Gin & Tonic $10 - boozer liked them.

Our total before tip $59.81.  Charged it.

Bathrooms: Go out door in the back right, then turn Left there's 2 unisex bathrooms.
author: Ann L.

description:
It was just about okay.

The place is cramped, with very little space to move. The service is just about above average. And finally, the food is also just about okay, if not worse. I ordered Vada & Dosa, and I was disappointed on both fronts.

It was definitely NOT a good value for my time & money.
author: Varun S.

description:
This was one of  the best Indian meals I have ever had, and I am a great fan of Indian cuisine. There were 5 of us at the dinner and we ordered the prix fixe meal for larger parties.  I do not suggest this.  It was much to much food and our meal was not timed properly.  We intended to dine leisurely, expressed this to the server, but our meal was very rushed.  In addition, we were constantly having to search for our server for additional drinks and wine.  The service was very neglectful and poorly timed.

However, the food was so excellent that all of us will definitely go again, but we will control the pace as we order.
author: MONA R.

description:
Pros:
 - Paneer masala dosa was very tasty!
 - Restaurant was clean and good looking on the inside.

Cons:
- Their standard masala dosa wasn't anything special.
- It was uncomfortably hot inside.

Overall:
- You can probably get better quality South Indian food for cheaper elsewhere. Would go back, but not in any hurry to.
author: Sid D.

description: Went to see a show at The Marsh and decided to try Dosa because its yelp rating and proximity to the venue. Upon arriving I was afraid there'd be a long wait because it was packed!!!! Luckily a seat for two had just become available. The service was great...fast, friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, etc. The food wasn't mind blowing, but it was fresh and good.i wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but I'd go back if I was in the area.
author: Delois D.

description: Awesome - the lamb shank was delicious and the mysore masala dosa was super tasty.  Also Chennai Chicken was great!!  Love this place :)
author: Labonee M.

description:
I love me a good dose o' the dosa. It's quickly become one of my favorite dishes, especially when packed with a generous portion of veggies. I ordered the Sweet Potato Dosa, which is described as also having "ginger, shallots, chiles & curry leaves". It sounded incredible, so I had to have it. 

All of the dosas come with "coconut & tomato chutneys and sambar, a flavorful lentil dipping soup made with vegetables and spices".  I thought the chutneys were good, but not great. The sambar was flavorful, but I prefer the version at Vik's Chaat, as this version was a little less spicy. 

I think (at least for us vegan folks) it would be nice if vegan options were clearly labeled right on the menu. Our server seemed less than enthused for having to wait on a table of two vegans. She told us that no appetizers were suitable for us except for the soups and salads, which was very disappointing. 

After some scanning of their online menu post-dinner, it appears that there is a Happy Hour menu somewhere, but I did not see it on our table. Was it perhaps hiding on the back of the drink menu? I would have appreciated if our waitress had suggested it to us, as it was our first time there. No worries, though. My Hanging Gardens cocktail (while expensive) was quite tasty. It was comprised of vodka, beet juice nectar, lemon juice, ginger liqueur, long pepper. I could have easily drank 2 or 3 more of these, but at $11 a pop, they are a little too steep for my more humble income bracket.

If the service was a bit more enthusiastic and more vegan appetizers were added, I might bump this one up to a four. There is a pleasant atmosphere inside, especially on a hustling, bustling Friday night. 

The hostess was just lovely (wow, what a beautiful smile!), and she and a handsome fellow bid us a fond farewell at the door. It was great to end on a high note. 

Helpful hint: if you have any dietary restrictions, there is a really handy dandy chart on their website that will guide you in the right direction. Enjoy!
author: Brandi W.

description: The best south Indian food I have tasted in the US in my last 4-5 years of visit/living here.. Great variety (including both south and north Indian) in the menu; authentic yet modern; traditional and experimental at the same time- just the kind I like.. We had Masal dosa and Dosa with Kheema; Pani Poori as starter. The Dosas were just right, just the right amount of spice/tamarind and curry leaf seasoning in the Sambar, fresh and yummy coconut chutney! The surprising elements came with the cocktails: Flower Child, a cocktail with turmeric - one HAS to try it! I got so excited that I had to barge in to talk to the bartender to the manager to the cooks to congratulate them!! I am looking forward to trying their brunch special Thalis sometime soon..
author: Ashwini B.

description: Takes 1 hour to serve a beer! Are you kidding me forget about rest of your order! Overpriced pos
author: T- B.

description: Went here at 9:35 and the place was closed. Not sure if this should be a review for yelp or for this place but I didn't get my dosa so one of you deserves one star.
author: Mihir S.

description: Excellent cocktails. Probably the best indian food ever. A little bit under staffed, service was a bit long.
author: Frank D.

description: Over cooked lamb chops at $28 and indifferent service.I ate one and took the other one home. Ate it the next day and it was just as bad as the night before . Won't go back!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Mediocre indian food, I've had better.
I went for lunch and everything felt old and stale as if it had been sitting out. It's a nice place with a fun environment but the food didn't do it for me. 
I ordered a masala dosa and it lacked spice and most of all freshness. 
If you're trying indian food for the first time or are just looking for a good place to try, recommend going to a more authentic place as this one felt a little 'commercial'.
author: Layla J.

description:
This may have been one of the best meals of my life. The atmosphere is exciting, and sultry. The lighting is perfect, and the service is outstanding. 
We ate family style - We tried the Chennai chicken as an app, and this was a show stopper for me, I think I'd have to say my favorite part of the meal. Tangy, sweet, and so unique. We also got their fries. Im a fry snob. I seek the best. And these fries- left me aching for more. They are so delish.
My mom, who is from Iowa - got the chicken masala which everyone agreed was the best main dish. They made it less spicy for her, and it was perfect. Although I think it would have been great with the original amount of spice as well. We got the dosa sampler which came with all these different dipping sauces. It was tasty but nothing to write home about. 
The waitress suggested this puffy bread - which I will dream about til I die. It was sweet, crisp, and so tantalizing. I've never had anything like it.
I will never forget this meal, and if I ever come back to San Fran, this is the first rez I'm making. Thanks Dosa. I Love you.
author: Sara V.

description: The food was good.  The rolled up newspaper looking thing was good. Great drinks
author: Phil B.

description:
I really like this place! Great food that is fun to eat, laid back vibe, with friendly servers and bartenders. 

I've been here for dinner twice now, and had a good experience each time. Let me first say that I do not consider myself an Indian food expert by any means, and I've only had the usual naan and curry dishes from other places. On my most recent trip here, I ordered the calamari, the prawn masala, bhatura, and the sweet potato dosa to share with my girlfriend. 

I'd say that the calamari was reminiscent of ceviche, except with stronger flavor from the spices. Take caution if you cannot handle spicy food. This dish packed a lot of heat! It also came with uttapams (small savory pancakes), which were very flavorful as well. 

Next came the sweet potato dosa. A dosa is sort of like a crepe that you can get filled with a variety of fillings. The sweet potato filling was alright, just mashed sweet potato with a conservative amount of spices mixed in. I would actually prefer the dosa plain next time because I like the crispier edge pieces. The dosa came with a few dipping sauces: a warm lentil soup sauce and a variety of different chutneys. They were all really good. I was already pretty full by the time we finished the dosa.

Our prawn masala entrée came next. You can get these served with rice, but we decided to try the bhatura. I was afraid that we wouldn't even get close to finishing the bhatura because that thing was HUGE. Thankfully, it's just because the dough expands a lot when it cooks, and is mostly hollow. The prawn masala was SO good. The flavors were and strong were on point, and the shrimp were cooked perfectly. I wish it came with more prawns though. 

We were stuffed by the end of our meal and had leftovers to pack. Next time, I will definitely stick to ordering one appetizer and entrée, and either a bhatura OR plain dosa and not both.
author: Rosanna K.

description:
All the dosas and uthappams I've tried here are great. Also tried the egg curry once and that was also very nice. My favorite South Indian place in San Francisco.

There's also a good ambience and feel to the place.
author: Samay S.

description:
Why is it that every time we come to Dosa, something isn't right? If it's not being screwed by the prefixed menu, it's food, or service. 

Last night it all started great. A nice server that gave us exactly what we ordered but when our mains came, never came to check in. I finished my wine and was ready for another glass but our server had disappeared. No one ever came to see if we wanted another round of drinks. We finished our meals with water and finally after 10 minutes past finishing our entrees a completely different server/busser came picked up our plates and asked us if we needed anything else. Well yes the check please. At that moment our experience had been so runed down that we didn't even want to check the dessert menus.

On our way out we saw our original server in another section of the restaurant. I assume she got moved there half way through our meal and our section never got a server reassigned ... Bad management I guess.

So see you in a year Dosa and thanks for reminding us why we only come once a year.
author: Isabel P.

description: This place is highly rated from foodies. No reservations were required and no wait for Sunday brunch.  Its not bad but don't know about authenticity. It is popular with millennials who have overtaken the neighborhood  and like trendy. Not critical but feel it might be over-hyped.
author: Smooth X.

description:
Simply awesome. Tasty, hip interpretations of Indian dishes. Service was attentive. The Valencia location is much smaller than the one on Fillmore. The paper-thin Dosas are unusual and a real treat.

UPDATE: If you've tried DOSA's offerings via UberEATS, know that the options on that menu do not do it's brick and mortar locations justice. The location on Fillmore is also amazing and has a more formal ambiance than the Valencia location.
author: Irina P.

description: Everytime I visit SFO,I come here to have Dosas.Scrumptious food and great ambience!  Servers are friendly and polite. 5 stars in all aspects!
author: Shelka U.

description:
Dope a$$ dosas here at Dosa!

I had the pleasure to dine with a large group of people and we wow-ed down on the food here. Everything from the kale and mung Salad, kofta, masalas and just so many dosas, were fantastic. It was a meal where everyone was eyeballing the plates, even when there was nothing left on them. Stare long enough and maybe food will appear! Not. Anyway, everyone was equally satisfied with the drinks and mine, Mango is the New Black, was just so easy to swig back and got me nice and ripe for the eve. Any Indian food fan should come here... and send me your leftovers.
author: Drew A.

description:
We went a day before Valentine's Day and had the Valentine's Day menu speciality truffle dosa with kale masala , the most oily food I have eaten in a long time! The presentation on the menu made it seem very healthy and light 
My husband had a keema masala dosa and that was bland and oily too.
The quality of food has come down since we first started going here
author: Aarti G.

description:
Vegetarian Thali = Food Coma!

Their thali platter was delicious. I loved everything on it, the dosa, the idli soaked in podi and ghee, the squah in coconut sauce curry which was out of the world, the eggplant ghosthu which i couldn't stop eating, the raita, the rasam, the sambhar, the rasmalai OMG I ate so much I couldn't walk!

Only let down was the lemon rice, who makes it using basmati rice? 0-0 But why I didn't like it was I could not taste the flavor of lemon juice on it.

Friends had the south indian moons, the vada sambhar, the habanera dosa ( yes, it is super spicy) and I wonder how he finished it! Sample the sauce before you decide to get it. 

All of them loved their food, some mentioned that the sambhar was full of ghee ( not that it's a bad thing but it makes it all the more authentic :)) In Southern India, restaurants like MTR and Vidya Bhavan pride themselves in using ghee in all thier dishes and Dosa retains this authenticity :)

Love love love..coming back soon
author: Harsha G.

description: Innovative cuisine that is unique in a welcoming happy environment.  My husband and two children and I ate here and it was really good and a refreshing change to the usual restaurant choices.  We had the chicken , shrimp and lamp from the small plates menu, and we added the dosa big puff.  Fun fun fun.  Oh and the drinks were really unique
author: M. R.

description: Dosa os one of the best south indian food places in the city. Their presentation and preparation of food is hygienic and tasty. I'm always visiting this or the Fillmore location every once in awhile and I highly recommend experimenting with their menu options
author: Nitish S.

description:
This has become my go-to nicer lastish minute dinner or brunch spot. Everyone is always happy, full, and impressed.

Cocktails are great.

Food - some of the apps are really small, and when they say spicy, they mean spicy, but overall, everything is awesome!

The apps are super flavorful and delicious, I generally try the more fusion-y ones because I want the more classical dishes to taste exactly the way they did when I was growing up (lamb sliders are great, chennai chicken is boring, . I always get the truffle masala dosa (so good!), the uttapa variety sampler is great for people who havent had much uttapa.
author: Nors P.

description:
Tried Dosa for the 2nd time! Both were take-out orders The taste of the food just hit the spot! 
I had their:
- Chicken Korma
- Prawn Masala (My favorite) 
- Bharwann Aloo Potatoes
It's really really good, yummy, tasty - just brilliant. The last time I tasted Indian food at such yumminess level was when I visited London (Indian food in London is the best).

I would have given it a 5-stars if they would change the balance of the pricing of the food and size portion. At the moment, price is expensive and portion is rather small -- appetizers' size. 

Will I go back despite the portion and the price? Unfortunately, yes -- because it's just so good and I love good food.
author: Hendry C.

description:
Great vibe, space and hangout. We had a big table and got to sit upstairs! We started with the chutney sampler, which we couldn't get enough of and the kebab sliders.
I love chickpeas, so I got the channa bhatura and shared a massala dosa.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Perfect place for vegetarians! Cute, quaint restaurant nestled in the mission with gorgeous artwork and Indian accents decorating the seating and walls. I highly suggest ordering family style and sharing dishes with others to try out the different types. The dosas are light and airy but crispy on the outside at the same time. They have three signature sauces: a red tomato sauce and green yogurt cilantro which is my favorite and quite mild. The coconut chutney and paneer were both delicious and the food was incredibly filling as well. The experience is wonderful and you get to use your hands to eat just like a little a kid! They also have bar seating and their cocktails are strong and delicious!
author: Lisa H.

description: Coconut chicken masala was so delicious! It's the perfect amount of spiciness with a hint of coconut. Can't wait to go to dosa again! And I want to try their giant bread next time! Gimlet was good too. Although the glass was probably too small.
author: Sofia Q.

description: Good food - spicy and different. Service was below par. Part of the food was very delayed - I had to remind them.
author: Pratap K.

description: I ordered 3 things: 2 orders of rice and 1 order of potatoes. I found a small cockroach in my rice, I found a hair in my potatoes, and another hair in my other order of rice. DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I don't know how this place is still open. So dirty! Hopefully I don't get sick later
author: Cass D.

description: Went here last week. We had a list of things we wanted to try. Waitress talked us out of everything and insisted we eat her suggestions. All of which were average and uninpsired. Not only did she insist on her selection, but when we asked about beer, she recommended two beers and couldn't explain why. I asked her what she meant by the Pilsner 'being hoppie' and she said 'uh, i really don't know i'm not a beer drinker' (after emphatically recommending two beers). More frustratingly she never came back to our table to see how we were enjoying her recommended dishes. She destroyed our order and never checked in to see if we were satisfied. Was a terrible experience. Fortunately the manager Michelle was very caring and apologized and comped our din, for which we were appreciative. But the experience was substandard and the service fairly amateurish.
author: Jason W.

description:
Dosa is our favorite Indian fusion restaurant!
We Make It A Point To Go See CHRIS at the Bar. He is just the Best! Our favorite cocktail is Steph Curry! Yes that is the name of the Drink! And Chris is the Master in making it. The atmosphere is really cozy and friendly! So we keep coming back because of the wonderful staff at Dosa.
author: Omar K.

description:
Dosa was spot on the moment we walked in the restaurant and earned each of the five stars. I have tried to convince my better half for YEARS to try Indian cuisine, but he objected every single time until now. 

We ordered a bottle of AR Guentota Malbec that had a perfect mixture of sweetness and spice with each sip. Got to our table and a bit overwhelmed by the menu we asked the manager to explain the courses which he was more than happy to do so.  He took the time to detail the difference between a dosa and a uttapam and suggested the Chicken Karavali as an entree which I ordered.  The menu even has a note specific to "first timers" like us and how we should order.  Nice touch!

There was nothing and I mean nothing that we were disappointed in! The dosa we got had mushrooms, onions, and an egg on top which next time I will ask for an extra egg because it really complemented the flavors. 

I love spicy foods and the Chicken Karavali had the right amount of kick to it. And the coconut rice? Hands down delicious!

We walked out of Dosa two very full and satisfied customers. We walked six blocks down Valencia and couldn't stop talking about how great of an experience we had!
author: Mary L.

description: Restaurant Week!! We tried it all, and it was amazing. So glad we made reservations as there was a line out the door. We had about an hour before our we had to leave for a show. When we asked the server if it still made sense to do the pre-fix menu her confident answer was: "of course! If you eat fast!" There was essentially 7 dishes we tried, all super delicious. The lamb shank dish and scallop dish stood out as amazing. Indeed we ate fast and was out of there within an hour. The place was packed, service was great, ambiance was friendly and casual. Definitely should go, but make a reservation!!
author: Sarah K.

description: The place looked really nice at night from the outside, so I've been wanting to go for a long time. Service was really good, food was okay- expected more flavor. The curry is $30?! If I go back I'll get the lamb sliders again.
author: Michelle A.

description:
The service was great and the cocktails inventive and delicious, but that was not enough to overcome the meager and mediocre at best tasting food. 

I understand South Indian food is different than the Indian food we traditionally encounter in CA, but everyone in Southern India must be vegetarian and on a supermodel diet. Summary: from the food we tried and saw others trying, they fill up paper bags with air, fry them and then serve them to you with salsa.
author: Kevin C.

description:
So seeing as the other Dosa is probably my fav food in z world I'm pretty stoked about this place too.

The tastiest Indian food ever. And this place is cool because it's so small (compared to the other dosa) so you can sit at the bar. The vibe is always sexy.
author: Ray S.

description:
Oh my god. Never again. The beer was good. The lemon rice tasted like a potted plant. The chicken dish was all bones. The lentil fritters was a bowl of yogurt. The rice was served with a thumb in it. My stomach was turning the second I left. 

On top of it all, the bill was presented with the wrong suggested tip amount. It was twice what it should have been on a split bill. 

I rarely write reviews anymore. Yes, it was THAT BAD.
author: Joe H.

description: Is it so expensive because of the ridiculous number of staff? The food is okay but $26 for a curry is just ridiculous. Also the hosts at the front aren't very friendly and try to push you to the bar area even if there are tables available.
author: Natalie S.

description: This place is delicious! It is actually really hard to get a spot, so you should make a reservation or come very early. The food is fresh is really affordable, and the service is helpful! I guess it is my favorite indian restaurant in SF!
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description:
What a delightful place, phenomenal service and amazing food. To say I am an amateur to Indian food is an understatement. For years I have had an ignorant prejudice against any Indian food. Why you may ask, no specific reason but pure ignorance and naïveté. Recently thru my travels I have found myself open to new experiences, cultures, and foods unknown to me. Maybe it's an appreciation for the unknown or an appreciation for life in general. Whatever the reason I find myself open to trying new things in all aspects. 

That said tonight's dinner was truly an experience for me, both in flavor and ambiance. The management at Dosa was extremely helpful. They spent time going over the menu and explaining how best to order my meal. My waitress was also very helpful and made some great suggestions for pairings. 

I ordered the Marsala Prawns and Louisiana Shrimp Curry was delicious. To say this dish blew me away would be an understatement. The Dosa complimented my main dish and the rice was the final added touch. I was truly blown away by the foreign flavors to my palette. The service and the Malbec bottle wine also helped in the cause. What an eventful and memorable evening...thank you Dosa!
author: Alexander L.

description:
I've been here twice over the time of a year and both times the paper dosa were really good.  They were crispy and not overly oily and also has a nice spice if you ask for it.

I've also tried their spinach and fennel and it's flavor is also nicely blended, but I always prefer paper dosas because it picks up the flavor of the chutneys and sambar better.

They are busy so make a reservation but even if you arrive a few minutes behind they are good about it.  

Their chat and galub jamam are both delicious together. 

Service is good, not great but friendly and polite. Definitely worth a visit if you are in mission, not a lot of good places for South Indian in SF.
author: Jannies L.

description:
This place is normally very crowded (and for a good reason), so I didn't get around to trying it until a few weeks ago when I was visiting one of my friends in the Mission. We were actually walking to another restaurant, but when we noticed that it wasn't too busy, we decided to stop and check it out.

I started off with the Mango is the New Black cocktail which has rye, mango nectar, lemon juice, and spiced agave. The flavors melded together very well to give the cocktail and slightly sweet and slightly peppery taste. However, considering that my food was a little spicy, I wish I had picked a drink that didn't have any spice. 

For my main course, I had the lamb pepper fry with lemon brown rice. Wow! The seasoning on this dish was perfect and it had a nice amount of heat. The lamb was cooked perfectly and was very tender. I would highly recommend this dish. 

For dessert, my friend and I shared the apple walnut tart which was delectable and not too sweet. 

Our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We got served our food relatively quickly too. 

Although Dosa is a bit pricey for an Indian restaurant, it really is worth the extra money. I would definitely be willing to go again.
author: Ravi S.

description:
5 stars for exquisite food
1 star for extremely horrible service. Had to wait 30 minutes for a reservation and then food was delivered an hour after ordering. Even then forgot 1 dosa out of 4! Never coming back to this location again
author: Vaibhav S.

description: I love this place (I don't usually like (north) Indian restaurants, but South Indian will usually sway me). I never actually went to the restaurant, but have ordered take out twice, so this is just a review of the food, which is AWESOME. They have fantastic veg food (the uttapams, dosas, idlis, and sambar are divine). Delicious coconut rice. They have some kind of pizza like item with chewy mushrooms which I adored. And their lamb dish is to die for - spicy and intense and yummy. Their chicken tenders are also great. All in all - great spot.
author: Abeer H.

description: This place is so yummy and the people that work here are so down to earth and kind. Do NOT be one of those people who visit and don't order a dosa. There is a reason it's named Dosa and that reason is that their dosas are AMAZING. All of them. It doesn't matter which one you order just make sure there is one in your order. You will not be sorry!
author: Jackie G.

description:
I am obsessed with South Indian food.  I had heard that Silicon Valley had a plethora of South Indian restaurants, but so glad I found this one.  There are two things that differentiate this place from other South Indian restaurants:
(a) This place does not smell like Indian food and neither does your hair/clothes after you leave.
(b) This is one of the very few South Indian restaurants that offers non-vegetarian food.

I went to both locations - Valencia and Fillmore.  The one on Valencia is tiny, so definitely make reservations.

Now to the food:
- Vada Paav: to die for.  Probably better than what I have eaten in India.
- Dahi Vada: awesome presentation and decent taste.
- Rava Masala Dosa: AMAZING!!!! The dosa comes with two chutneys....coconut and tomato. Both the chutneys were delicious.
- Keema Lamb Dosa: my hubby ordered this one and cleaned his plate like never before.

TIP:  If you are like me and prefer the masala on the side and not inside the dosa, make sure you emphasize that you dont want extra masala, but just the masala on the side.  I was charged $4.00 because I said 'masala on the side'.  

Overall - one of the best dosa places I have been to.  Just try it to believe it!!!!
author: Ani J.

description:
Dosa has been doin' its thing for quite a while now.  For me, it spawned the whole BFSBWP business model which has proved to be quite successful.  They have an elegant but warm decor filled with a balanced blend of modern and classic south Asian influences.  

The food is exceptional. All the dosas are must-tries and you'll enjoy completing the dosa tour over time.  My favorite is the masala dosa, but you really won't be disappointed with any of them.  Make sure you try them with some of the tomato and coconut chutneys (not normally done but quite delicious so who cares).

Hidden gems are their non-veggie dishes, particularly their lamb curry accompanied with lemon rice.  The lamb is tender and well-seasoned, and the aroma of the thick curry and lemon together is something special.

Last, don't sleep on their cocktails, they do creative things with south Asian spices and conventional liquors!
author: Saminda W.

description:
DOSA on Valencia is more of a casual vibe than its Fillmore counterpart. I saw Thrillist's article about the best, new happy hours of 2015. It didn't take long to get a table and the bar seating was open. The host was kind enough to seat my friend and I right away. We ordered a few cocktails, the Steph Curry and a classic Gin n' Tonic. What I didn't appreciate was the server consistently pestering about ordering food. Clearly, we are enjoying the drinks..can you give us a minute..or 20? Sheesh. 

We eventually settled on the Chennai Chicken, which was tasty but not to die for. 

I would rec DOSA for dinner or drinks only. Not the best HH experience!
author: Shana B.

description:
I love the food here, but my last 3 times at Dosa in SF have been so disappointing! 

This place is way too pricey for the service you get. Everyone I've had as a server or host acts like they are better than you and they are annoyed to be serving you! Last night here was no different! This place needs a management overhaul! 

If you are looking for good food and good service, there are way better options than Dosa in SF! I have written this small chain off and will no longer support this business!
author: Shakira M.

description:
Happy hour is only for the bar. 
People are nice.
Food is good but small plates and expensive.
A bit stuffy.
Lots of rules on reservations so be careful
author: K R.

description:
Incredible food and great cocktails. Authentic South Indian flavors throughout in every dish. Popadam was plentiful and the chutneys deliciously complimented absolutely everything. The cardamom gin and tonic is probably my favorite thing as it cools my tongue down after a habanero-mango dosa. Their salads are very refreshing. I recommend the chickpea, pomegranate salad with lemon juice and goat cheese. Everything delightful pops in your mouth! 

Order desert. You will not regret it.
author: Dee D.

description: The service was excellent the food fabulous.  The music was a little loud and hectic.  We enjoyed ourselves a lot
author: nancy f.

description:
We were on our way to the airport from Napa and decided to stop by here for a quick lunch, given the good things I'd heard. 

The service was very attentive to our time constraints, the ambiance was casual and hip, the food was excellent! The idlis were moist and fresh, the sambhar was so good that I had 3 cups of it, and the dosa was really yummy! Their chaats were not traditional - had avocado, etc, but each item was flavored well.
author: Shradha A.

description:
Strolled in here with some friends after drinking way more than we should have at Dolores Park. We sat at the bar for some reason. Would I have rather sat at a table? Yes. Did my friends listen to me? No.

I ordered the Lamb Keema Dosa which was recommended to me by the persnickety server. This guy was super knowledgable about the food and wines, but seemed a little annoyed at the six indecisive 20-somethings whom he'd been dealt. The lamb was seasoned nicely, had a good texture, and came with some super delicious sauces. The sauces maybe have been the highlight; they were spiced, aromatic, they popped(!)...wowzers. I had actually never had a dosa before this, but it was crispy yet pleasantly chewable. 

Would I come here again? Probably not, as it's a tiny bit overpriced, even for the city. That being said, I don't regret trying it, and if you're looking for some South Indian food in the area, then bingo bongo. 

7.3/10
author: Domenic K.

description:
3.5 solid stars
Why not 4 stars? I feel it is slightly overpriced

Southern Indian food at its best. Personally, I like northern Indian food b/c I prefer naan. Dosa is a little too thin for me--probably less carbs.

Their dosa here is impressive. SUPER large portion sized!

We ordered: 
Dosa-Masala: 4/5 YUM!!
Kerala chicken with dosa: 3.5/5

Overall, good food and service. I would love to come back again.
author: Jen H.

description:
I am sad to update the review with only 3 stars! Went back to Dosa recently and the quality of food is just not as good as it used to be! The sambar lacked flavor and was way too watery. It was their star dish and is just not as good as it used to be. 

Disappointed!
author: Shriya P.

description:
Boy oh boy, I sure do love Dosa. Of the 50 million times I've been here, it's never failed me. AND there has never been an item I've ordered that I can say anything negative about. Even though it's fusion food, it is pureee perfection!

Their vada sliders are UHHH-MAZINGGG
Chana Bhatura - one of the best I've ever had and I am an Indian-food connoisseur. It's the big ol' fluffy pancake-looking things you will almost always see someone ordering.
Dosas - all of them! Especially the mango habanero.
Mango martini
The chutney sampler to try with the papadum

Ooh and it gets packed on most evenings so I would HIGHLY recommend making a reservation beforehand!
author: Tania S.

description: This place is just ok. Not really pleased with the menu and service. It was not an authentic Indian food experience and they had messed up our check with adding items that we didn't order. And the food wasn't that great!
author: Shwetz M.

description: Had the Karaikudi Chicken Korma entrée for dinner with dosa, and the rasmalai for dessert. The chicken was excellently spiced with just the right amount of hot; the meat itself was tender and well marinated, exuding the flavor of the curry very well. The rasmalai was soft and just sweet enough to soften the blow from the curry but not so sweet as to leave a cloying aftertaste in your mouth. All in all, a great experience.
author: Vivek R.

description:
I don't I have ever been to a restaurant and I like almost everything that was served. Definitely a winner. Unfortunately since I didn't do the ordering I can't remember all the dishes we had. There were some that was just okay, but overall it was great. 

I'll update this review when I visit again to be more detailed. Until we meet again Dosa!
author: Mia L.

description: Good, but Indian is not my favorite so I'm a bit biased. We came for a friend's bday and the service was great, despite it being busy on a Friday. My one complaint is that we had to ask and flag down servers on multiple occasions (maybe they were short staffed)? They forgot the potatoes filler, they didn't have hot water for tea, etc. the server that came over was still helpful and the staff was sweet, it just seemed like they were slammed. The other item is that the Yelp menu is no longer valid - the link should be updated. Not sure if that's on the company or Yelp but it's not helpful when trying to order without the menu.
author: Martie A.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Dosa's flavors and gorgeous food. However, Dosa has a special "allergy menu" that's something of a problem. To me, being someone with food allergies (I'm celiac with additional food allergies) an "allergy menu" implies that the wait and kitchen staff are conscientious about the needs of those of us with food allergies. If you have a gluten-free menu, that means the food has to be prepared and cooked separate from other food. I've had many wonderful meals at Dosa and then been sick on my way home and for the rest of the night even though what I ordered supposedly didn't have anything I'm allergic to. My guess is that food is getting cross-contaminated--most likely when it's being cooked. 

Dosa should either get rid of their allergy menu so that those of us with allergies know that the food isn't safe or they should commit to insuring their "gluten-free" menu is actually gluten free and not getting cross-contaminated. There are restaurants in SF that meet the needs of those of us with real food allergies without making us feel like we're being high maintenance or asking too much: Nopalito has tons of gluten-free items and (at least on Broderick) is super careful about cross contamination. Tacolicious will cook food in a separate pan (not on the regular grill) for those who react to cross-contamination. And Delfina and Al's Place are also great at dealing with allergies and and making diner's with allergies not feel like pariahs or assholes. I've always wanted to believe that Dosa was in that camp but time and time again I've ended up sick after a really expensive dinner.

Oh, and their gluten-free dosa chips--at least at the Fillmore location (I'm not 100% about Valencia) get cross-contaminated after a certain time. And their wait staff generally isn't aware that happens. How confusing is that? Seriously, claiming your food is gluten free and then trying to save a couple dollars by cross-contaminating the cooking oil with gluten at a certain time is just about as lame as it gets.

The message is if you have real food allergies, unfortunately, it's probably better to stay home and not be in pain.
author: Beth B.

description: The food was delicious and well worth the packed-in feeling. Service was excellent as well. My friend was visiting from out of town and I wanted her to have a wonderful SF foody experience. We were not disappointed. The yogurt and lentil fritters were perfect with the salad for appetizers and then we split the lamb dosa. Amazing! It was a very hot night in SF and we sweat more due to the spiciness of the meal but it was worth it. Try to go early before the crowd gets there for a better experience.
author: Lesley K.

description: Yummm. We got the South Indian Moons uttapam sampler plate, the Sunchoke & Paneer Kofta, and two orders of basmati rice. It was incredible. The sunchoke/paneer kofta was like nothing I've ever had before. The 'veggie meatballs' tasted amazing and the curry was so rich and unique. The uttapam was delicious and just like little pancakes with amazing ingredients cooked in, like potatoes, onions, and cheese! Check this place out!
author: Lindsay R.

description:
Great Indian restaurant for the ambiance, not so much for the food. As the name suggests, they specialize in South Indian food and have a Western take on traditional dosas and other breakfast foods. 

We got a paper masala dosa and a lamb thali. Dosa was good, but the sambar, tomato chutney, and potato curry were way too thick to eat with the dosa. I would suggest steering away from ordering the thali. Most of the curries were not as hot as they should be (rasam, sambar) and the deserts along with the raita should have been much cooler. It looked pretty though! Service was above average. The owner came to explain everything on the thali, which was a nice touch.
author: Viroopa V.

description: Great service, amazing food and top notch cocktails! Authentic Indian dishes. Desert was phenomenal! My one and only complaint would be the dirty bathrooms. I feel this is always a reflection on the kitchen so it tends to make me nervous. Although here I am the best day and I feel great! :)
author: Suzanne R.

description: Amazing Indian food. Loved the small plates. Great ambience and amazing aromas. Please make sure to get reservations as this place is really popular. Was pleasantly surprised by their cocktail collection. If you are a bourbon lover Steph Curry is a must have.
author: Anurag M.

description:
Nothing phenomenal here. My friend and I came here and were a bit disappointed by our food. I'm always suspicious of "ethnic" restaurants with a hostess and all-white waiters, however the owner has clarified that he's from India and that:

"across both... locations, we have the largest staff of Indians where it counts the most, namely, the kitchen chefs.   However, since we are also a San Francisco restaurant we try very hard to employ people from the local neighborhood! We feel that's a non-judgmental and fair approach to being an SF restaurant!". 

When I last came here, we ordered a dosa, uttapam, and a curry dish. I can't recall what kind we ordered, but the food didn't leave a good impression. I would say that the food is decent and nicely presented, but overpriced.

Due to the fact that the owner Anjan is vigilant on Yelp about seeing how his business can be improved, I'd be more than happy to go back and give Dosa another try.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Went here for spur of the moment dinner last week, and was told there was a 1hr wait for just my date and I! We ended up leaving my phone number and walking around the mission, only to come back over an hour later and the hostess to inform me that she "thought" she'd called me to say there was a table. 

Saddened and hungry, we sat at the bar, and just as we were about to order drinks, she approached us and apologized, offering a table to us while saying that we would have to leave in an hour as a larger party was to arrive. Starved we took it, and this large party never arrived to replace us!

The server was wonderful and our dinner was yummy, but the hostess seemed flustered. Needless to say, we didn't order dessert or any coffee as we were so hungry, it took little to fill our stomachs. 

Might not wait the hour next time.
author: Kristina B.

description: Food is great as ever - but they really need to reduce the number of tables just too crammed together - anyone who is disabled/on crutches finds it very difficult to get around.
author: Bob B.

description:
Great Dosa and other South Indian - loved it ;)

Great place/atmosphere - we hung out for lunch - and had a great experience 

Definitely coming back
author: Mark G.

description: Came here last night for a friend's birthday and couldn't have been more pleased. Food, service and atmosphere were fantastic. The menu usually confuses me a little bit, so we left the decision in the very capable hands of our server. What a treat. He absolutely nailed it. Makes me wonder why I waited so long to come back. Love this place.
author: Jill S.

description:
I had come here the day before for lunch but they weren't open so went to Udupi palace instead. My friend raved about Dosa Palace however and said he preferred their dosa to Udipi Palace so decided to come back the next day for dinner. However, after ordering an appetizer I was so disappointed that I ended up leaving and going back to Udupi Palace. 

Indian food is one of my favourite cuisines and I expect it to be very hearty and traditional. My order at Dosa Palace however didn't taste at all like traditional Indian food. I ordered their lentil fritters with yogurt sauce and I expected it to be pancake size fritters with yogurt sauce on the side or top. Instead I got something that was 90% yogurt with fritter balls that were 1/2" in diameter. While it was very prettily presented, there wasn't enough substance to the dish. I felt like I had basically paid for fancy organic yogurt with Indian flavors. After looking around at the other patron's meals, I decided to pass on the entree. The prices at Dosa Palace were higher than I expected but the portions looked to be smaller than normal. If I'm paying alot of money for food I better be able to have leftovers I can use for another meal. 

While I"m sure many people enjoy Dosa Restaurant, for me it was too fancy to satisfy my craving for authentic Indian food. Since I'm on vacation in San Fran, I'm not trying to eat diet food. This restaurant definitely caters more to people who want organic Americanized Indian food with small portions. 

I do have to give them props for their service though. The host was extremely pleasant and accommodating.
author: Yoshi K.

description:
So this isn't quite Ajanta, but it's pretty darn close and a helluva lot easier to get to for SF residents.

Dosa is a gorgeous, chic restaurant offering Indian-American fusion versions of Indian favorites with an emphasis on different types of dosas. The music is a little too loud, which is probably my only criticism. Everything else is excellent.

Chennai Chicken: Spicy, spice-filled chicken, crisp on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside

Truffle Masala Dosa: The perfect example of Dosa's Indian-American fusion fare. The crepe was the perfect texture--light and fluffy, yet crisp and thick, if that makes any sense. The filling was the quintessential potatoes and spices but with the addition of Italian truffle oil. Did the combination work? Oh my lordy lord, YES!!!

Seasonal Vegetable Curry: My friend's entree for the night. Tasty and healthy and all that good stuff

Rasmalai: Probably my favorite Indian dessert of all time (besides chum chum), and one I always order at any restaurant that offers it. It's funny. I think ordering actually cheese for dessert is for rich morons with no taste, but I've discovered in recent years that I absolutely love desserts made with cheese such as kanafe and rasmalai. Dosa's rasmalai was just perfect. The paneer was clearly freshly made and generous in portion. The malai had the perfect combination of cardamom, sugar, cream, pistachio and rose water. How good was this dessert? Well, my friend who is getting married and has banned herself from having dessert could not stop eating this. Yeah, that's how good it was.

For drinks, I got a custom cocktail with vodka, cardamom, lime and vanilla bean. It was absolutely delicious. Prices wer reasonable for what you get and service was excellent. Next, I want to go to Dosa on Fillmore, which has the same menu but is even larger and prettier.
author: Josephine L.

description:
Their free chips are delicious! I re-ordered 3 times! 

Bhachura: very yummy! my favorite dish of the night! 
Dahi Vada: very pretty dish, like a painting. but it's cold:( it's not yellow color, but it tastes strongly curry! 
southern indian moons:  a great sampler you gotta try 5 types of uttapam! i like the squid and potato ones. 
sunchoke uttapam: this one got too much curry in it, too heavy for it. i'll skip next time. 
fennel & spinach dosa: it's a small dosa, not the big one. so i was disappointed. this one has the most left over in my table. the dosa here is a lot less tasty than the ones i had in India! 

The southern indian moons, dosa, and uttapam all use the same 3 types of sauces: curry soup, green coconut curry, and another type of yellow curry. I don't like their sauces.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Dosa on Valencia is one of those places that I've had bookmarked for a long time and hear a lot of hype about. Somehow, it always evades me, until a recent Saturday morning. 

For hardcore carnivores like me, prepare yourself. Meat item selection is very minimal, so I suggest you embrace it and go with the flow.

- Pani Puri ($8): Traditional small hollow crispy breads served with chickpeas, mung, potatoes, tamarind water, and spicy-sour mint sauce. Make a small hole in the bread, fill it up with all the ingredients, and prepare for the flavor explosion in your mouth. I've had this several times before and they execute it fantastically. Very fresh ingredients and a wonderful combination of flavors, especially the tamarind.

- South Indian Moons Uttapam ($14): Instead of getting one large uttapam for $10-$13, you can try all five for a little bit more. This features the Trumpet Mushrooms, Caramelized Onion and Paneer & Peas uttapams, as well as two others I don't recognize on their menu. Each one has its unique, but delicious flavor. Although a bit westernized, they still feature the distinct South Indian tastes. Trumpet Mushroom is #1 IMO, with Paneer & Peas as a close second. Dipping sauces are also fantastic, especially the tomato chutney.

Although it's not on the menu, they have mango lassis. Unfortunately, they didn't impress. Too thick and dry. 

One big downside is the service. Although our waiter was attentive and efficient, he went a little bit extreme on the former. When you ask for water, it shouldn't come with a lecture on the differences between their sparkling and still selection. He also made our token Indian friend a bit uncomfortable with his condescending attitude and inquiry into whether we knew how to eat all of our dishes.This was accompanied by several minutes of unnecessarily lengthy explanations. I understand he means well, and I appreciate it, but this needs to tone down. I just want to eat my food before it gets cold.

Dosa on Valencia takes a surprisingly semi-upscale approach to traditional South Indian street food, and I approve.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
At over 1500 reviews and 4+ stars I doubt my one baby review will make an impact.

But here is my story....

It was hot out and we had a company dinner planned. A co-worker and I came a little early to get our libations on and cool off from the heat. We sat at the bar and the bartender greeted us with menus. We werent that familiar with what was offered so we asked for advice. After a few Q's from him about our fav drinks he gave us a suggestion. We were 100% so he became insulted. Told us that any 4+ restaurant on yelp will have a bartender you can trust and that we dined more often in SF we would know that. Um. What? Ok asshole. He pretty much ruined what was a good drink by. the. way. 

The food here IS excellent and cannot wait to come back. But may to the Fillmore location where apparently my lack of dinning experience will not be thrown in my face if I ask one to many questions about a drink or doubt their recommendation. 

The bartender hands down needs to come back to earth and get an attitude adjustment.
author: Michelle I.

description: I don't often review, but felt my experience on Friday night warranted some feedback. I hadn't been to this Valencia location for many years. I made a reservation for 5 people - had to confirm with a credit card so if I canceled within 24 hours I'd be charged $15/pp. Fine. Fast forward to our arrival (on time). Our table wasn't ready. If I'm guaranteeing my reservation with a credit card I would hope to be seated within 10-15 minutes of the reservation time. Almost 30 minutes later (and in the sweltering heat - there are some major ventilation issues happening) our table was cleaned and cleared but we were still not seated (hostess was busy with other people arriving, so I had to ask her if we could be seated at our table). In the meantime, we had been subjected to some *serious* attitude from the bartenders. I've lived in this city for 20 years so I'm used to service with attitude but this was some outrageous eye rolling, non sensical sarcasm just because I asked politely who to order a drink from while we were waiting for our table (it was unclear who was doing what behind the bar, and nobody bothered to ask us if we'd like a drink). Ugh. We were seated at our table and thank goodness our waiter was wonderful (I wish I knew his name - he was our saving grace). We ordered a bunch of stuff as per his recommendation. Everything was delicious but the timing was off. And it was even more sweltering at the tables than it was at the bar. After we left, we all reeked of fried food because of the ventilation issues. Not sexy. Very long story short, food is great but they need to fix the facilities and bartender staff problems.
author: Tara K.

description: The hospitality, food and whole experience was amazing! Thank you DOSA for an incredible evening. The wait staff and manager never rushed you, made excellent recommendations and gave the most thorough descriptions to ensure everyone was satisfied! Five stars isn't enough for this place. HIGHLY recommend making a visit here. Be sure to make a reservation in advance, too! Thank you DOSA!
author: Nadia N.

description:
Clearly the best overall experience.

1. Staff actually spends the time to explain the complex Indian dishes
2. Impeccable service
3. Food taste fresh, authentic and just absolutely out of this world
4. Amazing cocktails
5. Amongst the best wine lists you will see at an Indian place
6. They actually pair wines with the complexity of Indian dishes
7. Super reasonably priced. Frankly too low for the quality of the experience!!

Absolute must visit place...
author: Kunal M.

description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for Dosa! It's one of my favorite spots in the mission and I've been going to it since 2007. The food quality is as good as ever and their happy hour menu is a great option for a lite bite. My favorites: Vada Pav and the Mysore masala dosa. Oh, and for dessert the rasmalai is excellent. Best drink - the peony, it has a red pepper in it..so it's definitely got a kick to it.
author: Hema P.

description:
Well. Dosa over there is good but gets nullified because of the impudent waiter that we happened to receive.

Things went fine till the time we ordered and finished. Came the time for the bill. And we see that bill has 3 extra items added, which we dint order.

(1). Called the waiter and apprised him of 1st item which we dint order. He without listening further took the bill, went back and came with that one item taken off.

(2). Apprised him of 2nd item, and before I could reach to 3rd item, he again vanished, without listening and came back taking 2nd item off.

(3). Okay this time, i told him "You will have to listen to me completely before you leave" . Told him about 3rd item, and then he left, came back and almost banged the bill tray (of the wood) on our table. Utter disgust on his behavior.

No apologies for intentionally or unintenionally over charging me, not listening to me completely and then you come up with your tantrums and disrespect.

I feel sorry for you for your behavior and Dosa having these people as their front face.
author: Rahul M.

description: We went to Dosa last weekend for the first time in a year or two. The dosa and uttapam we ordered were delicious, but I noticed they are serving fewer dipping sauces than they used to, which made me a little sad. I would be happy with smaller amounts of more flavors. Also, is it possible that the seating got more cramped? I don't remember being bumped by servers before and it happened at least three times because our table was next to a very narrow path to the kitchen. My cocktail was perfect and this place will always remain a favorite for all its vegetarian options.
author: Johanna L.

description:
This is hands down my FAVORITE restaurant in SF so far... it's super vegan friendly, and all of its dishes have delicious flavors mixed into traditional South Indian food! 

I ordered the White Truffle Masala Dosa and the Kale Pakoras. 
Both dishes are phenomenal. 

The ambience and service are amazing!

I can't wait to go back and try their other items!!!
author: Shalini P.

description: OMG! Amazing food, lovely atmosphere & GREAT bartender (Charles). We sat at the bar and did a little wine tasting -- thanks Charles! We went with their Cabernet Franc (can't remember the brand). The food was over the top, unbelievable. We had the Lamb Fry Chicken Masala & their Vegetable Korma. All three were Charles' recommendation and he did NOT steer us wrong. I will definitely come back to repeat our experience!
author: LaVon C.

description:
I'm not a GF eater, but almost everything on the menu is gluten-free. Also, the menu is the majority vegetarian. 

Cozy little spot.  Good service. Small drink menu, but some nice selections, especially with the beer. 

A menu full of southern Indian delights that you may not be familiar with. No fear, the waitperson can explain. The dosas are delicious. Perfect for sharing. Lots of different options. 

I recommend trying the chutney sampler - but beware, it's A LOT of chutney (a lot for two people to handle). Chennai chicken is tasty and the sauce is a perfect match. 

Great spot for a casual dinner or a date.
author: Mark M.
