description: Dosa is always a great place to go. I love their food and their ambience. Masala Dosa and Mushroom Uttapam are delicious, as is the mango Lasi. I wish there was something similar in the South Bay! It's sorely needed.
author: Janaina P.

description:
Recommended by a friend, we went to check it out. Group of 4, long lines and crowded seating, once we got seated. Food was almost entirely spicy, even when it stated mild.. so I really didn't enjoy it all that much. 
While I usually don't mention service, as I am not that picky (as long as you get my food, you're okay) -- these guys made an impression of being trained at Dick's Last Resort (for those of you who don't know that place, they greet you with sarcasm and continue to carry it throughout your meal. It's an experience and they do "warn" you). 

No patio, and I wouldn't suggest you make your children sit in this crowded seating arrangements. It's plain out suffering even for adults :) Parking on the street, and good luck!
author: Matea F.

description: We had the chutney sampler, chennai chicken, paper masala dosa and Chana Batura. Well chutney sampler was average, chennai chicken was bland. It's basically fried chicken served with a small amount of salad and chutney. The paper masala dosa and Chana Batura was good. However the proportions were not. The condiments were less in amount to the bread. The ambience is good though.
author: Joyeta S.

description:
The food was strictly okay. My favorite was the paneer dosa. This is the only reason why they get 3 stars. And also the bartender who waited on us for 2 minutes before we got the table was very peasant and accommodating. 

What irked me about this place was the service. The woman waitressing us was inattentive. I had to stop what I was doing, wait for her highness to stand somewhere near me, and wave my hands around to grab her attention. (She was only waitressing 3 tables including ours). 

I'm not sure why the Bay Area sucks when it comes to these things. I'm pretty sure it's a simple concept - people come to restaurants to be served. So don't you think servers and their subsequent service need to be high on your priority list? 

I will not be coming here again. With the variety of dosa places available there is no need to have to subject myself to this nonsense.
author: D M.

description:
Overall, our experience here was pretty underwhelming. Given how close Udupi Palace is to this place, I was a little  surprised at how crowded as it was. 

Within our party, we shared a couple of dosas and some small and large plates. The dosas were solid and probably reasonable for the price, but I've had better within a stones throw of this restaurant. 

The calamari appetizer was a letdown, with tough squid and the same sauce as the prawn masala that we end up getting as well. Definitely don't get these two items together, as the flavor becomes very redundant quickly. 

My recommendation would be to stick to the doses or maybe some small plates with a Channa Bhatura (the big pillow like doughy thing) to help soak it up. The large plates are too expensive with too little pay off.
author: Baron C.

description: I will say place is good . Good food , tiny . Crowded.  Open only short hours in evening . Better if they open in afternoon
author: Shikher S.

description:
You know, I think that if I went to Dosa in Santa Cruz, it would be a five-star place. In San Jose it would be four. In San Francisco though, competition is fierce, especially around southeastern Asian cuisine, and Dosa was good... but not amazing. And there is amazing all over the place in the city.

I wouldn't avoid it, but honestly, if my friend weren't hell bent on vegan and gluten free options, I'd have snagged her in my car and gone to Burma Superstar instead.
author: Sean B.

description: We love Indian food and this place has great Indian food with a twist.  Not sure if it is because it is supposed to be "Southern Indian" or if it is a "fusion" concept, but the main reason to come is the "Dosas" (hence the name) & "Uttapam".  These are variations of a nan, huge, fried dough puff, or flatbread, created with different flavors & herbs, served along with different sauces to dip.  These are delicious.  Having the 5 chile uttapam was delicious and not as spicy as the menu would indicate, so don't be afraid to try.We also shared some Mango Curry Fish, and some other dishes.  Our nephew needs to eat gluten free and our waitress was so amazing at explaining the gluten free dishes (they even had a separate gluten free menu) and she was so careful to speak with the chef to ensure there was no cross contamination on the preparation.  The service was excellent and the food delicious!  Definitely a need to go place if you like Indian food.
author: Steven B.

description:
As my husband and I were seated, I immediately heard they were playing Sister Nancy's "Bam Bam".  So far, this dinner was off to a good start.  I loved the decor of the restaurant.  Our server was really friendly and the bussers were very attentive.

The food was really good.  Since it was my first time having a dosa, I was surprised to see how huge the paper masala dosa was!  It was crispy and deliciously addictive...I had to force myself to stop eating.
author: Rose A.

description:
Dosa's got the whole package- a great vibe, flavorful cocktails/food, and great service.

I ordered a Peony, one of their Spice Road cocktails made with gin, while we waited for our table. It was carefully crafted by the bartender and had a nice balance of acid, sweet, and peppery flavors- definitely give it a try!

Their food was great, and reasonably priced for the quality. Their dosas are relatively "no frills," but the freshness of the ingredients make it taste so delicious! The truffle dosa was an interesting take on blending new trendy ingredients with a traditional dish- all in all a good combo of flavors!

As for the service- our waitress was incredibly attentive and even removed our appetizer from the bill just because it came out with our main courses. A great touch we weren't expecting. I'd definitely go back!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Food was delicious, service was great, and I loved the peony (gin cocktail with a kick of spice). Standouts - calamari, paneer and peas dosa, vada pav, and bhatura. Delicious, all came out at varying times which was perfect so we had space on the table.

Made a reservation at the wrong location, but only ended up having to wait 25 minutes or so and we got seats at the bar which helped to pass the time
author: David H.

description: I liked the atmosphere and we got seated right away. We ordered masala dosa and it was great. Our waiter was awesome and we came home satisfied.
author: Sammy F.

description:
Fried Idli and kale pakora are the best in appetizers and onion rava dosa is awesome.
Never get salty lassi, it's awful.
author: Nikunj K.

description: I'm happy to pay a premium for a dining "experience", but there is a point where you just feel kind of like an idiot for paying so much for so little - depending on what you order,  this place flirts with that kind of feeling.  And it's super crowded and noisy, so it's not like you are paying for some super nice/beautiful ambiance.  We were a party of 4, but a table for two was literally right up against our table - you would have thought we were a party of 6!  The food is delicious, but super small portions. As an example, $28 for two very small lamb chops? Laughably small portion of eggplant - 5 very small quarter slices - delicious, but we got that as an appetizer for our party of 4. The eggplant was LITERALLY 5-bites total. The $24 chicken masala was interesting - green, and tasty, but not what you normally think of as masala.  The dosa was delicious, and probably  the main reason to come here.  I'd heard a lot about Dosa, but I won't be back.  Even though the food was good, it simply was not worth it.
author: Emily G.

description: Been here a few times and never got something that I didn't like. They have a good cocktail list and amazing food. Vegan friendly!
author: Autumn M.

description:
On the way back from a picnic at Delores Park, some friends and I passed my car and saw from a distance the ticket on my windshield parked on Valencia Street.  All bummed out about the ticket, we decided to stop by this cozy restaurant on Valencia. 

I talked about the bad parking karma with the bartender, who preferred not to be called a "mixologist". I'm sure girls would love to hang out him just as much as guys would love to have a bromance with. We must have tried all the beers and specialty drinks while he gave us tips on how to make the city employees work for our money. He enlightened us with other cool places around the block as we drank and laughed like old buddies. Thanks Rubin!

He shared with us the best picks on the menu (on the appetizer section) -the Calamari and Dahi Vada. He made us both a Chai Russian on the house and now it's one of my favorite new drinks. After dinner and somewhat 3 hours later, we said our goodbyes with a new friendship handshake. When we returned back to my car, the parking ticket we thought we had, was merely club flier.
author: Moua L.

description:
Fantastic Sunday brunch with my daughter.  It was our first visit and we were a bit overwhelmed by the menu and looking around at other tables.  

Todd spent much time with us introducing sourcing and giving a bit of history about the restaurant and menu.  He first asked our preferences and then made suggestions.  

Everything was amazing.  He helped us with each dish and explained everything from plate to palate.  

We can't wait to return for another brunch, lunch or dinner.  Service was stellar, meal was outstanding and the atmosphere lovely.
author: Linda A.

description: Amazing service topped off with amazing food. My one wish is that the habanero dosa was spicy. My wife wouldn't stop talking about how hot it was. The reason we went. And it wasn't spicy at all. Should be named not habanero dosa. Other than that the sliders were amazing. Very well seasoned and spiced, the big balloon bread was crispy and fluffy almost like a donut. And the peas and cheese dosa was amazing like no other cheese. The sauces brought a satisfying flavor to the dishes.
author: Attic F.

description:
Heard a lot about this restaurant and thought of visiting here on my Marriage Anniversary.
Hostess was great seated us promptly but the server was annoying and seamed least interested or may be she was tired on a late Friday night.
Ordered a rasam, fried chicken appetizer, egg dosa and rawa dosa and was served all together-I wonder if they have a service sequence in place.
Cool no problem but at the end the busser cleared  my plate even without asking as if he is running late for his next shift- man I was just eating slow.....anyway I felt so nice the server gave me a dessert menu at-least ,I was thinking will directly get my cheque even without asking for it.
Decent food and busy place but would never return at a place where service is not happy.
author: Ajay M.

description:
I was excited to try this place, but left disappointed. The ambiance of the place is nice and the service was great, but nothing was memorable and it was way overpriced. 

Chennai Chicken ($6 during Happy Hour): Boneless organic chicken marinated in organic yogurt w/ coriander & cumin, fried. This was pretty good but nothing special. It's basically spicy chicken tenders. I thought the portion was pretty small if I had to pay full price. 

Prawn Masala w/ Shrimp curry ($18): Coconut milk, red chiles, ginger, red onions, spices. The flavor of the curry was good and reminded me of a spicier version of chicken tikka masala. We got this with coconut rice ($3), which went very well together. $21 total for curry and rice though? I would much rather go to a casual Indian restaurant and get the same thing for less than $10. 

Organic Mushroom & Arugula Uttapam ($15): Trumpet, maitake & beech, mushrooms, curry leaves, truffle oil, topped with baby arugula. I wasn't the biggest fan of this dish. There were too many mushrooms and I barely tasted any truffle flavors.  I would recommend getting a different Uttapam if you are thinking about ordering this. 

Overall, I thought the food was average and overpriced. I'm glad I was able to try it but I most likely won't be back.
author: Julia H.

description: The ambience is great! Their meat dishes are also good (prawns, lamb chops, scallops). However, their vegetarian dishes were lacking flavor. I had really high expectations from their paper masala dosa (since the place is called dosa), but it was really disappointing. They also had us waiting on our second round of drinks for at lest 25 minutes. Their desserts are made extremely well made, especially the 3 layered dessert, be sure to ask about that one!
author: Gauri P.

description: Really great, innovative food alongside Indian favorites!  Their cocktail menu is also very international and refined.  DOSA serves up really great fare at an exceptional price.  The only drawback to my experience is one of our brunch dishes with egg was overcooked, but they more than made up for it with the polish and flavors!
author: Justin W.

description:
Weird.  Apparently, it wasn't my first time here.... LOL

We had the summer squash for starter and the fire broth (tomatoes with heat!)

Paneer & Peas Dosa = crisp, tasty and plenty left over! 

Bharat Bread = delicious and PUFFFFY! 

Drinks = delicious ginger cocktail!!! Nom!!
author: Fannie S.

description: Great place to have your first South Indian food experience. The waiters were very detailed in their descriptions of the menu and tried to let you know what to expect with each item, but as a first timer I just picked one and hoped for the best. Lucked out with the brunch menu, chose the breakfast uttapam with 2 sunny side up eggs. Tasted like a savory pancake with crispy edges and full of flavor that was perfectly balanced with a runny egg. Also tried and recommend the masala dosa and the chicken on the small plates menu. Lentil soup had a good spice to it, tasted like vegetarian chilli. One thing to note is the waiter brought by a second bowl of lentil chips and we thought it was complimentary. Later we asked why it was added to the bill if we didn't request it they said the first bowl of lentil that came with a dip was only for 3 people so we looked like we needed another bowl. They took it off the bill and apologized.
author: Sharon T.

description:
Ordered the Chicken Karavali and Lamb Pepper Fry, with a side of Rava Dosa, no masala. We got two stringy, tendony, fatty meat-resembling dishes and a crispy, delicious Rava Dosa. With masala. A different waiter brings us a regular dosa, but takes it away since we already have our dosa.

We get billed for both a full Masala Dosa, and a side of dosa too.  I was politely trying to explain to the waiter that while we didn't order the masala we were happy to pay for 1 dosa, when the waiter starts insisting that the Rava Dosa was not a valid side order. (Who confirmed our order off his notepad then, your twin brother?) Before I can say anything, he rudely tells us he's getting the manager and pouts off. 

The manager asks if we have ordered this exact combo before (we have) and whether we go there often (we do), then says there is no way this should have happened since Rava Dosas are not a legit side.  He asks again if we go there often (we do) and then says he has to talk with the owner since this is a "special situation" that has NEVER happened before. Comes back 5 mins later and explains that they can take the extra dosa off but that he would email (REALLY?) all the waiters at both locations to make sure they don't give Rava Dosas as sides. And that they need to standardize so this NEVER happens again. Seems simple - a mistake was made, remove the offender from the check, apologize and be done with it. 

I'm confused and sad. Confused that the manager needed the owner's permission to deal with minutiae and we were a "special sitch." Sad because we've brought our friends and recommended the place to others countless times, just to be treated to such crappy food and crappy attitude. 

We're never going there again.
author: Sam B.

description:
After hearing about Dosa for years, I finally made it here and it was worth the hype! I am not normally an Indian food eater, but our waitress did a great job guiding us through the menu. We made it in time for their happy hour (it goes until 7pm....amazing right?) so we tried a chutney sampler and the chicken. Both were delicious little appetizers, the tamarind chutney was my favorite. Then my friend and I shared the Paneer & Peas dosa (had to try a dosa at Dosa) and the chicken dish. The chicken had quite a strong kick to it but was really delicious, but what won me over was the dosa. It is like a crepe. Ours were small rolls. We saw others that were huge puff creations. The paneer (a super yummy cheese) and peas were so good. I would get that again in a heart beat. 

The interior is really pretty. They have some gorgeous chandeliers and great window seats. This location right on Valencia was perfect for walking around and looking in shops afterwards.
author: Kari G.

description: Thank goodness the food was delicious, because the service was truly awful and the bathroom was a mess. Thirty minutes after ordering, SOME of the food that we ordered showed up. Some of it never did and we got a credit back. But definitely order the HOUSE Dosa,  absolutely outstanding. But be patient and forgiving!
author: E S.

description: This was my first visit to the Valencia St Dosa.  The food was just as excellent and the managers attentiveness to my wheat allergy was very appreciated. I felt very comfortable with the suggestions he made but all GF diners should know that this location only has one griddle where the Fillmore location has a dedicated GF griddle.
author: Sue L.

description: Dosa is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. The flavors here never disappoint, and the service is spot on. We've been to both locations, but I love the eclectic cozy feel of the Valencia location. We had the tasting menu, which I highly recommend, and it's always fun to try the dosa and uttapam which come with an amazing variety of toppings/sides. Warning: everything tastes so good, you will want to keep eating even when you are full. Stretch pants for apres is recommended!
author: Jill O.

description:
THE BEST INDIAN FOOD I HAVE EVER TASTED! Spicy, to cool, and potent, and good unexpected flavor. So many flavors pact in one bite. I especially LOVE the spicy lamb curry for $20. If you want something strong and something to awaken your dull food everyday, then try here. The service and management are very good and well kept. They were a little late on bringing us our first dish and gave us free delicious salad as an apology for the wait. LOVE IT! 

I've also tried the one on Fillmore ad it's more classy and prettier. But here in Valencia I think though it's not fancier, the food is a bit better.

I think the only bad thing was that they put their music WAAYYYY too loud, or at least for that day. I listen to loud music already, but this one is painful and irritating loud. I don't think this place is good for large parties that wants to socialize. Talking over each other is horrible.
author: Elaine N.

description: Good food. The namesake dosas are really the star here. All of the other entrees are super overpriced and not really worth the markup. Nice atmosphere. Feels modern yet still Indian restaurant-y. Lost stars on the service though Staff Made me feel super unwelcome as soon as I stepped in. Got there a few minutes (like 5-7 minutes) early for a 5:30 reservation and hostess would not seat us at a table and asked us to sit at the bar until it was 5:30. I was okay with this until, a few minutes later, another group walked in and was easily given a table. I looked at the waitress with a "what the f@&k" face and she finally got a table for me and the bf. Ultimately, I thought it was unfair for different patrons to be treated differently. I believe the hostess could have handled the whole situation a bit more gracefully. Her service directly impacted the mood of our whole dinner experience. Maybe I'm too sensitive, but I don't like feeling discriminated against and angry right before eating. I won't be back.
author: Anum A.

description: Excellent food and service. Great bar and wine list. Public parking lot right around the corner! I highly recommend this restaurant. Especially if you like fresh, healthy and spicy (but not too spicy) and light Indian food. We had a blast!
author: Bonnie W.

description:
One of the best south Indian restaurants we've been to. A great addition to what you can do it's also need food. They've taken classic dishes and added ingredients and spices to make them delicious.
The staff was extremely friendly. Very welcoming. Went there with two little kids with his little tough since it's a nicer place although they are very accommodating and still very welcoming.
We had one habanero Dosa, which is spicy but still very tasty.
The rasam was also very good. 
Overall, great experience!
author: Neesheet P.

description:
Update: Got this message from the owner after posting my review.

Hi Pete - I'm not sure if you actually came into DOSA since we do NOT serve a Madras Chicken and NEVER have!   We have also NEVER had a breaded chicken on our menu in the 8 years we have been in business.   Are you sure you really came into DOSA or are you confusing it with another restaurant?  
Please take a moment to consider where and what you ate?  
Thanks, 
____
Okay, I got the chicken name wrong because the food was forgettable, but I'm not stupid to not know where I ate at. I talked about the dosa, its location, and I checked in on yelp. I'm pretty sure I know where I ate at. 

 I ordered the spicy chicken appetizer that's on the happy hour menu which I'm going to post a picture of to make Mr. Anjan happy. I'm no food critic; I just said that I did not like the food hence the two star "Meh. I've experienced better" rating. Getting this kind of attitude from the owner definitely validates my 2 star rating which now I'm going to lower to a 1 star rating because I feel like I received rude service thus Eek! Methinksnot.

Sorry I'm not sorry that I did not like your food, get over it.
author: Pete B.

description: Being a south Indian, I have always had high standards when it came to good south Indian food! Dosa is one place that did succeed to impress me! We tried the habanero mango masala dosa and a regular plain dosa. Both were exceptionally well made. The ambience was classy and the service was commendable. In all, my visit to San Francisco was more memorable because of this place. Three cheers to the chef who was successful in bringing back memories of genuine south Indian dosas!
author: Sireesha A.

description:
Indian food + Great Ambience + Amazing Bar is a very very rare combination. 

There is nothing that I can think off that this place lacked. 

If you are looking to impress some one or feel like wearing your best dress on and getting some Indian food then this is the place to go to
author: Milana R.

description: Wonderful place for a lovely south Indian food, it was bit costly but totally worth it. Me and my friend are totally in love with this place. Channa battura is my favourie.
author: Dheeraj C.

description:
Eh. Slow service. The guy who dropped the food off was sloppy, our appetizer almost slid off the plate by the time it hit the table. The meagre portion of 4 papdi Chaat puris looked even sadder all clustered at the edge of the plate hanging on for their dear life. 

Idli fries were too greasy. Pan frying them might be a better idea, since frying idli is like frying bread & it just soaks up the oil. 

We all had dosas, they were nothing to write home about. The rava dosa was pretty flavorless, the saving grace was the masala. 

Then they added an idli order to the bill that we hadn't ordered. 

Meh. Prices were $$$. There are better places to spend my money at for this kind of food and service.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: Good and authentic south Indian food, the kind you'd get in south Indian restaurants in India. The sambar and the coconut chutney were delicious and so were the vadas. The masala dosa was nice and crispy but the mysoor dosa was a little on the heavy side. Tasty nonetheless.
author: Megha T.

description: A really fine dinner last night at Dosa. We did the 'Spring Tasting Menu', as it really features what the restaurant offers in terms of different dishes and unique favors combos as well as traditional southern Indian dosas. The food is superb, honestly. The cocktails are unique and amazing. The atmosphere is clean and intimate and the service is superb. What more could a foodie customer ask for. Outstanding.
author: Lin B.

description:
Presentation was nice.
Place was small and filled with people.
Hard to find parking.
Food tasted ok. 
Portions are small, but they take a long time to bring out each dish which with time makes you feel full. 
Good experience but not the best.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Meh!

11 of us from all over the bay made it here for a birthday dinner one weekend night. Reach there and we find out that we HAVE to order from the three course menu and not the regular a la carte one because of the our group size (-1 star). The food was overall decent but some of us did experience a little discomfort after we left (-1 star). The bill was quite ridiculous; we spent close to 550 bucks because of their 3 course menu (that too some of us shared) with ZERO drinks! (-1 BIG STAR) I honestly didn't feel like it was a fancy fine dining experience. Definitely a no no for big groups. The table we got was quite tight.

Sorry, not impressed!
author: Raquel D.

description: Great food and a good range. Ideal for sharing plates/sampling a range of tastes.  I've eaten at the bar and at tables - both offer great service with helpful staff that can point you in the right direction depending on your knowledge of Indian cuisine and if you want to expand your horizons,  It can get very busy and they don't take reservations, but you can put your name on a list and get a phone call once your table is ready.
author: Frank D.

description:
I've been a huge fan of Dosa for years and it's always been my go to for comfort food. We go there couple of times a month or at the very least do takeout once every two weeks. With that said, I had a terrible experience there for the first time. I'm intolerant to gluten and one of the items I ordered was the bhel puri. On asking our server if it was GF, I got a positive response. When the dish was served, i went through about half of it before noticing pieces of something that looked very close to a wheat cracker. I picked out those pieces and asked the server if it was GF to which he asked his co-workers and told me it was puffed rice. Being an Indian, I'm pretty confident of what puffed rice looks like so I asked for the allergan menu. On that I noticed the dish can be made GF but typically has wheat in it. On further questioning the hostess, I find out that the dish was not made GF.

I understand that restaurants screw up. My issue, however, was with how the situation was handled. When I first asked the waiter, he should have bought me the menu so we could double check. Fine that didn't happen, so what about the second time I asked and was told that the ingredients that looks like they were made of wheat were puffed rice. It was only when I asked a third time that the wait staff finally made an attempt to double check and see what order had been put in. 

And I get really mad when people just take things off your check as a way to appease you without really talking to the customer about why it happened and how it could have been avoided. Being gluten intolerant doesn't mean I just didn't like my dish..I will now have to deal with some severe discomfort because of this. So if you have any dietary restrictions, make sure you double check with your waiter and read the allergy card clearly.
author: sri b.

description:
5 of us (4 adults & 1 child) met here on a Sunday night for dinner. My husband and I arrived early, so we found a spot at the bar, ordered drinks and a starter that the bartender assured us was wheat-free. Turns out that the starter was NOT wheat free. Bartender apologized, said he'd take it off our bill, but he didn't take them off our bill. 

Our friends arrived. We moved to our table. Server was very helpful and, since it was our first time at Dosa, gave us an enthusiastic run-down of the menu. 

We shared some chutneys with pappadum. Chutneys were really nice and varied. One was spicy, one was herby, one was fruity, and the other vegetabley. Why, however, are they served in little rectangular dishes that are nearly impossible to eat out of? Pappadum was excellent. 

In the lull between appetizers and entrees, we began to realize that no one in the restaurant was happy to be in the presence of a child. The child is incredibly well-behaved, and the parents are laid back, so I don't really understand all the stealthy glances and looks of horror we received. Being from Europe, it's normal to have kids around in public spaces. They are just part of our life. We don't go to restaurants expecting a perfectly silent and private experience. For that, we stay at home! Anyway, I digress...

For entrees, we ordered the sunchoke-paneer koftas, lamb pepper-fry, chicken korma, and the south indian moons (a selection of 5 mini uttapams). Everything was fantastic. The food was so good that we temporarily forgot everything else. It was so good that we hardly cared about how dirty the toilets were (they were dirty though, like gas station dirty). The food was so damn good that we didn't waste a bite of it. I was partial to the sunchoke-paneer koftas and highly recommend them. Perfect with a glass (or two) of Clary Ranch Pinot Noir.
author: Beverly N.

description: This place came highly recommended by my brother (the local cali guy) while we were visiting SFO. We were able to just make it before their kitchen closed for lunch at 3:45 P.M. and boy were we happy that we did. Their menu is predominantly made up of south indian "Tiffin" snacks. We tried their Egg Poriyal Uttapam, Masala Dosa and Spicy Mung Masala. But their Habanero-Mango Masala Dosa is to die for. It satisfied my appetite for some spicy food from the homeland. Mango Lassi and "South Indian Monsoon" were great drinks. Highly recommended.
author: Surya S.

description:
The Good: Loved the channa batura and the wonderful saag dosa. Excellent service and a beautiful location. 

The Bad: It's hot, it's loud, it's a popular restaurant in San Francisco.

Overall: Really great, would recommend.
author: Meghan E.

description: I am a connoisseur of Indian Cuisine and an Indian chef myself, though I don't cook very many South Indian dishes which is the specialty of this restaurant. This was my first visit to Dosa on Valencia and surely will not be my last. First the bad part. Parking is horrible. Now the good: The room is fantastic. High ceiling with beautiful fixtures and artwork. The service was impeccable. Everyone, to a person, went out of their way to be friendly and welcoming. The menu is big but we were a party of six, including two Indians and four others who have been to India dozens of times each. We did full justice to the menu, ordering about 8 appetizers and 7 or 8 entrees. Each and every dish was prepared to perfection. I have to say it's some of the best South Indian food that I have ever had in America. I give Dosa on Valencia my fullest recommendation.
author: Mik H.

description: Everything we had was amazing! We ordered a bunch of different things to try them all out. We definitely recommend this place and we will be back! Great service ( thank you Tommy!) great food, great location!
author: Sasha G.

description:
This was such a fantastic dinner spot for a large group of us on a weeknight. We were all seated at a rather large communal table and the cocktails, beers, and wine started arriving at each of our seats. 

For the food, we had our server prepare a somewhat family-style menu and we ended up having several waves or courses, rather, for our visit. Some of what we had -- 

Kale and Mung Salad
Lotus Root Kofta
Prawn Masala
Dosa of several kinds
and a few others. 

We passed everything around in sections for our group of 12 and everyone left rather full and happy. The service was impeccable and the drinks tasty. I was really pleased with everything. Love this spot!
author: Benjamin G.

description: The food and wine were amazing!! The service was ok, pretty slow for a random Wednesday night. The spicy Masala dosa was really good, sprouted mung bean salad was super fresh, and the asparagus cheese ball things were so so cheesy.
author: Pauline G.

description:
After seeing so many reviews tried this place last weekend. 

I am an Indian vegetarian. We tried following items and rating goes as below. 

Cocktail - 4.5/5
Kale pakora - 2.5/5
Mysore masala dosa -4/5
Rava masala dosa - 4/5
Coffee - 4/5

Service - 4/5

We have tried Dosa in many Indian restaurants in Bay Area. Liked dosa quality and freshness here. Though it's not THE BEST!

Cons- small place. What else to expect in SF!
author: Shil S.

description: really slow service on a Thursday night, but good food. took almost a half hour before someone came to take our order
author: Shaina J.

description:
Went here for dinner tonight and really loved it. Dosa is definitely the best place for a South Indian meal in the area.

We have been to the Fillmore location quite a few times, so decided to go here today. They have a chaat special on Mondays so we decided to got for it. My wife got the papdi chaat and I went with the pani puri. They were both very authentic with great flavors. We also got an order of the idli fries which were not bad, but the cranberry chutney that accompanied them was truly out of this world -- apparently just got introduced a week or two ago.

My son got his favorite kid's crown dosa with a good helping of the seasoned mashed potatoes and chutneys. I finished my meal with an order of the vada sambar. The sambar was heavenly -- always love the sambar at the other location as well -- and the chutneys were great too. I always end up licking everything clean :).

This location is not as roomy as the other location and it was extremely packed today, but we still had a good time.
author: Amit R.

description: Absolutely amazing food! I highly recommend the pongal, the moong dal dosa and the South Indian payasam. The sambar reminded me of home :)
author: Varsha V.

description:
Most Indian food in the United States is a hybrid of Pakistani and central/northern Indian food. Dosa is different so don't go expecting the usual. I love the location on Valencia. The new Fillmore restaurant was way too upscale for the food and just made me uncomfortable. The atmosphere here is busy but feels warm and cozy. 

I've been here so many times and I love it but I always get the dosa. I think much of the menu is overpriced and frankly, the dosa is just amazing so I always get it. I usually come with a girlfriend and split two dosa and a salad or appetizer. I recommend getting the two different kinds of dosa and I also highly recommend allowing your server to choose for you or make suggestions. They know their stuff.

The wine selection is amazing. I've never, except here, sipped a wine that tasted exactly like the description on the menu! White wine seems to go particularly well with the spicy food and yes, it is spicy but it wears off quickly. I have a pretty low tolerance for spice and yet enjoy the heat of the food here.

The dosa expands in your stomach so at first you won't think you've ordered enough but just take your time eating it and you will have enough. I've never had any other food with the flavor of these sauces. It's really an incredible experience. Like fireworks in the mouth.
author: Angelique L.

description:
I can't believe I've never written a review for Dosas. I love this place and so wish there was one over here in the East Bay. 

It's nice to go to the Valencia restaurant early before the masses fill the place. We like sitting at a table near the window by the bar. There are always many vegetarian and vegan options available. The beer is good. I've never had a bad meal and I've been here many, many times.

The Fillmore restaurant is nicer but the food is consistently good at both places.
author: Leslie K.

description:
Wow! Wonderful fresh tastes, friendly attentive service, casual chic atmosphere add up to a great experience. 
We sampled several of the dishes but my favorite was the Paneer Dosa. It came with a curried lentil dipping soup which was out of this world. This place may not be 100% traditional but so be prepared for that. Highly recommended for someone new to Indian food, as the staff is very knowledgable an helpful.
author: Marc R.

description: Habanero Mango Chutney Dosa ,Must have recommendation for all spicy indian food lover
author: Abhishek S.

description: I came here for the first time due to their wonderful sounding Restaurant Week special, which claimed that for a price of $40 per person, you could get access to a select 3 starters, 3 mains, and 2 desserts. Sounded like a great deal, and this place was highly recommended by friends for the food in general. However, we came with 3 people, and it felt like the amount of food we received was not scaled proportionately at all. I didn't expect to get exactly 3 of the mentioned menu, but it felt like if we had come alone, individually, we would have gotten the same portions. Instead, since we sat at a table together, we got the 1 set menu of food shared among 3 people. Quite disappointing, and I felt as if I was very misled.
author: Jason W.

description: I would not recommend this place. I had a very bad experience with customer service. I waited for more than an hour to get seated. After waiting for this long, we did not get a good service. Servers just serve the food and then go. No one came after we asked for extra sambhar and salt and pepper. We asked two servers for the same, no one showed up until we finished. Food was good but if you looking for service, i would not recommend.
author: Nainesh D.

description: Lovely cocktail concoctions; average Indian food at premium prices; dosas are good if you like them.
author: Susan B.

description:
I got the mint cilantro dosa which was really interesting. The filling was potato like and the dips were pretty tasty but I didn't think it was 5 stars good. I liked the other dish I got which was the pepper chicken curry. It was recommended that it be eaten with lemon rice but I thought the lemon rice was too acidic. The spicy chicken plus the acidic lemon rice was a rough mix b/c it made the combo too sour and strong. I also tried the lamb roti small plate and I thought the lamb was very tender. They served it w/ a yogurt sauce (it tasted like Greek yogurt sauce) and I thought it was OK....

Service was great though. The waiters asked us if it was our first time here or if we were familiar with southern Indian food and he explained the whole thing to us. He also explained to us how to correctly eat the dosa. The busboy was also very smiley and friendly.
author: Brenda L.

description: I had had DOSA for lunch today, which was catered to my husband's office. So, I haven't been to the actual brick and mortar location, but I have had their food. The coconut rice was long grain and delicious as a base for all their other saucy dishes. There was lamb pepper fry, channa masala, chicken karavalli, and brussel sprouts poriyal. I tried everything, and it was all delicious, except the channa masala was too spicy for me. I'm sure if you like spice, you would like it, but it's just not my thing. I'm a wimp I guess. The meat was a little dry, but tasty.
author: Jessie O.

description: Fantastic place to have a unique kind of brunch. The service was great, staff was very friendly, the food was super good and well presented, the drinks were on point. They were also extremely helpful to one of our friends who is Celiac, went over the contents of each course in detail and had tons of options for her. Will definitely be back.
author: Tatiana N.

description: Long wait time and we were not informed about it correctly when we called them. Dosas were not cooked through fully.
author: Kranthi M.

description:
I love DOS-A! I love everything about it! The food, the dark interior, the plate presentation! The spice!

I came on a Sunday and there wasn't any wait. 0 complaints (oh wait 1 mini complaint because why is the lamb curry $20+? But all the dosas are only like $10!). Anyway, that still doesn't remove a star.
author: Carleen W.

description: Bomb mutha F'n diggitity!!!! Modern Indian cuisine! for all the traditionalists and people who complain about this place not being authentic.. Who the F cares. Its not traditional and its not the most authentic, but its delicious! we live in a world that is increasingly becoming more intermingled. The food at Dosa is a great example of how an ethnic cuisine can keep its roots but blossom into a cultural melange of sorts. And yes the mango habenero dosa etched a special place in the hall of fame (of my taste buds).
author: Gautam T.

description:
Just delicious food. 4 of us ordered the thali for lunch - bad idea. It's just toooo much food for one person to finish. Although everything taste amazing, we could maybe finish half. Makes sense to share. 
Their dosas are always good and their mango lassi is delish.
author: Beni D.

description:
Love the food, drinks and ambience. Service is great as well. 
I'll dedicate this review to their Chola Bhatura specifically though. I finally gave into my Chola Bhatura craving this past Friday. Definitely one of the best food indulgences in a long time. The Bhatura was nice and fluffy, but when you break it apart, it was so thin, unlike the doughy ones you get at most Indian restaurants here. Makes it feel healthier. And their Chola was amazing as well. My husband went as far as saying it was just like how his mom makes it. Now that, I think, is a huge compliment for sure. Kudos to Dosa for getting this classic North Indian dish right.
author: Manasi V.

description:
My friend and I decided to meet up for dinner one night after work. She went ahead and got the table. By the time I found parking and walked to the restaurant, she already had a good sense of what to order. I trusted her judgment so I really can't recall what we had.

I recall staring off with a roasted beet salad, followed by a chicken dish stewed in a green sauce with califlower. Also, we had a order one of their masala. 

By far my most favorite dish was the masala. The texture was flaky with a great chewy bite. Inside, was a good spread of well seasoned puree of vegetables (spinach, kale, etc?), The accompany side of sauces were also pretty good as well and paried nicely with our meal. The portion is quite good!

The chicken dish was ok, felt the chicken was way overcooked and the portion was slim. However, the sauce was good and would like to know how that was made. No real call out on the salad, cooked fine, really tart, straight forward dish.

I spoke to one of my co-workers about Dosa and she told me that they don't serve anything special. The dishes found there are what are typically served at home but they charge a great deal more. 

While I can safely say that its not "cheap" it's within reason. I would go back to Dosa but next time go to the one on Fillmore, I hear that one is a lot better

Overall Thoughts

I enjoyed the robust flavors of Dosa and would go back for some authentic Indian food.
author: Eddie W.

description: Thomas! You are the opitaomy of  great service! You definitely made our DOSA virginity pleasant!  So helpful and fun, it was an absolute pleasure. Food recommendations were fantastic and bartender/manager was a bonus! We'll be back for sure, and when we do, we'll be looking for ya! Thanks again!
author: Yolanda B.

description: My first real Indian foods since I left India , this place has really good Indian cuisine yummies
author: Abdullah A.

description: These guys really do a good job with Indian fusion. The food that's meant to be Indian is authentic and they pair it up with good flavors! Never thought I'd like truffles and dosa together but they called it right!
author: Bhavya K.

description: Super delicious Indian-Inspired food. Wow, I was very happy with everything we ordered! I thought that we were going to need multiple plates to get full but actually I just got the $10 Dosa Masala and was stuffed! The Dosas are huge! Everything is very fragrant and delicious. The service was great, our server was super attentive and I noticed she was keeping an eye on the entire restaurant like a stealthy cat; very impressive considering how full it was and she didn't miss a beat! Jake, the bartender, made us a super tasty drink with absinthe (I've never had a tasty drink with absinthe, so kudos to you)! Overall great experience
author: Christie M.

description: Amazing dosas and an even better cocktail selection. This is a good option for a date spot or when meeting up with a few (not many) friends. Weekend reservations recommended.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
So I've always enjoyed Dosas but I've been more of a North Indian food kinda guy.

This changed last night at DOSA on Valencia. This place ruled. The dosa was better than any dosa I've ever had. My girlfriend is Indian and her words about the place was, "The only dosa I've ever had better was from a mom that's from South India."

I thought the food was gonna be the best part and the cocktails would be good. Wrong. The cocktails were fantastic and when I asked what would pair well with our food the waiter (Kevin who was also an AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING waiter!!!) knew exactly what drinks would work well with the food. Very impressed. I'm surprised that my favorite restaurant experience in San Francisco was NO QUESTION: Dosa on Valencia.
author: Micah M.

description:
Great decor! Came a bit early with a friend and decided to sit at a bar table to catch their weekend happy hour menu. Little did we know that their happy hour menu didn't reflect any price difference from their regular menu!

Chennai Chicken: This reminds me of popcorn chicken but they take it to a new level. I loved the mild heat and the great flavor they were able to put into it. I could taste the cumin and wish i had ordered more.

Chile & Onion Pakora: They weren't kidding when they said it was spicy. They had originally brought out the wrong dish and we just stared blankly at the calamari sitting in front of us. We were tempted to keep it but being all too stubborn, we requested our original pakora order. 10 minutes later i regretted it! I gulped my glass of wine, drank some water, and had to order a side of coconut rice. So tasty but this was a bit harsh and i loveeee a bag of hot cheetos and tapatio.

Next time i'll come back for the Dosa!
author: Samantha L.

description: I travel a lot, domestically and this is my favorite Indian restaurant anywhere. Just awesome menu coupled with creative cocktails. The decor of Valencia location is modest compared to their other location, but food is stellar. Go!
author: Kenny S.

description:
This place does not live up to its hype. Maybe because I live in South bay, where there are tons of better indian restaurants, but I feel disheartened after paying $30 for a below average indian meal.

The good:
The dosa was absolutely delicious. The meat filling (keema) wasn't good, but the dosa was amazing.

The bad:
1. Everything we ordered was extremely salty (Sambar, dahi vada, keema, lamb curry) except for the paneer and pea Uttapam, which was actually quite decent.
2. Our keema had a piece of cardboard paper mixed in.

Overall, I wouldn't come here again unless someone is paying for the meal.
author: Eric C.

description:
This place was unbelievable, but minus one star for our waitress. (Actually, I would love to deduct more stars for her but I love the food here). I was ordering for the entire table (6 of us), and after I got the first two items out, she began to tell me I was ordering "incorrectly"...excuse me, but is there a correct way to order?? I told her I would be ordering more than those two items (obviously 2 dosas alone will not feed a table of 6) but she wouldn't let me get another word out. She began to explain all the different dishes they had and how I'm supposed to be ordering one of those other dishes...ok, we get it, not our first time dining there nor was I finished ordering. My uncle had to chime in and said to her "maybe let us finish ordering first and then make suggestions?" She still didn't shut up about the different options and she was adamant about how we should order a curry dish. Well maybe if she stopped rambling, she would have known we were ordering 3 of the curry dishes she kept talking about. After 5+ minutes of her talking nonstop, we finally continued our order. I think she realized her mistake and quickly took our order and walked away. Never saw her again. Not sure if that's a good or bad thing at that point. 

Onto the food. So delicious!! For the dosas, I recommend the paper dosa and truffle masala dosa. The paper dosa is huge! Definitely enough for 6 people. My personal favorite is the habanero dosa but beware, its spicy (or at least to my family, It wasn't spicy to me but I'm also a freak when it comes to spicy foods). The chicken korma is also really yummy...my uncle liked this the most! My table also ordered the shrimp curry and fish curry (it was their special that day). I think the shrimp was the winner of the two. My mom really liked the Channa bhatura as well, that puffy bread is amazing! The only thing was the Channa was that the onions were overpowering, but if onions are your thing, order this. The mushroom uttapam was good too but I think I prefer the dosas. Not as heavy! We started with the chutney sampler, which I think should be free, but I guess not! We used the chutneys on a lot of different things so order this if you like dipping sauces like I do. Will be back soon!
author: Alysa N.

description: very authentic taste... very busy place...little costly, but worth to spent the money for the good tasty food. The sambhar is little thick, I will love if it was thin. Overall, very good place for Dosa and south indian food.
author: Jaimin P.

description:
This place is amazing! The food quality and taste are fabulous! Few things to keep in mind:

1. Don't forget to order Dosa, it is great and always a safe bet if you are new to this place.
2. Please reserve your seat in advance, the place is very popular and seating is limited.
3. Well, it is in SF and Parking is always something to keep in mind :)
author: Venkata Vijay Y.

description:
We had a good experience here. Server was very attentive, and explained everything to us since it was our first time here. Love the decor and ambiance. I'm a total Indian everything freak LOL

Started out with Red Beet cumin soup.. very pretty and good taste. Also Lotus Stem scallops.. yummmy!! So tender and flavorful. 3-cheese dosa roll was so-so, prob can skip that. 

For main dishes, we shared the Lamb Pepper Fry (very good!) and Spicy Mung Masala dosa.. which was quite a good looking dish. Also delicious. Add a couple of glasses of wine and we had ourselves a good time. It can be pricey. And I may have detected just a bit where they may hurry you .. just a tad though! Maybe because I read that on here haha. But yes it was a new and good experience!
author: Vol T.

description:
I've been here enough times for dinner and brunch to give it an awesome rating.  It's a cool place to bring out of town guests because it's a bit of a variation on traditional Indian food in the sense it has a bit of class.  The pricing isn't bad either (although for nye the fixed price menu was a rip off...Indian food should never cost this much...ever).  They only have a handful of curries, lots of dosas, and other funky stuff.  Like I said, a fine place for a modern variation on Indian, but my hot spots in SF are Aslams Rasoi (casual proper sit down) and Little Delhi (dumpy casual). The location on Fillmore is way nicer, larger, and oddly the food is much better.   Weird but true.

updated 8/2016:  I've never had to update reviews for a place as much as this place.  It's good for a season, then feels like a ripoff, then great again, and now...bad again.  I was super excited to go, and the biryani was an absolute disaster compared to last time...the last time we went about 8 months ago was this great saucy wet biryani.  This time this dry rice with some baked naan cover...stupid, tasteless, bland.  The other curry we got sucked too.  Guess I'll wait another 8 months til you get it right again.  Sheesh.
author: A A.

description:
Good spot!

This place is happening for dinner - the dosa were huge and fresh. We loaded up on appetizers, which killed our appetite, but the food was good. The spicy here is SPICY - but exactly what you want. The service was super. 

Would go back, but won't be in the instigator.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I was so excited to hear that we were going to Dosa with a group of my coworkers! A Dosa Food truck recently opened here in Ottawa and I loved it, but otherwise haven't had much experience.

About 12 of us crowded into this place on a Wednesday night, and it was pretty busy, but still nice enough that we could hear each other. Most of us had no idea what to order so we trusted our fearless friend Ben to do the honours. He ordered us a smorgasbord of deliciousness and while I can't remember half of the dishes names for the life of me.

I do remember how flavourful each dish was (make sure you get lots of rice to lessen the heat of the sauces!), and that my cocktail was super strong (but tasty!). The giant pieces of dosa were unbelievably fresh, and all the food was excellent for family-style sharing.

The service was fast and efficient and the atmosphere was great. I'll absolutely be coming back here next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Andrea B.

description: The two times I've been here I haven't been particularly impressed with the food. It's nice that they have a vegan menu, but everything I had wasn't particularly well flavored compared to other Indian restaurants. I've tried the idli with sambhar, truffle dosa and channa masala with poori. Everything was pretty heavy/oily. The lines here also can be pretty long, and I'm not sure if it's worth the wait.
author: Josh B.

description: Yum! Very good place representing South Indian food very well. So decently priced and delicious! My sister and bf ate dosa with masala inside it and it was so tasty. I wanted something different so I ate the uttapam with chili. It was so good and filling I had ab half left. We had paneer pakoras as a starter so I already got semi full. So crunchy and cooked to perfection. The masala chai is the best end to the meal. Simply delicious. Highly recommend this place.
author: Priya S.

description:
Dosa on Valencia is good for groups. Dosa is very good to their customers. I made a reservation for 6:30 and got stuck in Paul McCarthy traffic, so I arrived close to 7 and they were very quick to seat me. 

Because I arrived so late I was not able to fully experience all of their happy hour but it seemed pretty good from what I could tell. A lot of action at the bar that Thursday evening. 

My friends and I shared a variety of dishes for dinner. All dishes were good. We loved the large dosa! Dessert was okay. I think we would have been happier splitting a pint at Bi-rite.
author: Kelly H.

description: I just loved this place. Great ambience and great food is an awesome combo. They forgot to bring one item in our order but it can be easily forgiven for the high quality food served. We tried moong Dal Dosa, mango Lassi, batata vada, Masala dosa. Everything was really good.
author: Pushkar A.

description:
Super tasty! my favorite Indian food in San Fran
So many difference tastes.. 
Careful with the chilly ;)
author: Uriel C.

description:
In short: Dosas with atmosphere! 
I was a bit apprehensive because usually the best ethnic food is served in hole-in-the-wall places. Dosa restaurant is an exception, fortunately! 
The flavors are not toned down but you do see some non-traditional Dosas on the menu (which actually are quite interesting).
Service is fast, parking is close by & they have great drinks.
author: Food S.

description: No staff member understands the menu nor will they be polite or courteous to your requests. If you want bad food with shady lights and a Motel 6 service kindly visit.
author: Raj M.

description:
I saw this on an episode of Food Network's Heat Seekers and have wanted to try it since then. We weren't too hungry, so we decided to start with the paper masala dosa which was humungous! I usually prefer thin and crispy over thick dosas, so this was perfect. I think my eyes popped out of my head when it was delivered to us. It's gigantic!!! It was very thin and crispy and tasted so good with the sauces that came with it - coconut, tomato mint, potatoes and a veggie based stew. All were very good! Somehow, we were able to finish the whole thing. We also decided to order the Tamil lamb curry to share. We added lemon basmati rice to this dish and it paired perfectly. Every bite was flavorful and tender. It had a subtle kick in the background, but it worked well. 

The waitresses were super duper nice and attentive. When we sat down, we were curious about the spice level of the habanero mango dosa and she offered us a sample, which were really appreciated. No joke, that is super spicy! We enjoyed our dinner and will gladly return again to try many of their other offerings.
author: Cindy T.

description: I need to update my below review as it turns out that I have developed a nut allergy, specifically cashews. It was not the restaraunt fault that I suffered a reaction to an ingredient that was listed, and which I did not expect to happen. No more masala anything for me, alas.
author: owen o.

description: Really great and authentic Indian Dosa. Relaxing atmosphere and staff very friendly. I wish I lived closer to this place. Would be here every week.
author: Sunil S.

description:
I take my Indian food very seriously. Dosa on Valencia meets the "I'd take my Indian parents here for dinner" bar of quality. It's actually really hard to find places Ma and Pa will enjoy when they come visit! 

I enjoyed the Spicy masala dosa. I think they may have forgot the spicy, but I've also been told I've eaten so much spicy food that I've totally lost my sensitivity to low spiced food. 

One of my friends ordered the Lamb Pepper Fry and I had a chance to taste. Definitely a lot better than the dosa in my opinion, so I'll keep that in mind next time. I thought the dosa would be the best given the name of this place, but I was proven wrong.

I think next time I'm going to stick to the curries and forego the dosa, I'll be back next time I'm in the area.
author: Brad M.

description: Enjoyed the food here last week. Was worried the hype might push this off the expectations ladder but Dosa didn't disappoint. The spice level, freshness of ingredients, fusion of North & South Indian dishes was well executed. Only thing I would ding them on is the server waited too long and as a result the food was a tad too cold for our taste. His reasonable excuse was he wanted to bring all the dishes together. I would definitely recommend this if you are in SF.
author: OliveR A.

description: Ive noticed theyve changed their menu since i was there in Dec... regardless...Food great, services sucked. From the moment we walked in (2) we were dismissed - pushed to sit & eat at the bar rather then our requested table. Finally got a table (7pmish). Servers were meh. The app of octopus was good but only 1 or 2 pieces of octopus. Fish special was very good and friends dosa (habenaro) was very good as well. Kingfisher beers came 2x without hassel. I most likely will be back.
author: lauren l.

description:
There isn't a large selection of great indian restaurants in SF. Let alone, South Indian. Dosa hits the spot, entirely. How do I know? We brought a picky Indian relative here, India born and raised, and vegan on top of that. She loved it. 

You should be ok with a moderate amount of spiciness or else, order a mango lassi with your dinner. Delicious.
author: Rekha G.

description:
Busy; hyped and very salty  -- from the drinks and the free bread to the appetizers and the entrees. The prawns were previously frozen, soft and overcooked. 
If you love Indian food for the complexity and yet subtlety of flavor, do not go to this place. All you'll taste is SALT, cardamon,  cumin and some more salt.
The decor attempts to make up for the misguided flavors.
author: Michelle B.

description: The quality of the food and the service is on a decline. On our last visit, the tea was cold, cholle undercooked, Bhatura too oily and staff inattentive especially given their prices. I've been here many times and the Filmore location is much better in terms of food and staff.
author: Parag M.

description:
Wow was extremely disappointed by this place.

Came here with a group of my friends for Saturday lunch. We ordered dosa, keema, sambar, dahi vada, lamb curry, paneer and pea uttapam. The uttapam was pretty decent, but everything was very salty. It was border line uneatable. Our keema had a piece of cardboard in it too. Very strange. Looks like they had a bunch of interns in the kitchen while the real cooks were on vacation.

Won't be coming back here again.
author: Maxim S.

description:
I was really disappointed with my experience here. The service staff are unbelievably rude, the food is overpriced and mediocre. It is clear to me that the people running this restaurant do not understand basic principles of treating customers well.

I don't want to go into the details of the terrible experience I had with the service staff at this restaurant, suffice to say that I will never go near this place again. Don't make the same mistake I did... stay away from Dosa.

Good Indian food seems to still be a unicorn in San Francisco.
author: Evan S.

description:
A worthwhile blend of Indian and American Style . Indian Food served with best of the Wines and Drinks . Ahh . Awesome . we ordered Chennai Chicken as a starter , followed by Uttahppam and Masala Dosa for Entrees. The taste of each food item is as good as it looks .Wonderful place for your taste buds and ensures a pleasant meal . 

Recommended to a lot of friends already . coming back for sure !!
author: Anil V.

description:
WHAT A SPECTACULAR WAY TO SPEND NEW YEARS EVE!! This year, my friends and I weren't in the mood to pay a $50-100 cover to get crunk and dance with strangers.  We just wanted to spend it with each other and have a good meal, good drinks, and good company.

A week prior, Open Table indicated that Dosa was booked for the majority of the night.  We called and they were able to give us a table for 12 at 10:30pm on new years eve.  This was perfect because we could eat until the countdown and they were giving out complimentary champagne and party favors.  The restaurant was about 75-80% filled at the countdown which wasn't bad.  Everyone was happy and noisy.

There was a 4-course NYE menu for $49/person which was a LOT of food. You're basically getting 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and a dessert.  My husband for the prix fixed and I got one entree.  Below was his 4 course dinner:

--Appetizer: Chicken Kebabs.  They're like spicy and delicate chicken patties with this amazing cilantro sauce.  People were hesitant to order this because I'm sure in their minds they were expecting overcooked white meat on skewers.  This was not the case at all.

--Entree 1: You can choose either a dosas or uttapams.  I tried the white truffle dosa and after sharing this one person, we were both veering on the full side.  This is a BIG pancake.  I couldn't really taste the white truffle.

--Entree 2: Goat curry.  The meat pieces were bone-in and so incredibly tender.  I loved the dish.  The accompanying rice had a strong lemon flavor that went well with the goat.  The downside is that there are quite a few bones to pick through the dark sauce.

--Dessert: Tearamisu.  It's their take on the tiramisu using paneer and chai both in the cake and in the chocolate-chai sauce.  Almost better than the original.  It's like drinking chai.

And my single entree was the Kerala Chicken which looks like a dish of really poo green mush but is so AWESOME!  I couldn't stop smelling each spoonful before the bite because the fragrance of the coconut milk was so enticing.  I don't think I've ever really done that before.  I do agree with some other Yelpers who say that the non-dosas are better than the dosas so be sure to order other items such as this.

Drinks were also well made and they have a section of spice-filled drinks.  Get ready for cumin, chili, and cardamom.  I got the Gunpowder which is Antiguo Reposado tequila, gunpowder agave, lemon, elderflower, and grilled mezcal pineapple.  I was worried this would taste too strong but the bartender reassured me that the other ingredients help to mask and balance out the tequila which it did.  

My drink did come pretty late but other than that, service was top notch.  Pictures make the place look casual during the daytime but the ambiance is pretty romantic at night with all the candlelight.  It's a small place so make a reservation!
author: Shannon L.

description: Had a wonderful meal at Dosa on Valencia last night! A friend in town from Colorado is a strict vegetarian and I heard Dosa was a very accommodating restaurant with plenty of veg and vegan options. I heard right! Not only was there plenty of options for her to enjoy but they were all delicious. We shared a few plates including a little gem salad, brussel sprouts and a white truffle potato Dosa, and found everything to be well dressed, seasoned and prepared perfectly, and served with a variety of different accoutrements like chutneys and dipping sauces. They have a fun bar program, with an extensive gin and wine list, as well as cocktails, but also lots of fun non alcoholic bev options too. I'd describe Dosa as an all around crowd pleaser with options for everyone. The service was attentive and informative. No complaints here, definitely check it out!
author: Leslie H.

description:
Southern Indian at it's best. This is not a place to get your naan fix, but what you may harbor in disappointment over that detail, you will make up for in a world of other, new flat breads and flavors.

This is home to the chutnies and cilantro and coconut sauces, to the fried delectables such as poori, paratha and my new favorite; the Frankie. There is a lot to this menu, and if you need any explanations, the staff is only too happy to help - they are well versed and on it if you need something. Upon my inquiry of "what's a Frankie??," I then ordered it. After I lay it on you, you will too.

Frankie. Comes in three styles; Paneer, Lamb and Prawn. All have their own distinct twists and all are wrapped in roti and then FRIED like an Indian BURRITO. I excitedly ordered the prawn version, and it was happily gobbled as slow as I could without looking like a Frankie assulter.

My Dear Mother ordered the Chicken & Eggplant entree and this was wonderfully spiced and roasted pureed eggplant with peas and chunks of chicken, menu recommendation was the lemon rice to go with, and so we ordered! and, it went with!

We also got a side of the Masala Potatoes, nicely spiced with onions and cashew nuts.
CASHEW NUTS?? Yes, and they DO go with that! We were sad to stop there, but knew we could fit no more in our party clothes, and so we did the sensible grown up thing and walked away from the menu, but don't think for one second that our stomachs agreed with this prudent decision.

What also sets Dosa apart is the atmosphere. It's beautiful, spacious and luxurious feeling. Like a lounge that happens to have fine food.

I can't wait to go back and try more, there's a wealth of interesting and new things here, a bit like your first trip to a new country!
author: Katie W.

description: Hit or miss on several dishes, good flavor in dosas, idli's, but often too spicy. Ambiance did not add to the experience and house cocktails needed work.
author: Ayyappan V.

description:
Nummy! Relatively small place and it seems like it's always poppin!

The menu seemed kind of pricey and first but it's really alot of food and it made me really full at least. Breakdown below:

(Free) appetizer: Some kind of cracker thing?!?! I have no idea what it was but it was the best thing ever. It was sort of like a mix between a water cracker and a tortilla chip.

Calamari small plate: It LOOKED really small when it came to the table but it was more than I thought. Different than what I'm used to for calamari, but very interesting! I honestly don't remember too much of what it looked like or tasted like but I did like it. (Lol)

Masala dosa: So I've never had dosas before, I had just heard my friend rave about it all the time. I got a frozen version from Trader Joe's once (DON'T DO IT). It was kinda gross so I wasn't expecting alot. Once it came out, it was a biggggggg crepe/naan thing with curried potatoes in the middle and 3 dipping sauces. So good! I'm guessing it's probably overpriced for what it is if you were actually Indian but I still didn't feel ripped off because it was really good =)

Service: Extremely attentive!
author: Emily C.

description: Unbelievable great indian food.  Got the paper masala  (yum)  paneer fried rice (spicy,  tasty), chaennai chicken (hot, yum), bhatura bread (puffed up, yum), pots of cream (omg).  Drinks were strong, tasty.  Great service.  Went twice this week. First time birthday,  then just the 2 of of us.  Warm, classy ambiance. Fav new restaurant.  $110 incl 4 drinks.
author: David F.

description:
Unsatisfactory experience overall. Made a togo order on the phone. Took them about an hour to make, including about half an hour of wait at the counter with repeated assurances that the food would be ready shortly. The food tends to be decent but not sure it's good enough to overcome the crappy service.

Turns out the Chana bhatura was packed without the Chana. Unbelievably negligent service.
author: Soham M.

description:
Was not expecting anything. Never had a dosa but was willing to try something new. Man I was blown away. Everything I had I liked but what I loved most was the white truffle masala dosa. Will definitely come back for that. 

Only downside is the food takes forever. We ordered plenty of small plates..and they came out in waves. In fact, it was pretty lengthy between plates. We had reservations at 7:30 but didn't finish our meal until 10pm. I guess for that occasion it was fine. We were celebrating and talking and didn't mind the wait. I don't know if this is how it always is or if it was an off-night but be mindful. Otherwise GREAT food!
author: Danica C.

description:
At the outset, I must mention that I was pleasantly surprised by the decor of Dosa as it's the only "upscale" Indian Restuarant I've been to in this country. But I was a little apprehensive by the relative paucity of Indian clientele which set me thinking if the cuisine is going to be anywhere near authentic.

Well, perish the thought ! The chefs still appear to have their feet firmly planted in South India going by the dishes they dished out.

The sambhar/sambar at Dosa on 21st and Valencia (Mission) is the best I've ever had --- and I have lived in Southern India for a little over 12 years. It was simply amazing with the "Medu Vada" which was crispy outside and fluffy inside and made for an amazing appetizer ! 

Sadly, their namesake dish, the Dosa, on the otherhand, was pedestrian and sorely disappointing --- which is not to say that it was an unmitigated disaster; it was still a pretty respectable Dosa !

The spicy pepper chicken which is served with a side of either lemon rice or dosa (I went for the dosa) made for a satisfying meal with generous portions, and in my opinion goes pretty well with a glass of Riesling.

I'd rate it 4 stars for their food, service, and decor but have to dock one star for disappointing on their namesake dish.
author: Umesh T.

description:
After the San Francisco Food Festival ended, we decided to have something very light but awesome and hence, we ended up at Dosa.

The wait was long, really long... more than an hour even when it was mentioned as 45min-1hour. However, they apologized for the delay and they actually promised that service for us will be prompt and that they will make up for the extra time we had to wait. Meanwhile, we were in a hurry because we had to catch a train back to the bay area. The service proved to be ultra prompt, we got our order almost instantly and we finished our meal within half an hour... they were true to their word! Small things such as these make the experience of dining unforgettable!

As for the food, it was amazing as always. They can't go wrong with the Habanero Mango Dosa, which is the spiciest dosa you can get in town and also the best. The uttapam with caramelized onions was also delicious but it is definitely the Dosa which will get us back! The Madras Coffee and Mango in the Black were interesting drinks to take with the food that we had.

All in all, a wonderful experience, even with such a long wait.
author: Natansh V.

description:
I was here during my trip to SFO and made a special trip just to downtown to have dinner with work colleagues. The restaurant I was looking for was Udipi. While I was waiting for my colleague outside the restaurant, I walked down the signal and came across Dosa. From the street both restaurants looked similar. After peeking inside I noticed there is a noticeable difference. Udipi felt like an authentic and traditional south Indian joint vs Dosa (south Indian name) but an upscale experience. 

We quickly switched our decision to move our dinner venue to Dosa instead to Udipi.

Servers greeted us and gave us a nice place next to the windows. I ordered sparking water and my friend ordered a beer. We both enjoyed our chat while watch around. It was evening and slight hustle and felt the sitting places were tightly packed. I was enjoying the environment and nicely designed and maintained interiors. 

Our server was attentive and prompt and bothered us just enough times that did not feel like an interruption. 

I ordered Chana Bhatura for my entree. Food was tasty and best bhatura I had in a while. 

The only downside I can think is parking. Both of us went in circles around the block for 15-20 minutes before we could find a good parking.
author: Amar K.

description:
Whoever thought Indian food was low on presentation and service has never been to Dosa.

From the get go, the complimentary crispy papadum crisps are great.  It's crispy and flavorful, and left our hero wanting to fill up on it before the main meal.

The mains here are simply amazing, and were described by our hero's South Indian friend as "even better than the food from India".  The consistency and flavor of the sambar here is excellent.  It doesn't come off as runny and soupy, but instead has a thicker texture that makes it suitable for dipping.  Our hero's "South Indian Moons" uttapam  sampler plate was good and offered a variety of uttapam flavors, which showcased the thicker pancake style dosa very well.

Watch out for the habanero dosa though... that thing will make you breathe fire!

PROS:
- Excellent service with helpful recommendations.
- Authentic South Indian food with some classy refinements.
- The dosas are large and filling.
- Really clean and chic interior.

CONS:
- Pretty pricey for Indian food.
- Tough to find parking nearby.
author: Albert W.

description:
I came here for brunch with friends. It was surprisingly kid-friendly. We had two toddlers in our party, and they had high chairs and didn't give us any trouble about children. 

The food was great, and service was attentive. The owner/manager described the food after it arrived in a theatrical manner which was fun. 

Negatives: one server gave one of my friends a dirty look when she asked for a to-go box, prompting her to say "Never mind, forget it!" Then the credit charges were seriously messed up. But we were ready to leave, so my group worked it out among ourselves.
author: Alicia C.

description: Super Dosa, was recommended by an Indian friend. Nice staff. Make sure to reserve as it seems the place to be where all the Indian techies have their dinner.
author: Sara C.

description:
Love this place and its spin on Indian food! Although I would not call myself an expert on Indian food, I do know what tastes good and this place is delicious! This is also one of the very few instances where everything I ate was vegetarian and very delicious (Most of the vegetarian places I have gone to have had bland or very simple tasting foods. I evidently don't go to the right vegetarian places.)

Dosa has a large food menu full of tasty and complex Indian fusion food. There is definitely something on the menu for everyone. My personal favorites are the idli fries and the sweet potato dosa. Their bhatura is also really tasty (and not overwhelmingly oily) and "larger than your face" as my friend put it. 

The portions for their foods are large enough to share between 2-3 people so I definitely recommend ordering "a la carte" style. 

Overall, Dosa is a great place to experience a different spin on Indian food while still getting your fill of that Indian cuisine flavor!
author: Nirel R.

description: Terrific..one of the best dosa we've had...paneer dosa is simply awesome. .great work guys.
author: Rajat C.

description:
As a South Indian hailing from the place the famous dosa was invented, I have to say that this place makes some darn good South Indian food!
The traditional dosas are a bit thicker, soft on the inside & crispy on the outside, but I haven't come across that style of dosas anywhere except South India. 
So overall, this is a huge win for me!!!
author: Kaushik S.

description:
I'll keep this brief. I have never had a bad meal at Dosa and given that I live across the street that says a lot because I've been there several times. What really bothered me that I have been asked to leave immediately following the conclusion of our meal TWICE now by the manager so they can seat the next guest. 

I don't like to drop $100 - $150 on a meal with friends only to be asked to leave as soon as the meal is over (and I think we stayed for 90 minutes between appetizers, dinner and dessert). I just think it is poor customer treatment to ask someone to leave and it has happened twice now.
author: karen h.

description: The food was really good. The place is small and cozy. They have a decent bar as well. The spicy mung masala dosa was my favorite. Overall, had a good experience.
author: Vishnu V.

description:
Dosa. 

One of the great frontiers on good Indian food in San Francisco. 

Tonight was actually my second time here and I only arrived here by chance because of the lack of parking around Pakwan (ANGRY FIST SHAKE).
