All the food was fabulous & we had no complaints (sorry...I can't remember what we ordered). Most importantly, though, all of our cocktails were excellent -- unique & interesting, well-made, & with a subtle but tasty Indian flare to most of them (cardamom, curry spices, etc.). Really nice!

A little pricey so probably not somewhere we'd go on a regular basis, but I would definitely love to go back & try more of the cocktails. :)
author: Angela B.

description: The vada pav was amazing! Really enjoyed the ambience, though it can be quite a bit busy here. The service was good; the staff is friendly, and the food is great.
author: Shilpi M.

description:
I was invited to a friend's going-away party at this restaurant.  I almost had to actually bail out on the invitation, because I'd told my friend during the party's planning stages that my budget was pretty tight and I could only go out if it was somewhere cheap.

Dosa is many things, but it is NOT cheap.  I ended up going anyway because my lovely friend paid for my dinner (she really wanted me to be there, the sweetheart).  That said, when I go somewhere as pricey as this, I have pretty high expectations.  

In many ways, those expectations were well-met.  For starters, the tiny restaurant was crowded and busy, but there seemed to be TONS of staff, constantly running every which way while managing to be efficient rather than frantic.  All the service was very prompt, questions asked were graciously answered, finicky eaters (me, vegan) were accommodated, glasses kept full, enjoyment levels frequently checked, etc etc.  At one point, the table next to us was vacated by a family with a baby.  Three different people working simultaneously had the table cleared and wiped, seats cleaned, and floor swept in bare seconds.  So the staff get 5 stars from me.  The presentation was also stunning.  Everything looked amazing, down to the gorgeous stainless steel presspot of coffee.  

However, there is a reason that Dosa only gets 3 stars instead of 5, and that comes down to the food itself:  it just wasn't THAT amazing.  It was tasty, but my Tenderloin neighborhood Indian joints have food as tasty or better for a fraction of the price.  Sure, the setting and everything else was a great deal more upscale, but I just expected more authentic flavors and felt that the spice level had pretty much been toned down.  We ordered family-style and shared a HUGE number of small plates and entrees in our large group, and even the 'spiciest' dish just wasn't that spicy.

I guess if someone else was paying again and really wanted to go, I'd go back, but otherwise if I'm going to throw down teens to twenty on an entree alone (if you get curry and a 'side') I'd rather go to Gracias Madre.
author: Keegan R.

description: The food at Dosa is really nice, the way they make the dough is the best. The place is really small and a smile now and then on the faces of the staff wouldn't hurt them but the food is amazing!
author: Vincent V.

description:
First restaurant in SF to really impress me since I moved here from New York.  It's not that we haven't found really delicious food here, but it's just nothing has been better than what I have had previously.

Dosa, was perfect.  It probably had a edge as I've only had South Indian food once before with an Indian friend and did not find it particularly wonderful.  Dosa completely changed that.  

We got the tasting menu for $35, which btw, what a great deal.  
Calamari appetizer - divine, perfectly cooked texture and the taste was unique but amazing, definitely not your typical calamari.  It was my favorite dish of the night, if I had to choose.  

Watermelon salad - just because it sounded, well, interesting, and it was very refreshing, the combination of the sweetness of the watermelon really balanced the other Indian spices

Dosas - we had both the white truffle dosa, and the paneer dosa (cheese).  both were delicious and came with three sauces.  I think the most amazing thing is the fact that you really do get layers of flavors, especially with the sauce, where your initial taste buds are stimulated by the sauces, then by, for example the flavor of the truffle.  Usually, with sauces, you just taste the combination of the food and sauce at once, but there was such a clear layer of different flavors that explode in your mouth gradually, which was amazing (like that scene from Ratatouille!!!)

Lamb tamil - very soft lamb, absolutely cooked to the perfect degree where the meat was just coming apart very easily, delicious.  comes with this citrus rice, which takes a bit of getting used, I couldn't really get used to it and probably would ask for a milder seasoned rice next time

Prawn curry - the curry was absolutely delicious, one of the best I've ever had.  I do have to say the shrimp was a bit underseasoned, which is weird given the sauce is amazing.  it was almost that you taste this amazing sauce, and as you get into the texture of the shrimp, which was perfect, the flavor falls  bit flat... 

Service was absolutely amazing.  Staff was very friendly and attentive. Incredibly fast service and your water glass is always full.   

Ambiance also perfect.

I think I will become a regular here, as it is just a block away!  Can't wait to try the drinks next time.
author: Li Y.

description: It's one of the most reliable food wise and  reasonably priced nice restaurants in the mission. Crowded, but not the most trendy. The specialty drinks are delicious. My regular spot for dinner before music at Viracocha across the street.
author: Meredith G.

description: I thought the dosa and puris were good, and we loved the cranberry cashew chutney, but the crab vada was so much drier and stingier than a simple crabcake, and the keema was so dull and heavy, like it was overcooked the day before. I wanted bright, fresh flavors, but never were so many spices used to so little effect.
author: Chris M.

description:
Dosa is the entire package!. Kudos to the owner Anjan for bringing the food, ambience and the service all together and making this as a place to experience.  I came away extremely impressed. This is by far the best showcase of Indian food (read south Indian food) across all of North America (I travel and i have been to many places).  
I was also happy and pleasantly surprised  to see my ex-colleague in software industry make the switchover to running a restaurant like this (way to go Anjan!).
author: Random D.

description: The food is good but this place is cramped. I sat uncomfortably the whole time. There was no place to move the chair or move my legs.
author: Amol J.

description: Food was good but I felt cheated with the bill. They charged 4% for employees healthcare as mandatory charge which they justified by cheaper menu. Mango lassi for 4.5$ duh!!
author: Prashant T.

description:
This place was so delicious with such great service I had to write a review. Best meal I've had out in a few years- the spices are so authentic and delicious!!  
I brought my 4 month baby and was pleased to find s changing table in the bathroom.  I also have a ton of dietary restrictions and they were able to accommodate. Great staff. Great food!
author: Jane G.

description:
For some odd reason, I thought Dosa was going to be snooty and pricey since it's been perennially on Michael Bauer's Top 100 list since it first opened. However, it's actually more reasonably priced than I assumed, and the decor is not all that fancy inside. It's a hybrid between a creperie and a tapas restaurant ...lots of small plates ...mostly variations on the South Indian dosa, which is really a savory crepe, and the uttapam, which is the dosa's thicker pancake-style cousin. It doesn't matter to me that much as I found it all pretty darn tasty.

I came with my good friend Mary, who was adjusting well to her newly unemployed state as are many of my friends in this most somber economy. Neither of us were familiar with South Indian cuisine, so our order was strictly shot from the hip. To our amazement, it turned out we were culinary marksmen no matter how blind our shots fired. First, we tried the $10 Masala Uttapam, which had spiced potatoes, onions and cashews. It came with little cups of dipping sauces ...a coconut milk one, a tomato one, and something called sambar, which is a thick lentil-bean mixture.

Then we went for the $8 Samosas 'North & South', which were huge with the Southern one filled with caramelized onions and vegetables and the Northern one with spiced potatoes. Delicious. However, our favorite dish was the $14 Channa Bhatura, which is a garbanzo bean masala accompanied by a puffy, savory wheat bread. The combination of flavors was just right with just enough on each plate to satisfy us. Clearly there are other dishes to try on future visits, and I indeed look forward to them. My one minor complaint is that the place gets packed awfully quick and expect to be grazed frequently if your back is facing the unmonitored walkway in front of the bar.

FOOD - 4 stars...a genuine treat and a nice intro into South Indian dishes ...Naan n' Curry will become Naan n' Phooey if you come here
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars... on the dark side and rather crowded during the evening
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...quite stellar and patient with our Yankee-level questions about the menu
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely want to try a dosa next time, and there will be a next time
author: Ed U.

description: The best lamb dosa in this part of town. Even the chutney tastes out of this world. Authentic flavors, feels like you are in madras, india. Compliments to the chef. This place gives you food coma.
author: Amira J.

description: HIgh end, Super nice. Dosa was a different type of Indian fro me. Love Valencia St
author: Chelsy W.

description:
I took my boyfriend here the other night and we had a blast! We tried the Kerala chicken paired with lemon rice, Fish Pecora, and plain Dosa. They were all tantalizing to our taste buds. 

To drink, we had a mango lassi. I expected a bit more punch from the lassi that had pieces of mint leaves mixed in, however, it did not satiate my pallet. 

For dessert, we shared the Rasmali which had just enough flavor, was not too sweet but decadent without going overboard. The breaded pieces were soaked in the chilled yogurt to give a surprising texture but nonetheless, an experience worth trying!

The service was excellent, our waitress was very attentive to our needs and always asked if we needed anything. Water glasses were filled without having to make requests. 

Overall, it was a delightful experience. Since my boyfriend was South Indian, it was like visiting his homeland with a modern twist. The lighting and decor in the room added just the right amount of luminescence and grace expected of elegant, casual dining.
author: Melissa A.

description: Great place to chill and try something new. Very friendly and helpful staff will help you chose items from the menu. I enjoyed new tastes, high quality food and tasty Indian-style cocktails. Tried dosa for the first time - it was delicious and the sauces were spicy and colorful. Also enjoyed the atmosphere of a lounge with modern Indian accents.
author: Anna G.

description: The sambhar was perfect and dahi vada really had the presentation I have ever seen. Quite exceptional.
author: Saloni H.

description:
I have mixed feelings of the smell as I spent a week in my friends' room when he worked there.  The mix of Indian spices and guy was a strange combination indeed.  I never went because of it but my date this last week told me that's where he was taking me.

Bravo on the lamb curry.  It was full of flavor and rich in texture.  The sliders there were also very good but if you're a bit of baby when it comes to spiciness then your eyes might water (as mine did and I like it spicy).  It was served with melted butter.  Another 3 minutes shaved off my life per dip.
author: Ashley I.

description:
Gawd, it's not like I live in Vacaville...

As an SF foodie, I finally forgave myself for not stopping by this gem whenever I drive down Valencia St...what a treat to visit DOSA!

Being food explorers, we found out that it was crowded but what do you expect on a day before the holiday? 

Service is awesome when they tell you that:

- You can go around Valencia st. and they'll call you on your cell phone when your table is available...SWEET!
- They mention that it will be a 45 mins. Wait...WRONG!
- We only waited 20 mins. When they notified us of an available table....SWEET!

Lovely décor as I experience the very dim mood lighting with fake lighted candles per table, contemporary wooden furniture with wooden flooring and contemporary architecture. It was comfortable but loud with a happy vibe. The service was efficient...they asked us if we were new here & recommended which to order by their food & wine menus.

Because it was our first time in DOSA, we had the following:

Classic DOSA Masala: a DOSA filled with creamy spiced potatoes, onions, and cashew nuts

Paneer & Peas Uttapam: a southeast asian thick pancake style topped with spiced and shredded farmer's cheese, lightly grilled, peas and cilantro. It tasted like butter & pancake was sort of crunchy

Thanks for the recommendation, Ms Yelper Heidi C. *High 5*

Naan n' Curry, sorry to say this but...you just got served!
author: Charmian D.

description:
I don't typically eat South Indian food and have a strong predilection for the piquant flavors served up North.  So I am pleasantly surprised that I am giving Dosa 4 stars.  

Their food was pretty much as good as I've tasted South Indian food.  No I do not consciously choose to dine at South Indian locales with any regularity, but I have been to my fair share of them with friends and Family.  At least for comparison purposes.

And Dosa had some dank uthapum and appetizers.

The down side was the service.  It was far too (TOO) attentive.  At a certain point you just want to be left alone to eat.  I don't really care about what order you recommend we eat our dishes in, just let me eat them before they get cold.
author: Raman S.

description:
Had an absolutely fantastic dinner here tonight. There were three of us -including 1 vegetarian - and everybody was convinced it was the best Southern Indian meal we'd had.

The drinks are definitely over priced - 10$ for a tumbler.  A creative and well made tumbler but still over priced.

The small plates were incredible and worth every cent. From good to best we tried:
- dahi vada (lentil cakes in creamy sauce). The cakes were good but over powered by the sauce. 
- chile & onion pakors (deep fried stuff in chickpea batter). Really phenomenal and surprisingly light on grease.
- Cochin calamari (yummy squid curry & pancake).  Nom nom nom. My new favorite Indian dish. 

We also shared a habanero & mango masala dosa. You know the warning on the menu about this being "intensely hot"?  That's no joke!  This was too hot for the three of us to finish but we all found it perversely fun and tasty. 

First and only indian place I can think of that I'd give 5 stars.
author: Ivan L.

description: Great ambiance, fun wine choices and killer food!  I'd like to see the staff more knowledgeable about the wine offerings and I'd love to see someone carry a glass by the stem.....other than that, bravo!
author: TresLeches X.

description: Arrived at 5:29 for a 5:30 reservation.  Told we needed to wait until the dining room was ready.  Nobody doing anything.  Four people show up and are immediately seated.  We left.  Guess they didn't want my money.
author: Gene B.

description: Awesome Ambience, great food and service. Loved  the food presentation. Makes the food even more tempting. Must try.
author: Gayatri S.

description: This was a great Indian restaurant. They have great cocktails, appetizers and they really only serve Dosas. But the menu is pretty large and I thought the food was good.
author: Will D.

description: Best dosa place ever - beats several authentic dosa restaurants in the bay area. Truffle masala dosa is a must try ! The dosa fillings are so original, it adds a fantastic gourmet touch to the otherwise simple indian breakfast food. But don't miss the plain dosa, this place makes it delightful with a ton of fun dipping chutneys and lentils!
author: Mariposa R.

description:
My husband and I came here for dinner last night. 

I made a reservation for 9pm and didn't get seated until 9.30. Granted it was a busy Friday night, but waiting thirty mins while seeing walkins get seated was a bit frustrating. 

I was pretty excited to come here since we had just returned from southern India a few weeks ago in which I got to have my first taste of masala dosa. Maybe I shouldn't be comparing eating dosa in bangalore vs sf, but I was sadly disappointed. The sambar (sp?) was not as delicious as I remembered. The potatoes resembled mashed potatoes and it was pretty bland . My husbands dishes were just OK. 

Our favorite was the cocktails. We both had the "gunpowder" and it had a surprising kick to it. I recommend this.
author: Simone B.

description: The food here was amazing! I love Indian food and this totally hit the spot. I've never had a Dosa before and I wasn't disappointed. The server was super friendly and attentive. He took his time to explain Dosas to me and my friend. I ordered the Potato Masala Dosa and my friend ordered the Habanero Dosa. Both soo good. It was even nice that our server brought some of the Habanero sauce for my friend to try to make sure it wasn't too spicy in case he wanted to change his order to something else. I also tried to pumpkin soup which was equally delicious. I will definitely be back whenever I'm in The Mission again and craving good Indian food. :)
author: Tamika C.

description: I much prefer this location than the one in Pac Heights/Japantown as it is more convenient location-wise.  If you order a drink, be sure to get the pink peony cocktail! Really, you won't regret it.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
So GREAT!  I am a huge fan of Indian food and this place is a bit different than your typical curries and rice but without a doubt, the best ever.  I recently took my boyfriend there as his first Indian foray and he is unfortunately forever spoiled.  

What we ate:
- spicy mung masala dosa ** amazing!
- summer squash & potato curry ** amazing!
- baby eggplant kofta ** amazing!

Note: I need a better adjective than ** amazing!

What was extra impressive was the Aaraam Se cocktail option - "relax and let our bartender make a drink for you".  What a great idea!  We ordered whisky spirituous and whisky savory -- both were super delicious and exactly what we were after.  When the bartender came over to see if we liked them, we asked him about the obscure Fernet Branca; could he make a cocktail with that?  He was all over it and allegedly named it after us.  Awww.

And finally the ambiance is just perfect. I have been to Fillmore as well but found it to be too big and loud and prefer the intimacy of Valencia.

Yum.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Sarah L.

description:
My sister I went to Dosa on Friday, we got there early so we did not have to wait, but it did fill up quickly.  There is no valet so we parked in the  garage on 21st between Mission and Valencia.  The ambiance was great and the wait staff were attentive however, I do wish they would have told us what was on our plates because we ordered an assortment of dishes and we didn't know what we were eating some of the time.  

The food was extremely tasty and  the assortment and shapes of the dosa were very fun & unique.  My stomach and senses were pleasantly overwhelmed with the spices, chutneys, and delicious food!!!  

Unfortunately, don't have three stomachs so I could've tried EVERYTHING on the menu, but I think I put a good dent so this is what I had and I recommend all of them.

*South Indian Moons  Chef's selection of five different Uttapams - my only complaint is the server did not name each the uttapams on the plate so I can't tell you which we liked best.  However they were still very good.
*Paneer & Peas  Dosa filled with spiced and shredded farmer's cheese, lightly grilled, peas and cilantro
*Coconut & Lemon rice, we liked the lemon better
*Popadom (think I am spelling that wrong) - was the best I've ever had before.
Dahi Vada  Lentil dumplings - This was one of my top choices, its delicate and refreshing.
Also, they have a wide assortment of chutneys and I favored the coconut & mango.
author: Megan M.

description:
Wow, this is hands down the best dosa I have ever had in the Bay area. The food was very well prepared, the quantity filling, service was prompt and friendly. The chutney is spicy and tangy, as it should be. The curd rice in particular was delicious.

The place looks trendy from inside and has a bar too.

I am definitely going back whenever I visit SFO.
author: Nikhil K.

description:
Dosa, 

I still think about you. I know it's been a long time. I've tried elsewhere, and some have come close but you hold a special place in my heart. Your crispy dosa, delectable chutneys, creative menu, quick service and good prices are the best.

Fondly, 
Kimberly J
author: Kimberly J.

description:
I had such a positive experience here. My friend and I sat at the bar since it was a Saturday night at a busy time and we wanted to be seated quickly. That ended up working out for the best because our server was AMAZING. Wish I could remember his name but he was SO helpful with his recommendations. I can't remember the names of the dishes we ate since it was quite a few months ago but I remember being so satisfied. I love south indian cuisine because I love hot spicy food. It's actually more warm than spicy if that makes any sense. Also, you feel much lighter afterward than if you were eating the buttery and sauce heavy dishes from northern India. 

We asked our server a lot of questions and once he saw we were genuinely interested he basically gave us a culinary breakdown and history lesson of the food we were eating. I was so impressed. Really shows how knowledgeable and passionate the staff is ..or at least he was!

He was even kind enough to recommend a few bars to check out in the vicinity and they were perfect for what we wanted.

Wish there was a location in LA. Can't wait to go back to SF to eat here again!!
author: Glendale L.

description: Awesome prawn marsala that's non-dairy. For the portion, insane that it was around $25!
author: Lauren C.

description:
At my job, I work with a lot of former heroin addicts who are now on methadone.  As you may/may not know, when you go to get your methadone dispensed, it's called 'dosing'.

I wish I could dose like an addict at Dosa! It's addicting, delicious, and soothes my cravings for the savory like no other.  And if I could have insurance pay for it, even better!

I've never not gotten the paper masala dosa, because I'm an addict of habit.  I love how it looms over the entire plate and hangs off of each end! And it satisfies my craving for crispy without clogging the arteries like other drugs will. During my last visit to Dosa my friend and I finally tried the Uttapam (and oh-so ravenously ordered the sampler: the South Indian Moons.) Thanks to the high from the food, and the Malbec coursing through my veins, I don't know which uttapam was which, but they were all gratifying.  

If you haven't been to Dosa, cave into peer pressure, hit that gateway drug (mmm paper dosa...), and get used to the thought of seeing me dosing at Dosa on a regular basis, alongside your soon to be addicted self.
author: Joanna M.

description: My brother came from out of town and wanted a special meal in San Francisco. Dosa immediately came to mind. We had a lovely meal. The food was unique and delicious and the service was impeccable. I highly recommend this restaurant for a fun and yummy night out.
author: Sandra F.

description: Damn stoked on this place! Great drinks and awesome food, loved the chutney variety to go with the dinner! The Masala Dosa was great! Took a buddy who lived in India, and even he was impressed.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Costly meal! About $100 bucks.
My sister and her roommate brought me and my father here to the Mission for a luncheon. Electrifying.
It was amazing! Fancy high-rise ceiling. Exquisite atmosphere.
Appetizing dishes and esp. their crispy wraps known as a 'dosa' and spicy, aromatic indigenous sauces.
This place slams any Indian Restaurant. 
Best indian food I've ever had.
author: Eileen R.

description:
we beat the crowd by showing up at the open, got a nice table by the window, had fantastic and knowledgeable service, and the food was super. we had the red beet cumin soup with creme fraiche ($7)  and it was out of this world. Then my friend and i shared 2 entrees, the marsala dosa and the paneer and peas uttapam. The paneer is homemade. The carmelization of these with the way the uttapam is cooked is not to be missed. The dosa is the size of a kite, with a much smaller filling. The marsala (potato and onion) was good. The entree came with soup, which was flavorful.

I hear people mention the price, and I agree it probably starts to add up. I think $10 for a dosa and soup is quite reasonable, but maybe some of the starters or salad might be a little high. No matter, I'd save this for special occasions and savor the experience and the food.
author: Henry Y.

description: This place is really good. Our favorite is the Lamb Stir Fry curry. The dosas and uttapams are good. Great place to take gluten-free friends and possibly vegetarian/vegans as well.
author: Heather R.

description:
Holy smokies, I've been waiting a long time to come here and wow it was worth the wait!

Came here for a birthday dinner, made reservations online for 6pm on a sunday.  The place was pretty much empty, got busy around 7pm...FYI.

The staff was VERY attentive and three waitstaff checked in on us regularly.  Immediately we were asked if this was our first time here, and everything was explained to us.

I had looked at the menu online before coming and knew what gluten free goods I was going to have.  We ended up each ordering the tasting menu....whoa, WAY too much food, we each were stuffed and took home half.

The calamari appetizer was good, came with a little salad, my least favorite of the night.
The dosa (mini huh?? NOT so mini!, I have no clue what full sized would look like!) with the paneer and peas was pretty outta this world in my opinion, and the dipping sauces were awesome as well, loved the coconut one.
The lamb curry I didn't even eat there, took it home, but it was nice and spicy and the lamb was good quality.  
The uttapam sampler of the different ones we took home, and they were great even re-heated....all the flavors were soooo good.
The raita was such good quality...not anything like that watery stuff you get if you eat at an indian buffet.
The desert I had was the rasmalai.  Just the right amount of sweet, the rose flavor and cardamon really came through.

Everything tasted so good and clean and flavorfull, all the spices were great!  I've been to some places recently where the indian food was very bland and somewhat oily.   This place is now hands down my go-to indian restaurant.
author: Q L.

description: Food is good. Service is ok. Dining areas are clean, restroom not so much.
author: Shashidhar D.

description:
OK, I know this place is consistently given 5 stars and I will probably be kicked off Yelp (and out of my adopted Indian Family) for saying that I like it but not enough to give it a 5 Star rating.

Everything we had was vegetarian.  2 salads that we split were amazing.  I think it is more that I just don't like the dosa thing overall.  I wish I did.  I embarrassed to say however, that I do not.  I am sad sad sad, and I am sorry, but it is true.

We had amazing drinks and amazing salads and my Indian sister was mad that the cute waiter paid more attention to me than to her...which makes me rethink the 4-Stars actually, I may upgrade to a 5.

I loved the ambiance too.

Don't get me wrong, I would totally go back and hope that I love everything I have...I will just stay away from the giant dosas.
author: Stacey C.

description:
Love this place! The food here is wayy too awesome. It's one of the best Indian restaurants in town. Its always crowded but the wait is definitely worth it! 

The tables are sooo close, it uncomfortable when there is a couple sitting on the table 3 inches away from yours. Hahah!
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Good ambiance, great service! Came in without a reservation on a pretty packed Tuesday night.. thank God they were able to squeeze us in last minute.

The 7x7 list brought us in for the paper masala. When they brought it out I had to give it a double-double take. It was huge! Came out the size of a tree trunk or a big rolled up art project. We HAD to take a picture of this!! So since the size was unparallel, how did the taste and quality match up? With each bite I kept expecting more, but the taste just didn't measure up for some reason. Four generous sides cames out- potatoes w/onions &nuts, tomato/coconut chutney, and lentils. A heaping portion of potatoes came, slightly oozing out of the little bowl. Lentils, same size.

The samosas were ok....take one of the paper masala side dishes and stuff it in an empenada. Voila! Now add 2 sauces (cilantro & chutney) and now you have a samosa meal.

My favorite entree of the night was the organic Kerala chicken & coconut rice. The chicken and slices of tomatoes & green beans were covered in a slightly spicy green sauce. The coconut rice was okay, had the same consistency of an Uncle Ben's type of rice...I wasn't impressed. The taste of the chicken however made up for the rice. I would definitely reorder this again.

Overall, good spot. It tends to get crowded, but a little crowded for my own good maybe. I was using my hands to explain something, and accidentally tapped the waiter's private area as he walked by. Hilarious! Well, we had GREAT service from then on...so I can't complain. LOL

BTW- Parking gargage down the street cost $2 and hour. Trust me, street parking is scarce.
author: Joy A.

description:
Dosa has a trendy ambiance and extensive menu with plenty of carnivorous and vegetarian options. 

Everything was cooked well and who doesn't dig dipping sauces, but honestly I'm surprised more yelpers haven't commented on how salty everything was. It seriously detracted from any other flavors Dosa may have attempted to showcase in its dishes. Between the 5 of us, we split the following (with salt scale rating from S to SSS):

chicken chennai - SSS
fish pakora - SSSS i.e. pretty frickin salty considering it's only a 3S scale
eggplant kofta (veg) - SS
lamb pepper fry - N/A didn't try
summer uttapam (veg) - uttapam S; chutneys S; sambar SSS

I guess it's worth a try if you are looking for mid priced trendy indian fare.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Went here with four co-workers, all Indian who have been before, and highly recommend it.

 This place will go down in my top twenty meals. If you are a foodie with a bit of an open mind, you will love this place. If you are someone who typically eats and enjoys the basic fare of Curry's and Tandoori, it may be a bit different and not your cup of tea....but try it anyhow!

I will be returning here in the next month or so, and truly look forward to trying some new dishes.
author: Sam E.

description:
Came here for "Dine about town." 4 course meal. Was the first time I had Dosa and it was awesome!

Started with the Roasted Garlic & Fennel Soup which was alright, it came really pretty though.  Presented very well.  My friend got the Garbanzo & Avocado Salad which was REALLY tasty!  Highly recommend!

Followed up with a "mini" dosa of the spicy mung masala which was also REALLY good.  Came with 3 sauces (coconut and tomato chutney and sambar).  The coconut one was the best.  When the dosa came, it was huge, but when I noticed the couple sitting next to us got the real dosa, it failed in comparion of how HUGE dosa is.  Would get again!

Had the Seasonal Vegetable Korma for the main entree which was really good although I wish I hadn't filled up on the soup and dosa.  The Korma was really good, the sauce it was in was sweet and really good, but lacked in good vegetables.  It had a lot of onion, some cauliflower and some potatoes that I could remember.

The best part was the dessert.  I had the Passion Fruit Custard and Coconut Tapioca.  OMG I couldn't get enough of it.  I have to say that the dessert was really the best part of the meal.

Although it came out to a hefty 34.95 per person, it was really worth it.  I highly recommend their set 4 course menu if you are not sure exactly what to get.  If not, go with the Dosa hands down.

Full bar and plenty of seating.

The atmosphere was really pleasant but the music was a bit too loud and was hard to hear during my conversations.  The servers/staff was very friendly.  I would highly recommend dosa and hopefully come back very soon.
author: Kameron K.

description:
I've always heard people talk about how awesome DOSA is and the first few times I went there I was very underwhelmed. However, yesterday's dining experience at DOSA has made me a DOSA fan!!

We shared -
-Rava Onion Dosa - The consistency of this dosa was just right - not too crispy and not too soft. There were enough onions and cilantro mixed in with the batter to add some extra crunch and flavor. 
-Paper Masala Dosa - Huge paper dosa that comes with potato masala, chutney, and sambhar. The masala tasted great with the dosa and was not too bland or oily. 
-South Indian Moons - 5 mini uttapums. These were good but not great. I think the paneer uttapum was the worst - the paneer did not even taste like paneer! 

I would definitely come back!
author: Geetanjali J.

description:
Dosa obviously has a huge following here in little 'ol San Fran, and I can see why.  It's some solid Indian food served in a nice but unpretentious setting.  The prices are extremely reasonable, the service is friendly, and the company... well, when you're hanging with friends, it's always all good. 

I enjoyed my samples of the huge cross section of dishes we ordered and served up family style.  The appetizers were very tasty, the paneer roti wrap was quite good, and the chick-pea stew drove me to seconds and thirds.  The highlight of the night for me (aside from my excellent dining companions) was the roti with potato and some form of sauce (also with potatoes).  Good stuff.  We indulged in the special, a whole fish marinated overnight in garlic then fried to a crispy blackish-brown. It was tasty and required some serious work to debone.  We did a damn fine job of getting a much meat as possible off that fish, eyeballs and all.  The meat was tender and amazing but the exterior had a somewhat burnt taste.

All in all, I was impressed but not blown away.  I enjoyed all of the dishes just fine, but felt they lacked some form of depth/complexity that I am used to in truly amazing Indian food.  Maybe I'm just not used to authentic southern Indian, I have never been there, so who knows?  I do believe that it's very, very solid food. Just not 5-star solid. 

The wine list also scores some stars, with a wide and diverse variety of red offerings in a very reasonably priced range.  We scored a pretty decent bottle of Malbec for somewhere in the $30's.

The desserts were again very good but not insanely good. The highlights of our spread were the little donut balls in syrup and the rice pudding in rose water. Those were both amazing. 

Would I go back? Absolutely. Should I go back? Probably. With so many 5-star reviews from so many of my trustworthy cohorts, I feel like maybe I missed something. I guess until then, I'll just have to guess...
author: Don B.

description:
I enjoyed my meal at Dosa, and definitely recommend it to others looking for great lndian food.

At first I was surprised at the entree prices -- $10-$12 for most of the dishes.  I guess given that most dishes are vegetarian, that makes sense.  Still, though, there's an opportunity to squeeze extra dollars from the meat eaters.

I ordered the paneer and peas dosa, which was extremely filling.  My partner ordered a dosa with a pound of potato in it;  she barely finished half.  Both dishes were very simple in terms of ingredients and seasoning, but we were also given three bowls with different sauces to try.  So, there was a lot of good stuff going on.
author: Bill H.

description:
At the end of a meeting marathon day, the last half of which was spent in a windowless, white room with the weakest coffee ever, I was so looking forward to a yummy dinner and a stiff drink to wash it all away.  

Dosa delivered in a big way.  I got the vegetarian slider appetizer and white truffle masala--and a square one dirty martini.  I was stuffed about halfway through the dosa.  

Beautiful chandeliers and graphic art on the walls--it'd definitely be a fun place for a date!
author: Lynn M.

description:
Went to Dosa last night after a few years, and it confirmed what I had previously thought.  Great ambiance and presentation, mediocre food.  Though I appreciate the thought, Indian food isn't about presentation.  It's about flavor!  I have never seen prettier Indian food in my life, but I have tasted much better.  And it's really expensive for what it is.  Here is the breakdown:

Dahi papdi chat: 2/5 - This tends to be one of my favorite chats.  It is usually loaded with delicious chutneys, tomatoes and onions, and is swimming in dahi (yogurt), so that every bite is flavor country.  Not so here.  It looked very artistic, but chat by its nature is meant to be messy.  There was not nearly enough dahi, chutney, tomatoes and onions.  We added our own to make it taste better.  Even still, it was far from the best papdi chat I've had.  

Fish pakoras: 3.5/5 - These were pretty good.  We got 5 large pakoras, which were fried and then crusted with something delicious.  They are served with garlic and onion chutneys.  Not going to lie, I didn't really care for the garlic chutney (use it sparingly), but the onion chutney was tasty.

Uttapam moon: 2.5/5 - This was a collection of 5 uttapams (small, savory latka-type pancakes, with a variety of ingredients cooked in... kind of like omelets but with no eggs), served with 2 different chutneys.  There was a tomato chutney and a chickpea chutney.  I thought most of the uttapams were just ok.  I really liked the onion one and the paneer one was decent, but the rest were mediocre.  You can get MUCH better Uttapam at Udupi Palace 1/2 a block away.

Chana Battura: 4/5 - The chana was tasty!  I am a huge fan of chana masala and Dosa's did not disappoint.  The batura was unfortunately over-cooked and had we not been in a hurry, we probably would have sent it back.  All in all, this was my favorite dish of the evening.

While Dosa is unsurpassed in its presentation, the attractiveness of its food comes at the expense of its flavor.  This might be fine for someone who is into blander foods or who doesn't have much experience with Indian food, but I don't think I would return to Dosa again anytime soon, except for for drinks.  The food is just meh and it is VERY expensive for what it is.  There's no need to go to Dosa when Udupi Palace less than 1/2 a block away.  The food there is MUCH better and it is WAY cheaper.
author: Julie S.

description: I was very happy and surprised to find such amazing Indian food in SF. Our party ordered a mix of curries, dosa, uttapam (South Indian Moons is a nice tasters choice), and poori, and everything was delicious. I highly recommend this place.
author: R. J.

description:
Try the meal combos they have each night, as unless you really know this cuisine you'll probably miss out on something interesting, and if you're into such either the wine flight or the beer flight to go with it. Then order a bhaturra to impress your dining companions (make sure to pop it while it's still hot!).  Also, keep all of the little sauce bowls they'll give you over the course of the meal (don't let them bus them away!), since you can revisit them with later dishes as well as with their original dish.

Gobs of fun.

Try to reserve if you can, particularly in the smaller Mission version versus the larger Fillmore outlet.
author: Michael F.

description: I can't thank Dosa enough for providing a special menu for people with food allergies! Every restaurant in the nation should follow this example. It is so appreciated and makes ones dining experience so much better. It allowed me to have a delicious meal and not feel sick from it ! I've not been able to enjoy Indian food in a long time until now. It made me so happy, thank you again and again !
author: Soul Surfer S.

description:
Go to Dosa to try the Dosa.

Say that five times fast.

Now actually go to this restaurant -- it's that good.  I had the cilantro mint masala dosa dish.  It had the perfect amount of spiciness and mintiness, and it all came together perfectly. The plate also comes with a couple of chutneys and a lentil dipping sauce.  The lentil dipping sauce is GREAT.  I would eat a bowl of that shit on my own.

The only bad thing I can say about this place is that it seems to be very popular. Even with a reservation, the they had us wait maybe ten minutes. Overall, this place is very good and definitely worth trekking over to the mission for.
author: David H.

description:
fabulous.
amazing for vegetarians and non-veg.
i loved the wine list.
i loved the food.
service was great.
ambiance was loud but i loved it.
bar was beautiful.
cocktails creative and delish.
author: K E.

description:
OVERALL:3.9   FOOD:4   SERVICE:4.5   AMBIANCE:4   VALUE:3

Fancy south Indian--definitely NOT your everyday chaat joint.  Interior & staff are well-groomed and attractive: brightly colored & dimly-lit walls, high ceilings, minimal decorative art, & at least one head of spellbinding dark curls.  Totally awesome that nobody batted an eyelash at our post-softball game scrubbiness--bonus points!

Food was delish, and as expected, on the pricey side compared to less manicured Indian spots.  We happened to stick to boring h2o, but the bar kept churning out lovely-looking mango lassis & other concoctions in pretty glasses.

TIPS:
*Sit at the bar to avoid waiting (full menu)...plus, it's more exciting to watch those dark curls...
*Try the Dahi Vada....it's gorgeous to look at & even better on the tongue!
*Unless you're absolutely dying for crepes, try the uttapam instead of the dosa (Masala was a winner, though I was tempted to steal my neighbor's South Indian Moons)...something like an omelet-naan-pizza with spicy coconutty dips--YUM!
author: Amy K.

description: The food was very tasty. The sambhar for the dosa was authentic, very close to the one that my mom makes. I had the Summer uttappam which was different from the traditional uttappams. The ingredients they used were American vegetables, like corn, caramelized onions etc. So it was a good fusion. A good place to go for a classy dinner.
author: Malathi R.

description:
Amazing Dosa's and really good ambience. 
I ordered the wada paav and dahi balle for appetizers. Both of it was excellent, especially the wada paavs. 
For main course I had the lamb kheema dosa and it was very well made. But my wife had the truffle dosa and it was one of the best dosa I've ever eaten. Even better than a few I had back in India.
author: Zeeshan P.

description: What a great experience. I love Indian food and this place offers a familiar yet different experience. Everything we ate had great flavor and the yelp reservation got us seated right away!
author: Doctor B.

description:
Really tasty. First time I ever had dosas before. Got the paper thin dosa & the uttapam sampler type plate of different uttapams. 

Not an ideal first date spot (In which my case thats where it was spent. Not my pick) However, the food was delicious. Those two plates shared was more than enough food, we were stuffed! 

I love that there's many vegetarian options too since I don't eat meat. Yum!
author: Natassia S.

description: Exquisite restaurant.  Dosa (best Indian restaurant in town). Went there to celebrate a family bday. With a party of 10 and with gluten, vegetarian, vegan, chicken only, prefer cocktails than just beers, and a complete chicken tikka masala snob, the menu delivered a fantastic meal for a family who truly has specific/discriminating tastes. Still looking  forward to go back and until then, I tell all my family and friends about Dosa. Thought I make it official and leave a note on Yelp! :)
author: E ..

description:
After looking at the menu at the Fillmore location numerous times, I finally ended up at the Valencia location...starving and ready to try some Dosa. 

The Dosa section of the menu has endlessly good options and lucky for me most of them are vegetarian. We tired the Spicy Mung Masala and the Rava Masala. Both were larger than I expected and very good. The Rava Masala was extra special with it's airy wheat bread. Each Dosa order comes with condiments for spreading and/or dipping and a cup of lentil soup. 

Sitting at the bar was a great way to spend a casual midday eating hearty food. The waitstaff was very chill and helped us choose a dark wheat beer that was fantastic...especially with the spicy flavors from the Dosa. 

Also would love to try the Fillmore location, but it's a pretty safe bet that I will be back on Valencia soon trying out some new dosas.
author: Theresa T.

description:
We went there for dinner last night and it was really nice! This place manages to strike just the right balance of upscale ambiance and tasty south Indian food. We ordered the vada sambar, carmelized onion uttapam and tamil lamb curry with dosa. Everything tasted authentic, even the coconut chutney! 
I also had the ginger ante, which had a refreshing gingery flavor. I would definitely go back.
author: Suri P.

description:
Nice date place!  It was relatively easy to get a reservation here on a Friday night despite being in the frenzy of all the Mission eateries.  The place had warm colors, good service, and a modern interior. 

The Masala dosa and the Lamb curry with the lemon rice was the perfect amount of food to accompany our bubbly and beer.  The lamb curry was really tasty!
author: Bonnie S.

description: Stopped in late yesterday when it opened for a quick potato dosa.  It was absolutely fabulous.  Great servers. Great food. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Stephen J.

description: All kinds of dosa and king fisher on tap, good food and service.
author: paul k.

description:
Since many excellent (and true) things have been said about Dosa I'll forgo further laudation and will instead make note of something that I didn't know before dining here. 

South Indian cuisine is heavily nut based. 

Yes, they have a special (limited) menu of dishes that are nut free, but if you're allergic, you may want to skip this culinary adventure.  My wife only at the nut free items, but nonetheless had a reaction...when there's that much around nut free dishes are bound to become tainted.

That being said, the food was excellent. The scallops especially were like AMAZING.
author: Nikke G.

description: I like the Valencia location better than Fillmore because it's less uppity. The dosas here are superb, namesake and all, but I didn't particularly like the one with the truffle oil. I come here every year for my birthday and it's so fun to share plates with good company for the big day :)
author: K M.

description: This place suck!  The food is okay but the experience was terrible. Me and my wife was visit Dosa for a starter and a main course, we order the starter and the main course at the same time wish shouldn't be a problem  but got the main course before we got our starter. The starter turned up five minutes in to the main course and before we even finished our main course the asked us for dessert.  When we kindly said that we where full they gave us the check in about 30 seconds and then they circled our table until we felt forced to leave. The funny part is that the guy who served us this evening prolly was the manager or the owner.... So if you are into paying too much money for an okay meal and you're in an hurry this place for you!
author: Fredrik A.

description:
So glad we decided to eat here. Made a reservation on open table about 3 hours before and had no problem when we got there.

The parking was tricky but that's not so much the restaurants fault as its a mission thing.

My boyfriend got the Chennai Chicken for an appetizer and said it tasted really good. I ordered the Chaat and thought it had a really good blend of flavors and textures. 

For our main course we decided to split the South Indian Moons Uttapam. It came with 5 patties, 2 chutneys and a lentil soup dip. Very tasty. 

For the desert we couldn't resist the chocolate mouse chili pie. It was sooo good. Definitely hit the sweet tooth spot we had brewing. 

Before we even left I commented on how much I wanted to come back. It was hard not to drool over the dishes everyone around us was getting. Everything looked sooo good. I just can't wait to come back and try something else!

Food plus 2 beers =60$
author: Tuesday C.

description: I usually get the Habanero dosa because I crave "punishment by spice".  Since my roots are from Kerala, I figured I'd order the Kerala Chicken Curry to mix things up (but spicy please!). It presented itself with a fair bit of spice and since I was asked if it was spicy enough for my liking I said I could take it to the next level. They obliged; I left happy (ulcers may follow), but that's not to worry about now.
author: Vivek N.

description: I've always enjoyed Dosa and I've been going for a few years now. I had dinner and drinks with friends here last week. The restaurant has a cozy and intimate feel but yet has a bit of swank for a night out. I had Mango is the new black cocktail and it was refreshing and delicious. We mostly shared everything and we ordered a lot. We had this amazing cheese bread that I can't remember the name of, but it was amazing. I ordered the chicken curry with coconut rice. Sooo good! We also shared the spicy scallops and a salad. Overall everything was delicious and the waiters were knowledgeable and helpful. Love this place!
author: Heather H.

description:
A very nice place, especially if you go at a time when it's not filled to the brim with people.   The atmosphere and service is clean or cleaner than other Indian places.

It also helps if the waitress is extra smiling and talkative to you because she recognizes you. 

Food is good, I have no complaint of the paneer dosa , of the .. forgot what was the name, the platter with little things on it..   

However if I am sure, that I saw a separate charge for the SF Health Tax on the bill, I am probably not coming again.  They should just incorporate the charge it in the price of a dish.
author: Jordan G.

description: Finally stopped in for the first time after 8 years of walking by. Really good, wish I would have checked it out earlier. The prices are a little inflated but the service and food made up for it. Will definitely go back.
author: Lenny K.

description:
Pancakes with green peas and curried potatoes done 15 ways comingled with pretentious service is just not my cup of mango lassee.

Some of the side dishes and chutneys were quite good; thayir sadaam was creamy and smooth, lentil-tomato soup flavorful, and the chick peas spicy and hearty.  However, if silver dollar pancakes sprinkled with green peas and crepes filled with potato are the essential entrees of "south indian" cuisine, then I am perfectly happy sticking with the north indian dishes of Indian Oven on Fillmore.  The service was just fair - the waitress showing a visibly snarky attitude when asked what the spring dosa consisted of and if they served raitha - and the noise level high.  Although the primary burnt orange wall paint, warm and aesthetic, resembled some of the hues of traditional indian sauces themselves, an attempt to create a sleek, modern alternative to the customary exotic decor of more traditional indian restaurants comes off as excessively stark and forced.
author: Rick H.

description:
Thought this place was great.  I had never eaten a dosa before, and it was really good-  interesting flavors and textures.  Quite tasty.  We also had some curry vegetable dish with coconut rice and I thought it was great.  

One note-  definitely make a reservation- that place is always busy.
author: Sarah G.

description: I was so disappointed in Dosa. We ordered a cocktail that took 40 minutes to get to our table. Finally, I had to cancel it because I wanted wine with my dinner. When they brought me my wine about 10 minutes later I was surprised that no one even said sorry to me. Just a quick apology would have made it a little bit better, but that may just be the way they do service there. We were not that impressed with the food, we've had way better for way cheaper. The ambiance was cool and hip but that's about it. The drinks looked good, but I couldn't get my hands on one!
author: Shanae M.

description:
As a south indian who flinches at the thought of fusion food I refused to visit Dosa on principle for almost 2 years until a friend pretty much dragged me here. I have to thank her, for now I'm a believer!

For starters, this place gets their blends just right. I believe I can make a pretty good Sambar myself, so I'm pretty confident in stating that this restaurant has the best Sambar among all the south indian ones that I have tried (I'm looking at you, Saravana Bhavan!), including the ones in South Bay. The same goes for their Chhole. The coconut chutney was the only sauce I could find fault with.

Their namesake dish. Its hella overpriced, but done very right. These guys are the only ones that use Ghee to make dosa, as opposed to every other restaurant that uses plain old Oil. And does it make a difference!

I've seen a lot of the new-fangled fusion restaurants that fall flat as they dont have their basics right. This place does! Their basic food items are authentic, tasty, and done right. And so their fusion offerings are pleasure to eat as well.

I liked the ambience and their service as well. Would I recommend? Hell, I've taken so many visiting out-of-towners there I should get a frequent customer card!
author: Vinay K.

description: Amazing, worth every penny.  The beet and pumpkin soup was particularly delicious - deep red, complex flavors. I also loved the spicy mung dosa and enjoyed the chicken korma.  The house-made coconut sorbet was another unexpected delight.  This place is a must-go.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
This place is both classy and tasty! 
My husband and I came here on Friday night. Good thing we made reservations! We got seated right away but this place got way packed and very loud. 

Our waitress was extremely helpful - she first asked us if we experienced South Indian food and then explained the difference between the Northern tradition (e.g. chicken tiki masa, etc) and what they were serving - the Dosa. Service is super great, friendly, and helpful, and this place is trendy and great for bringing out of town guests. (especially if they haven't tried South Indian food yet.

We started with the Chennai Chicken appetizer which came with some yummy yogurt and other dippings. It's good, but best in groups if you're trying a variety of things and not just this semi heavy dish.

We also ordered the Tamil Lamb Curry which was deeeelicious! Very tender meat in a yummy sauce.

And of course we ordered Dosa. At the waitress's recommendation we ordered the basic Masala Dosa (cuz we were beginners) and this was SOOO Tasty. The crepe is lightly crisp on the outside and soft doughy on the inside - although this was my first time experiencing dosa, this was my husband's second time and he loved it! Even if you've never had dosa before, this will be a mad tasty experience! The creamy spiced potatoes inside were really yummy and all the dipping sauces were soooo good, especially the coconut. 

Awesome place to eat!
author: Cecilia T.

description:
DC, TC, TL and I FINALLY made it around to Dosa after a few failed attempts.

AMBIANCE: The space was a lot bigger than I thought it would be (SOMEONE described it as gasping-for-air-TINY... they were mistaken), with high ceilings and fairly spaced out tables. I noticed some people were unlucky enough to be squeezed four to one tiny table, but it didn't seem to bother them.

SERVICE: iffy. Sometimes I felt ignored (like when we wanted to order, but couldn't find our waitress) and sometimes I felt like a queen (the busboys were pretty good about keeping water glasses filled and taking away plates).

FOOD: So much DAT gluttony! Dosa offers a four course DAT menu for $35... it was a lot more food than any of us were expecting. What I would order again and also what I would avoid at all cost:

Appetizer:
- ORDER - Chennai chicken: tender, juicy, with a spicy kick, these were yummy dipped in the yogurt sauce
- AVOID - Lentil patty: This wasn't just swimming in yogurt sauce-- it was DROWNING. No thank you.

Dosa:
- ORDER: Spring dosa: I loved the combination of dosa and veggies. It was oddly light and refreshing. I would choose this over any of the other dosas (we tried masala chutney, paneer + peas, and the uttapaam, which reminded me of a Korean seafood pancake)

Entree:
- ORDER: Tamil lamb or chicken curry: both were delicious and extra savory. The lamb was tender and had no hint of gameyness (probably because it was covered in spice!)

Dessert:
- ORDER: Chocolate chai gelato: I'm sure any of their gelatos/sorbets would have been fine. If you MUST order dessert, go with one of these because...
- AVOID: Gulab jamoon: I've learned from previous encounters that Indian sweets are SWEET. Tooth-achingly-practically-inedible SWEET. So I definitely avoided this particular dessert when it came time to choose. Maybe I wasn't firm enough in my description of the Indian idea of dessert, but all three of my dining companions decided to order this dessert (because they wanted to declare their love of balls?)... and probably bitterly regretted their choice. I don't think anyone finished even one third of one ball. 

OVERALL: If Dosa wasn't a 40min drive from me (and if I didn't have to prowl for parking in the Mission) I would probably come by to try a few more of their dosas and their bhatura. Unfortunately that's not the case, so... it was nice to try, but I don't think I can maintain a LTR.
author: Susanna W.

description: Terrible dining experience; a combination of way-too-spicy food (tried multiple dishes... Chef must be deaf to people's comments re. the level of heat in the food), and the I-hate-my-job waitress who could not care less about customer service and satisfaction. The cocktails were the only good thing about our dining experience at this place, but that's not enough to bring us back.
author: Giovanni G.

description: We wanted to eat some nice south indian food on our anniversary but ambience was also on our mind because of the event. We loved everything about this place ( food , service, ambience). Madras coffee was soo authentic in taste that I couldn't control myself from ordering 2 more. The girl serving us was so sweet that she gave the add on coffee for free :) !! Loved this place!!
author: Chin C.

description:
Came here on a Friday night & the wait was unbelievable. Oh well. I was with my friend & we were having a good time chatting while waiting. We ordered the spring onion Dosa & it was massive. it was good, not memorable. We also ordered the vegetarian curry which came w/ a huge airy bread loaf to dip into the curry. It was divine! 

The ambiance was very taste full & modern. Our server was busy & pleasant. The hostess was non stop & very nice. Overall, a great experience.
author: Ashlee F.

description: Went on a Friday around 10:45 pm. Got great mixed drinks, a huge egg dosa that we completely polished off, and a stone fruit salad. But the best was the delicious panna cotta. Extra points for how late it was open.
author: Maria C.

description: Good food and great service. They let our group take our time without pressure. And, when we left something behind, the hostess called repeatedly until she tracked us down. I'll be back!
author: Cheryl P.

description:
A culinary adventure!

I have a ton of experience with the run-of-the-mill Indian spots with your basic Naans, tandooris, and tikkas. So I was surprised to find the menu at Dosa was...well...full of dosas. Okay, I'm a little dim.

As a South Indian newbie, I decided to try the "South Indian Moons" a selection of 5 uttapams (circular breads with veggies baked in). I really liked it - something totally new - but tasty, spicy, and filling.

The decor is on par with most of the medium to high-end Mission restaurants, certainly date-worthy. However, they don't take reservations (for small parties), which means if you don't have some time to burn standing in line you might have to pick a different spot.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Service was horrible. It was one of those meals where you are never sure who is taking care of you. Waited a long time before someone came to our table. A different server took over later and never brought us free papadums that other tables received. Then, he seemed to forget about us again. Food came out all at once and the poori and rice were cold before they remembered to bring us dishes to eat from. Sadly, we ate here a month earlier and we're delighted by the service and food. Well, in SF you never have a lack of alternatives.
author: Steve A.

description:
Great place for south Indian dinner.  I had the classic masala dosa, and it was excellent.  They definitely toned down the spices for the American crowd, so if you want it hot, be sure to ask.  

Although Indian dosa's are huge, they shrink them down a bit to fit on the smaller tables and to be manageable for one person.  If you take a group of people however, they will make some huge dosa's for your table.

We made reservations and were seated promptly on time on a Saturday night.
author: Anshu A.

description:
I can't believe I didn't immediately review Dosa after eating there.  I had wanted to eat at Dosa for months.  And I was not dissapointed in the least after my experience.  From the friendly hostess, bubbly at the bar, super server - who explained everything so well and made great recommendations, to the incredibly nice couple seated next to us who were experts in dosa-eating.   Each of our choices were amazingly delicious - so full of flavor.  I was ready to come back for more before the meal was even completed.

I got dosed at Dosa and I can't wait to do it again!
author: Mac M.

description:
I really like Dosa and find it to be a reliable place whenever I'm craving Indian food. They are pretty professional and friendly - every time I make a reservation they'll call to confirm the reservation and I've never had to wait for my table to be ready. Would definitely recommend making reservations here, especially for dinner.

I'm a huge fan of their dosas - especially their masala dosa. I also love their naan, and the Chennai chicken. Their cocktails are also really really tasty.

The only reason I'm giving it a 4/5 and not a 5/5 is the ambiance. It might just be a summer thing, but I've found it to be quite hot and loud lately. Out last time there I was pretty ready to head out when we were done with our meal for this reason. That said, the food is great and very consistent!
author: Ana M.

description:
Great application of small space.  The use of spice and sauce to compliment the meats is perfect.  Great service- a little aloof with attitude-maybe the server was overwhelmed.
Great wine selection to enhance the delicious meal.  
Take a date and explore the flavors of different dishes.
author: Robert L.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the Mission. 

Been here several times, after it was recommended by a group of Indian friends who described it as "authentic" southern Indian cuisine. Very different from all the traditional americanized Indian food you generally find around. 

Good choice for mixed veggie/non veggie groups, they have good selection of lamb and chicken plates. The Dosas are the signature plates, but the menu is a lot richer and if you want to pay a bit more (~30 bucks) their entrees are superb.

On Mondays they have Indian street food (enjoy them with your fingers) appetizers. They're great and very very interesting. Better make a reservation, they are generally packed.
author: Riccardo C.

description:
I wasn't impressed. 

I went for the Dine about week.  I had Chicken Masala, Lam, etc, 
Not that I know how exactly these things supposed to  taste like, but they were all sort of "OFF".  None of  what I had was flavorful enough.  

For the price they charge.... and competitive neighborhood, I expected a lot better food than they offer. 

It's not horrible. Not worth the horrible parking and the price tag for sure.
author: A O.

description:
We went there a few days ago. Ordered a lot of dishes and all them were amazing. Started off with medu vada sambar which was very tasty. Probably the best in this part of the city!

The main course included paper masala dosa, chilli uttapam and a sada disa. All these came with an assortment of chutneys( green and red) and hit spicy sambar. Took a mango lassi on the side, which was almost as good as the main course.The meal was great and qualifies completely for the five star review.

The place is generally full and inspire of the long waiting time, I would totally recommend this. The dosa at the end of the wait makes the wait worth while!
author: HCfoodler C.

description: Again... I am lost for words and so spoiled for choice in this city. DOSA, both on Valencia and Fillmore, just is the place to enjoy good southern Indian dishes, good company, good wine and not to mention the cocktails. If you are like me who like to host and entertain visiting friends who share the common love for southern Indian dishes, DOSA is the place to take them to and to be seen! I hate it when so-called food reviewers ridicule with harsh words -- truth is no place is 100% perfect, no service is super duper excellent because this is a restaurant/bar and not a massage parlor! I can tell you the waiters at DOSA both at Valencia and Fillmore, have always been attentive, kind, and good to me and my guests or my dinner companion. The service they give is unrushed, unforced but natural. Yes they never bring a big fan to fan us while we look at the menu! But they treat us like how they want to be treated. If you have a bad experience here, I am sorry. Sometimes I like to see a waiter disrespecting a customer for disrespecting him! Yes it is a two way thing! You as a customer must respect your waiter if you want him or others to respect you! I am lucky, I've always been treated and respected well here. Let me take this opportunity to remind diners that the service here is good, and the atmosphere and the flavors here are truly modern classical southern Indian -- the dishes are the reasons why we Indian food lovers eat here and tip our waiters well. Now to the tart -- its Black Mission Fig Tart is its newest star for me and worth getting another mention this week -- it is pretty epic! Definitely deserving my double thumbs up. Definitely a date-night desert after a delicious meal for two.
author: Ambrose A.

description:
I had to say my return visit to Dosa on Valencia was stellar.  It was crowded and I thought there would be no way we would be able to eat there.  Luckily eating at the bar was perfect and a corner location that helped me to see my dinner mate.  

I was recently at Dosa on Fillmore and had a great experience there and I am here to report that was so a mirror image at Dosa on Valencia.  The bartender made great drink recommendations--honed in on what I was seeking and made a gorgeously spice drink with the perfect amount of gin and a hint of coconut milk.

All cylinders were firing properly.  Service, kitchen and overall feel of the environment.  The very spicy and gorgeous Dosa was stunning--potato and sweet pepper.  I look forward to a return very soon.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Nothing makes me happier than delicious, affordable food and great service so this is why Dosa is my new favorite restaurant. I went there with a group of friends and Dosa got rave reviews all around. 

The space is casual and inviting. The hostesses were gracious and seated us promptly. We started off with a round of cocktails. I had the mango one and it was one of the best cocktails that I've ever had. My friends got the lychee ones which were also addictive. 

Our server was attentive and helpful. Most of us were novices to South Indian food so she made some good recommendations which were appreciated. We ordered the dahi vada, chatni masala dosa, various uttapams, the prawn coconut curry and the pepper chicken curry.

Everything was great! I will definitely be coming back to Dosa again - soon!
author: Amy C.

description:
I was super excited to try this place with my favorite people following my bridal shower. My family was in town, and my husband-to-be and I had spent the weekend shuttling them around giving them a taste of SFs finest restaurants. Finally it was my choice: A mellow family dinner at a hip urban locale! Plus the price was right, since we'd be treating all weekend and funds were running low.

I just had the most fun bridal shower ever and I selected Dosa as the finale to the evening based on yelper, Todo, and many other recommendations (like BFF Sharon M). I thought it was the perfect choice because of its convenient mission locale (good for people coming from all areas of the city) and it was good for my vegetarian family (so many options!), also because some of my family is always riding me about trying more spicy foods (they are basque after all) and I figured Indian food has a lot of nice spices. Little did I know these members of my family were really anti on the Indian food, so the dinner ended up being a total mess. Mostly because it's impossible for them to keep opinions to themselves and let everyone else enjoy. Sigh, but you know fam...you still love 'em.

I was a bit annoyed starting off because we had a reservation, that I made months in advance, and we still waited quite a bit for our table. Also, the staff wasn't the friendlist, but neither were my guests so I would give them another shot (as I did with my guests!) 

Dosa doesn't have just spicy curries. Which works out good for me because my gastroenterologist would not be pleased seeing my family history and all. I asked them what I could have that wouldn't be spicy and they selected a few items for me. Namely, the Dosas are what you should be ordering (hence the name). The fam on the other hand, ordered some of the spiciest dishes available and were visibly...and verbally... unhappy.  They ended up drinking too much and getting sick. I ended up getting sick from the all tension and the staff wasn't too good about rectifying the situation, they mostly threw up their hands, which was annoying because their recommendations for me were so on par. 

The Dosa I had was really yummy, but it was so hard to enjoy.  I'm big on second chances, I can't base my whole opinion on this one off night, so I'm going to go back, especially for the brunches everyone raves about, but I won't go back with a group, it's just not the right setting.

UPDATE: Came back for brunch with my husband, Sharon M, and Ian M and were very impressed. I think it was just an off night that we went there (mostly due to the people I was with). We enjoyed a non-vegetarian curry, the masala dosa, and the eggplant dosa. Nothing was spicy for weak little me! We also had these yummy things sharon and ian picked that you can only get at lunch and my husband used the words "heck yes!"
author: Nikki M.

description: I know it's unfair to compare this to getting dosas in india, but even growing up with indian friends its no mistake that this place is overcharging for what you get. indian ingredients aren't that expensive so i don't know why i still walked out of here 40 dollars lighter.
author: John B.

description: Service was great. Small place though...crowdy and very loud. Food was good but could be better in my opinion.
author: Kay Y.

description:
I have such a love/hate relationship with this place.  on one hand, it's pretty decent food.  on another, it's trendiness makes me want to vomit.  I've been several times now though.  I've never disliked something i've eaten here, and god knows it's better than udupi. (they've brought a scourge upon their namesake. but this isn't about the flavorless restaurant a couple of doors down). 

My favorite thing i've had there is this Dosa with chili, cilantro, and potato.  If you like really spicy food (along the lines of spicy food challenge spicy) go for the Mango Habanero Dosa.  I went on a friday once, and had the special for the day which was this fish curry.  and an entire fish came out..  (a very expensive, delicious entire fish).    

Their salt lassi is delicious.  the one time i've had a cocktail there it was pretty good.  So really.. my one dislike is the "we take our trendiness too seriously  despite our name being Indian street food"
author: Kamla K.

description:
Food was all right... 

I just think that if they are going to be named "Dosa," then their dosas better be on point delicious! See, I had trouble with that concept because, no, I don't think they are very good :(. 

If you are a vegetarian, then, by all means TRY this place out! I'm sure you'll love it. BUT...if you are a well seasoned restaurateur carnivore kinda gal like myself, you will more than likely be disappointed with their dosa mush (to say the least). 

I'm sad to say that I disagree with the hundreds of Dosa lovers on this Yelp page. I've definitely, definitely, had better.
author: Jasmin W.

description:
I want to eat dinner here every night for the rest of my life.

The food:
We got the chickpea curry with poori (fried dough!) and the super-spicy mango-habanero dosa with a side of coconut rice. Thank god I happened to order the coconut rice because I don't know if I could have handled the heat of my dosa without it. Everything was really delicious.

The experience:
Our service was perfect. The decor and atmosphere is great. The bathroom is a little hidden, but two busboys (buspersons?) showed me the way. I was happily surprised to find that the bathroom has tissues!

The cost:
We didn't get drinks, and our bill came out to $30 for the two of us. I think that was pretty reasonable for the high quality of the food and the experience. Unfortunately, until I get my employment on, I can't afford to eat here daily. But I'll be back soon.

The list:
I was disappointed to find out that the vegetarian slider is not vegan and can't be made vegan, but it turned out for the best since the entrees were more than enough food for us. The server impressed me by quickly checking on that and bringing us a special list of their menu items that shows which do and don't contain dairy and eggs. I wish every restaurant had that!
author: Charlie F.

description:
Had a wonderful time here with a girlfriend I was visiting. It was Saturday night and we couldn't find anywhere to eat without a 1.5 hr. wait, but we could sit at the bar and get a good view of the whole of Dosa without waiting a minute. That's not to say it wasn't busy...it was. The staff were friendly, the bartender, Ruben, cute and flirty, suggesting dishes and chatting us up :) 

The food was so good: calamari appetizer was spectacular, the persimmon salad was not, but that's probably because I just thought it was too sweet...my friend loved it. We shared a pea and farm cheese dosa. Delish. And we were totally full after only that amount of food! (could've been the beer though...)
author: Valentina V.

description:
Ate here after seeing Dan Hoyle at the Marsh down the street

We had the spicy lentil soup rasam ( loved it) and the lamb shami kebabs (so flavorful), we didn't get the chatni dosa we ordered, but the potato plain one, which was ok, and then we also got the curry veg bhatura, which was mostly potatoes

We ordered one glass of wine, and the portion was so skimpy, did not order a second glass--

Our meal was too potato heavy, but we really liked the first two dishes and will be back
author: Foodlover B.

description:
FLAVOR FEST!!! The sauces and spices are what make this place. I had the Avocado and peach salad with pumpkin seeds ($9). The flavors blended really well and the lettuce was crisp and crunchy. I also had the Masala Dosa ($10) which is a potato mixture in a dosa, which is like a crepe.Very filling and flavorful.

I ordered to go, so I enjoyed all this deliciousness in the comfort of my own home. However, the atmosphere of the place is very nice, a little upscale for The Mission, but conducive to a really nice night out (date night).
author: Shira O.

description:
My loverman made reservations here for 8:15.  We were surprised we were able to get reservations the same day. I gave myself plenty of time to get there because I figured it would take me forever to figure out how to walk there from 24th Street Bart. I ended up being an hour early. 

My loverman met up with me and he went inside and asked if there was a way we could get seated early. I'm not sure but I think we did end up getting seated earlier. Neither of us were very hungry so my loverman asked if we could split the tasting menu but our waiter told us we couldn't because the menu was designed for only one person. We considered ordering two of the tasting menus but ultimately decided against it. I ended up ordering the Spring Dosa and he ordered the Egg Dosa with Cheese. We were then served a plate of chips or something. They were obviously deep fried so I didn't go near them. 

I'm always surprised at how fast service is at Indian restaurants. My Spring Dosa was freaking huge. It was cut into three pieces while my lovermans was just one gigantic wrap. I didn't really like any of the sauces it came with. The white one looked super fatty and I didn't even want to try it but I did at the request of my loverman. I really liked the Dosa and all the veggies looked really fresh. At one point a woman walked by and  asked me if what I was eating was the Dosa and I said yeah and she goes "Oh I should've gotten that." Haha. 

I finished 2/3s of it and I was completely stuffed. I hate taking food home and I usually finish everything on my plate but I would've literally burst if I tried. I went to the bathroom at that point. When I came out, I had no idea how to exit. I looked behind both the curtains which both led to some type of storage area. I decided I would just wait for the person in the other bathroom to come out and follow them out but they never came out! It literally took me almost a good 10 minutes to figure out how to leave. Haha. It ended up being the door at the left. 

When I got back to my table, my loverman told me he asked them to bring us the dessert menu. Tiffany! Van always has room for dessert. Not in this case though. I didn't even bother looking at the dessert menu.
